Everyone was very good about wearing masks and there were plenty of area's to wash your hands or use sanitizer. Several of the rides have restricted seating size, so if you're over weight by much you can't fit into the seats. They have sample seats outside the rides but I was too embarrassed to try one out with others watching. I felt that charging $25 PLUS TAX to park was ridiculous considering the cost of a days' ticket! In conclusion, at the age of 64, handicapped and overweight, our theme park days are over with and better left to young, healthy and weight appropriate people. I'm glad I enjoyed them in my younger years.

We have spent several days at Disney Parks and decided to venture to Universal Studios CityWalk for dinner despite what we had read online about lack of safety procedures. Here is the truth: universal studios definitely attracts a lower class of people who have utter disregard for others. For every 5 people we saw there was either a person or group without a face covering or had their face covering under their nose or under their chin. They all were constantly in movement and not stationary while eating or drinking. No one follows physical distancing guidelines.  Security guards constantly passed pwople without masks on and ignored them. We saw many security guards gathered in groups completwlt ignoring what was going on around them.  We had a great experience outside on the patio at Margaritaville. Once actually seated (not while in line) they take a pandemic seriously.  Needless to say - the reviews we read were generous. If you take your health seriously at all and actually care about the possibility that you could be carrying something that could hurt others, do NOT go to Univeral Florida! After 1 short evening at CityWalk we will NOT be buying tickets to this theme park until long after the pandemic is over. Sad as this was one of our favorite places to visit.  If you want to get out safely, go to Disney. Step it up Universal - this is extremely unresponsible.

I have planned some fantastic, fabulous vacations in my time. I like to do things myself because, frankly, I don't trust others. I HATE having to always find someone to ask. I feel like I'm wasting my time. This vacation was the lowest of the low for us. It was the most frustrating and disappointing vacation we have ever taken!  First, the good. The staff is phenomenal! Almost everyone we talked to was super helpful and friendly. The staff at the hotel (Lowes Royal Pacific) was the absolute best people to work with! We drove 15 hours to get there and arrived late Sunday night. We checked into our room at 10:30, unpacked, relaxed a few minutes, and went to bed. Thankfully I was the only one who noticed the toilet tank emptying and refilling every 30 minutes, but it kept me up all night long. I wrote to the hotel staff (they use text messaging as well as calls) and they had someone in to look at it within 20 minutes. The gentleman worked on it and left. This caused the toilet to do this every 5-8 minutes, so I wrote back. Same guy came back and said he had a few more pieces he could replace, but wasn't sure what was causing it. We went to the pool while he finished working. I got back in the room and found it was now doing this every 45 seconds! Writing again the gal asked if I'd like to change rooms. It was 9:30 PM and I said only if it was close by, as we had unpacked. She found us a room down the hall and we were moved in an hour. She, by no prompt from me, comped the parking fee (more on this later) ($125) for the inconvenience. Wonderful customer service!  I also want to point out specifically the staff in Volcano Bay. They are phenomenal and I highly recommend getting a cabana if you are going to be there all day. We had excellent service and their set-up is fantastic! Our lunch was brought to us and we had a personal attendant who made sure we always had towels and water. You also get a fruit/pastry basket, which was really nice.  The rides are all pretty fun. We rode almost every ride, the only 2 being the one we were not allowed to (Pteranadon Flyers), Popeye's Raging Rapids (a water ride and we didn't want to get wet), and the one that wasn't open when we got there (Woody Woodpecker). Most of their rides are very derivative of all the others. They are mostly 3D/4D with lots of spinning motion. Not a lot of variety on type of ride, but each ride has its own theme and more were pretty cool once. Hagrid's Motorbike ride was extremely enjoyable and innovative! It is one of the few rides anywhere worth the wait in line.  Now to the bad points. Do NOT under any circumstances purchase a vacation package unless you are prepared to not get what you paid for. We purchased this package in February. What we were told we were getting was an hour early park admission to Harry Potter Land and Volcano Bay. I looked at the website and everything indicated that it was an hour early into BOTH Harry Potter parks. We get there and I was told we are only getting an hour into Island of Adventure Harry Potter and Universal Studios Harry Potter is only an hour early on weekends. (What!?!) Plus, the hour early into Islands coincides with the opening time of Universal, so you actually lose an hour in that park if you want to try to get on Hagrid's Magical Motorbike (the only ride without fast pass capabilities) early as the line gets really long. Not only that, we went to Islands and Universal for 3 days and 2 of those days Hagrid's was delayed for an hour or more during early admission, so actually getting in early had no benefit what-so-ever.  The other thing that is on my ticket email that we purchased was an hour early in Volcano Bay. When we got there we were informed that we only got 30 minutes early. As far as I am concerned, this is illegal as we purchased something from them and they did not give it to us. I called their customer service to complain and he said, "we are unfortunately unable to open Volcano Bay just for you." I told him I wasn't calling for that. I want part of my money refunded as they sold me something they had no intention of providing! He was very condescending as he told me he understood how I felt, but he could do nothing. I was on the phone with him for 15-ish minutes to just have him be condescending and very unhelpful. I gave up and tried to enjoy my day.  When we purchased this package there was a clause about a possible parking fee, but nothing more than that. No number to check and no indication that people actually staying in the hotel will be charged a fee. I honestly thought if you didn't stay in a hotel you were charged, but if you did stay you were not. I get there to find out there is a $20+ a night charge and it will be another $125 for us to stay there. Why couldn't they just put that on the package online? It is extremely expensive to do this and after driving 15 hours, we aren't going to say never mind, we want a refund. I feel this is dishonest on Universal's part. They hide fees and know you'll pay them anyway when you get there. Yes, ours was taken off our bill, but that was because our room had a problem. It still seems unethical.  My last complaint was that we showed up for the early admission wanting breakfast at the Three Broomsticks, because their menu has a breakfast section. None of us ate due to this. We get there and it's not open. I ask a vendor on the "street" about it and she tells me breakfast is suspended at this time. There was no indication of that anywhere online or on their app (which everyone says to use)! I realize the app says to check times, but I would never have guessed they would up and decide not to serve breakfast at all. We had to wait until 10AM to get out of the Harry Potter part to find something to feed my children. I acknowledge that this is partly my fault, as I did not ask anyone and I should have, but like I said before, I hate not being able to plan vacations all by myself! There is no reason their app could not have been updated to indicate this or that an email couldn't have been sent to me saying all these changes they had made. The technology is out there.  The other technology flaw they have is for eating in restaurants in park. They want you to link a credit card to the app on your phone to order and pay that way. We do not link our credit cards or any banking information to our phones for privacy reasons and in case they were to get lost or stolen. Plus, we used gift cards to help control how much we spent. We went to eat at the Leaky Cauldron and sat for 10 minutes with no one coming to our table. I got up to go ask, as I knew I had to go to the register to order. I was told to go back to the table and do it on the app. I had to explain over and over again at every restaurant we ate that we were not doing that and I needed to go to the register. Most places were cool with it, but the Leaky Cauldron servers acted like I was crazy. It was frustrating to have to explain to everyone working what we needed as they pushed the pay by app on us everywhere we went.  We will never go back and my suggestion to anyone reading this is to not buy a vacation package or be prepared to be disappointed. Stay off site and buy tickets because you aren't going to get what Universal sells to you once you get there. Their customer service number is pointless, they use false advertising, and their technology is very unhelpful. I really wish I could say we got more out of this for what we paid. It was super frustrating and not very restful for the adults dealing with it all. Yes, I've been to Disney and they know how to take care of you so you have no worries and we got everything we paid for!

Even though Florida lifted restrictions. Universal did not. Mask at all times even outside in 90 degree weather They hassle you if it’s not over your nose. Lines r long from not filling rides. Most restaurants r closed so it takes hour for food. Good luck if you wanna eat inside in air conditioning. Website aside they closed at 9 but they closed at 7. I won’t be back as long as they’re trying to be politically correct!!!!

My husband & I visit Universal every year. This year we were excited as we've purchased tickets in advance and planned to both have the day off. but we don't have a smart phone. Without a smartphone there are issues eating in the restaurants and going on ride because we are unable to virtual cue anything. Tried to ask this question on your website but there is no link to e-mail. We always have a super time visiting Universal Studios. This year was a disappointment. Next time we will consider spending our money somewhere else. Thanks for nothing.
Get to Hogsmead and Three Broomstick early and I highly recommend the Fast pass will save a long of time in line

Without the fast pass don’t plan on riding any of the premier rides. We went yesterday and were only able to ride one ride. Plan on around $400 per person if you are not staying at a universal hotel. Go ahead and get the fast pass if you want to ride. If you just want to go play and enjoy the park you don’t need one.  Instead of requiring fast passes to do anything, why don’t you just start charging people $400 each and limit the number of people you allow in so everyone can enjoy? That way people can budget and be prepared?  I will remember this next time for sure and get fast passes ahead of time.
It was a great experience with 5 teenagers on a birthday trip. The lines weren't too long and food lines were moving as well. Lots of areas to tests and take masks off and lot of sanitizing

Comparing to LA Universal - this one is close to nothing. 1. Ticket is either one of the parks, if you pick one the other is not letting you in. 2. Minions virtual line never has any spots 3. Lines for food 4. Realistic picture: It is just narrows down to three shows during the day and is was $700 for four people. $700 for three tiny 12-min shows and multiple hours in lines.  Totally regret

Below is an email that i wrote to the guest services of universal and am sharing with you:  I must tell you about an experience at your park today that has been completely mishandled and is the single reason our family will not be purchasing the remaining 4 annual passes we planned to and may never visit again. My mother and son visited yestersay with their annual passes and endured the day of standing in line regularly, as my mother is a proud person. However, I had made sure she had all the paperwork for her disability. Including her handicap plaque and doctors information regarding her degenerative joint disease. Extended periods of walking and standing causes joint swelling to the point of not being able to walk. This morning, I advised her to put her pride aside and go speak to guest services regarding an assistance pass. She did and was advised to get a wheelchair instead. She was embarrassed and crying so when they offered her a manual wheelchair, she took it and was unable to even use it, so instead a women with an aleady debilitating disease was pushing around her own wheelchair. This is unacceptable. I called guest services after they had been in line for over an hour for one ride because my mom was crying in pain and i wanted to know how to advise her to get the assistance she needed. The guest service person told me since she had been standinh in line for over an hour, it was obvious she could stand in line qnd they accommodated her as much as they could. He then asked me to explain why it was medically an issue, which goes against the hiipa laws and i explained it. He said she would need to go to guest services and explain it and if they could do anything, they would decide. I asked to speak with a supervisor bc after almost 5 hours in the park, they want to leave and i wanted to assist them any way I could by perhaps granting them a few express passes so their last day was somewhat salvageable. Since they are annual pass holders, my mom was saying she did not believe they would ever return and I also wanted to discuss if we could reverse their pass to a 2 day pass and be done with universal. We gave up our Disney passes for all 6 of our family members bc we felt we were at the age with the kids to enjoy universal , but are now very sure we made a huge mistake and I needed to discuss this with them. Her plan is to leave the park asap and never come back, but I have asked her to stop at guest services to try and speak with a manager . She stated she is humiliated enough already and I am 3 hours away and can not do anything. I felt it was important that someone understand exactly what happened, and I will be posting this everywhere I can bc anyone whose family suffers needs to know this story and be aware . I was also told via guest services that there is no sort of disability pass bc ppl have different disabilities and each person would have to explain theirs (which my mother did and provided proof

I’ve been an annual pass holder before- I was so disappointed this trip. Some rides are by virtual reservation only. Good luck getting one of those. They are only available on the app which just clocks until it says “check back at another time”. Not sure what the cost of my ticket paid for. The rules are insane. I was sitting in a restaurant and our table was next to the bar, yet my husband had to go outside in the sun and wait in a line outside the restaurant to just come back inside to get us a beer. They wouldn’t give him mine either even though I sent my ID with him and there was a sign saying 1 drink per ID. Now as we sit eating the fries we were forced to order or leave, patrons are 3 deep in front of the same bar. It’s like employees have carte blanche here. Also, I was harassed about my mask not being on in 100 degrees while I was trying to drink one of my $5 waters. It used to be so fun to come here. What a revelation.
Everything was wonderfull. Great service, bathrooms clean, 5 star atractions. Great food and restaurants.

They turn you in circles from trying to park to walking to the entrance to waste time to finally tell you they are at capacity. We got rerouted for parking then walked about 15 mins to get to the gate after temp checks and security.  They oversold tickets for the day to let you know that they are at capacity after you finally reach the gate despite the ticket you purchased. We arrived at 11am because we figured we would stay until closing.  Really disappointed with UNIVERSAL ORLANDO. Way to disappoint excited children.  Instead of waiting hours for a maybe ticket that we realized we purchased we fought for a refund that was not nearly what we spent for our original tickets after jumping through so many hoops and talking to multiple associates that told us something different. Regardless we are so glad we didn’t stand there for hours in 90 degree weather for a maybe ticket. We left and made the best of the rest of our day.

Don't bother unless you buy the express pass. Not only do you get to ride in 1/4 of the time of peasants with normal tickets, express lines can be packed toe-to-toe. You can buy your way out of the pandemic spacing imposed on peons.
Cast team was fabulous, everything was great. I can't wait to go again. The best park at orlando. Yujuuu

The magic was gone with all of their restrictions. Certain attractions were closed almost no characters walking around and interacting with the kids. Better to wait until worth full price. It’s a scam I felt cheated out of my money.full park price is not worth it.Face painting is still full 15$ price for half the face when it should be whole face. Also the new policy of keeping masks on during your ENTIRE stay in the hot Florida heat was very very difficult. They do have rest areas where you can take your mask off, but that didn’t make the experience better. The entire time we were there we were being harassed by employees about the masks. You can be 10 ft away from someone or no one around at all, and there will be someone to harass you about pulling your mask up. It took away from what could have been a waaaay better experience. My husband was playing and talking but with our daughter and they told him to not lower his mask. He flipped out because he was enjoying the moment counting owls in the Harry Potter side of park with our 2 year old and the moment was ruined. Felt like we were in jail or school. Definitely won’t be coming back until restrictions are lifted.

Universal is a fun place for people of all ages. They have plenty of things to do like ride rides, attend shows, and eat. They have so many good restaurants in the parks and in City Walk. One of my favourites is the Chocolate Emporium where they have amazing specialty milkshakes. It gets very crowded in the summer and around holidays so i would suggest staying in a Universal Resort that offers fast passes. I have stayed in the Portofino, Royal Pacific, and Hardrock all of which have beautiful scenery and a wonderful staff. The resorts offer a ferry boat ride to the parks or you can use the short walking trails. If you don't want to stay at a Universal Resort another option to cut down wait times is to use the single rider line. It's great if you don't mind being separated from your party. It was overall a wonderful experience and I will definitely be back!

The park did a decent job of reopening for Covid. There is social distancing, temperature checks, hand sanitizing stations, and masks are required. At some points, there were large crowds, especially when the park closed, so I recommend leaving 30 minutes before the park actually closes. The virtual lines worked very well and I never felt uncomfortable in a line with too many people. The new deals Universal is offering are amazing and I plan on going back a few more times this year. The new Harry Potter ride is amazing!

There were many rides to go on and with the fast pass I was able to do many rides over the curse of the day. I loved going to The Wizarding World of Harry Potter as I felt it was a good representation of the movies/books and was very cool to see. The lines however can be long sometimes and the food is expensive. I feel as though it's worth it for the memories you make and the overall experiences you gain from this park. I think it is very worth it, to visit and travel here and you will not regret your decision.

Universal Studios is a very fun and entertaining place to visit! It is full of rollercoasters and plenty of rides. Not to mention that it includes great, delicious food around the whole park. This is a very exciting place to go filled with lots of adventures. I would definitely recommend others to go and have a blast creating countless memories!

the park is taking great measures with covid but the virtual lines are a disaster had to complain to guest services in order to be able to ride several rides otherwise becuase of their system we would of missed most of it

This was our first theme park visit since the pandemic started so we were not sure what to expect. When parking, every other parking space was blocked off to allow social distancing. Masks were required, except when eating. The few traditional waiting lines had distance markings on the floor. Parades and street shows were not present. Some photo with characters were allowed but only with the visitor a few feet in front of the characters. The biggest change however was with most wait lines that were converted to virtual: You use your app to reserve a future time, saving you from waiting in long lines. This sounded great except that it didn’t work at all for us! We arrived a little after noon and by that time there were zero time slots available! We were wondering why would they let people in the park if they cannot get on any of the rides? Talking to Universal team members, we were told to check the app as they would release time slots every hour. That did NOT happen. Actually it did a few hours later but the app froze and didn’t allow us to reserve the slots it briefly displayed. This repeated a few times and we suspected the system just wasn’t working. That could have totally ruined our experience, but we were saved by the friendly Universal team members. When we explained the issue and showed them screen shots of time slots we attempted but failed to secure, they actually allowed us to use these time slots as if we were able to capture them! This allowed us to go on the Mummy, Jimmy Fallon, and Harry Potter. We also stood in the traditional lines for the Simpsons and Men In Black. So these 5 rides plus walking around the park, shopping at the Hello Kitty store, and getting Butter Bear ice cream made the trip worthwhile. One other issue: I wear eye glasses and it was raining lightly the entire day Saturday. Most of the rides require 3-D glasses. These didn’t work well for me as they kept slipping off (maybe due to sanitizer used before handing them to you). Even worse, with the mask on, my eye glasses got fogged up very quickly and so it was hard to see the 3-D show! Still I did enjoy it and the rest of my family that don’t wear glasses didn’t have this issue. Big thanks to the awesome Universal staff for doing everything they can to create a safe and pleasant experience for their guests despite the difficult circumstances.

We actually went in Aug-2019 during summer break to Universal Studios Florida. It was well planned tour by my 13 year old son and he made all reservations, day wise plan for each places to tour at Florida. We really enjoyed the time with fun and joy. Couple of rides were really different than what we enjoyed in past. All together our experience with the accommodation that we booked in their resort was not at all good. We recommend to avail better options available in Hotels there. It will be good, comfortable selection by all means including cost.
Special effects we loved this visit, our children had already discovered it through the comments read on the internet, they each made a list with their visit preferences, it was magical

The staff working here makes this theme park amazing!! Best theme park employees ever. So nice and helpful. My husband and I (just got married two weeks ago)! went to Universal Studios Florida & Islands is Adventure for the first time ever today (Sept 30). We had the absolute best time. Covid precautions were handled wonderfully with everyone wearing their masks, temperature checks before check in and sanitizer before every ride. Tons of spacing and social distancing on every attraction. We felt totally safe and comfortable and we have been very cautious about Covid for this entire pandemic. I am a huge Harry Potter Superfan and we have spent some time out in the California HP world and universal studios park. Always love it and have a great time but Florida tops it by a mile due to having not just Hogsmeade but also the Diagon Alley world! We went to Ollivanders wand shop in Diagon Alley because I have always wanted to partake in the “wand chooses the wizard” experience/show. In LA pre-Covid, lines were hours long for this attraction and fast passes were not used towards it, so I have never done this experience but always wanted to. We spoke with a lovely girl working in Ollivanders Diagon Alley named Jessica who showed us how to get to the back of the shop where the wand experience sign ups were. I’m not sure if Orlando always does this Or if it is due to Covid, but they were signing people up to reserve times for later in the day. We were thrilled that times were still available and we didn’t have to wait in a 5 hour line to have the experience! Taylor was doing the wand experience sign ups - she was super nice and even fit us in at a wand appointment that was a perfect time for us (12 noon)! She was so helpful and great.  We were really excited about our wand appointment, and since we had a reservation time, we could actually walk around the park for a bit and then come back to our wand appointment. I was absolutely shocked when they brought just myself and my husband inside!! Because of Covid they were only doing one family/group at a time. I couldn’t believe it. I had to try not to cry in public, I was so thrilled, lol. They brought us inside by ourselves and I was able to do the wand experience - something I’ve always dreamed of doing. I felt just like Harry in the book/movie. It was a really wonderful once in a lifetime opportunity that I am so grateful to Taylor, Jessica and the whole team for. At the end, I of course bought my wand, and Jessica happened to be the sales clerk! She mentioned the wand holder and the masks for sale and I bought them also. Their team made the day one I will never forget for sure.  We also grabbed a fire whiskey/cider combination from Janessa who made an excellent drink and was very friendly as well, and a butterbeer ice cream from Fortescue’s which was great.  Then we took the Hogwarts Express over to the Islands park. Wow! Looks just like the movie. Because of Covid, each family/group once again, gets their own compartment on the train!!! Such a a cool experience. Again, because of Covid it you got your own space heading over to the next park, which was pretty awesome, and the experience was wonderful.  My husband and I also went on the Hagrids Motorbike ride at the very end of the day. Though we bought the fast pass, that didn’t work towards Hagrid’s (we were told it is because it is too new of a ride). We got in line one minute of 6pm (park closure) and the line said it would be a 90 min wait - but we only waited 30 min! We both agreed it was the best ride we have ever been on (and he’s been on a ton of roller coasters). Completely worth the wait. Super exciting and with Hagrid and the other creature animatronics there it was a very creative and fun ride. Even my husband, who isn’t nearly as big a Potter fan as me, loved it and thought it was very thrilling.  I would highly recommend anyone who is interested in checking out a theme park right now to go to Universal & Islands, and any Harry Potter fans should absolutely go now! In fact, we had so much fun that we are hopefully taking my parents to the park and going again this week!

We paid over 2 thousand dollars for our tickets (FULL PRICE) and everything but the rides and the outside hot dog stands were closed. They should be offering discounts not charging full price. The rides were great, especially Harry Potter world. They did a good job of making sure everyone had their masks on properly and stood six feet apart but that full price thing has turned me off of Disney forever.

i was so existing to had the experience of all universal movies games such as transformers , minions , fast & furious i had the rollers coaster journey takes a great photos there are a variety of restaurants hope to take my kids there oneday

It has become a premium park with their additional Express Pass that they want you to buy. They now have several rides that are only available through their virtual que system. If you buy the additional Express Pass you will have no problems reserving a spot on the virtual que. with just a general admission ticket, we couldn’t get a virtual pass. They release them at specific times, you click on the App to reserve a virtual pass, it spins for 1-2 minutes and tells you they are all out of passes on the virtual que. At that point it’s too late to try for a different virtual que, all of them go in seconds upon release. We tried 3 times the same day at the designated times and got zero virtual passes. About 1/3rd of the rides are off limits with general admission alone. No standby line for those virtual que rides. It was the worst visit I have ever had. It wasn’t worth visiting. 1 Star is too generous.

I knew there would be COVID precautions and I was a little worried after reading the negative reviews and customer complaints. Social distancing is handled very effectively by the park. I was amazed that they were able to accomplish keeping people 6 feet apart even in the serpentine lines. The drawback to the social distancing lines equated to longer lines. However, the ride experience itself was better. for instance on MIB. The wait would have been 5 minutes. But now due to social distancing its 15. But after a 15 minute wait my wife and I were place in our own car. This in my opinion makes the wait worthwhile. I even bought the ride photo. And it was pretty much the same throughout the park. To sum it up. Go to the park be patient and relaxed and have loads if fun.
The parks seem more crowded than Disney World parks. Though guest were required to ware masks, many were not worn properly.
Without a doubt, it is the activity that we preferred for the special effects, it feels like reality, it was magic

Harry Potter area was spectacular. Truly spectacular.  Some of the other rides were great.  Some of the rides haven't seen a coat of paint in 15 years.  We are, admittedly, Disney fans and are used to the constant improvement of Disney parks and technology. Universal really went all out on Harry Potter portions, but some of the older rides and areas needs TLC.  The app has clunky parts. The photo package is totally bizarre compared to Disney. Pictures are manually added, you have to get a print out slip at Will Call to then turn around and activate it in the park to get a necklace, and then every picture is manually added. And the pictures don't even show up in the Universal app! We still have some that were taken and not added.  We did the Express Pass--which was super helpful on a few rides, kind of helpful on most rides, and useless on some rides (because their was no line--MIB and ET, for example). It also excludes Hagrid's Motorbike (which we didn't know until we tried to get in line).  Kids loved, loved the interactive wands--especially in Diagon Alley.  Also weird--all adults needed ID with their tickets to get into the park. This wasn't disclosed anywhere in advance (or was done so small we didn't see it). Fortunately, we all had it, but it could have been a problem.  Do we wish they would improve some of the customer service pressure points? Yes!  Would we still go again (and spend most of our time in the Harry Potter portions? Yes!  They were less stringent about COVID restrictions, which was fine with us. Lots of spacing in rides and restaurants--virtually no enforced restrictions in any of the stores. Hand sanitized before every ride.
temp checks, and social distancing practiced.Harry potter area amazing, try the butter beer frozen. The attraction wait times were all about 15-20 minutes max Great time had by all

This is the first time I have gone to universal since COVID happened and I am pretty shocked how well they are handling things at the park. From cleaning the rides everytime someone gets off, to giving you hand sanitizer before you get on and once you get off, and even making sure while waiting in line everyone is 6+ feet from each other enforcing social distancing. The park was pretty empty when my boyfriend and I went and lines we’re no more than 10-15 minutes. (:

Fantastic fun for all ages, and very impressed with their COVID precautions. There's not single ride my family didn't enjoy, and food stands were generous with free ice water in the hot sun. Harry Potter area workers especially helpful with amusing children. Afterward, got in touch to buy souvenirs from stores that were closed when we left and person on phone was very helpful. Expensive, but you get what you paid for. Don't miss the Monster Makeup show!

I visited Universal last weekend and it was amazing. Limited capacity and extra cleaning made it a great trip. I felt extremely comfortable with the way they handled each guest and each ride. Hand sanitizer was mandatory before getting on any ride and was available after each ride. They also limited the rides to each group so you aren’t sitting with strangers. Definitely worth the money to go while it’s slow.

We went to Universal during the peak of the COVID surge, a few weeks after it re-opened in June. We had a wonderful time. Mask wearing was enforced and there was hand sanitizer everywhere. Especially enjoyed the Harry Potter rides and Hagrid's Magical Creatures Motorbike Adventure is incredible and worth waiting for. Lines were short and we were able to rush through both Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure in a day (rushed through, mostly Harry Potter). Hogwarts Express is a must-ride and there were plenty of other fun rides. Parts of Universal feel dated and need to be revamped (Superhero rides, Dr. Seuss section). Some staff members are wonderful, others are just ok as to helpfulness and willingness to answer questions. There was more mask difficulty at CityWalk where staff members were telling people to wear masks properly but were being ignored by guests. Overall, we loved our trip though we can't imagine what it would be like when it was busy and we would have to wait in long lines.

Wizarding World of Harry Potter is amazing. The detail, shops, staff. Do everything you can rides, shops, interactive wands. Simpsons, Minions, MIB.. Transformers is the best 4D experience, and is a must do. I suggest if you have kids 10 and under rent a stroller.

We came on a holiday before here and it was amazing and this time over it was pretty much the same with some new rides, all of the facilities were great and all the staff were helpful if we got lost overall it was a great holiday away

They really take safety seriously, every single attraction is packed with hand sanitizer and someone that makes sure every person gets it. Keeping social distance is priority on the rides and the park in general is super clean, including restrooms. The staff is very kind and professional since you step into the park. Thank you for such a nice attitude that keeps people coming back.

Spent a great weekend at Universal. Initially had a problem getting into the park because of a ticket issue that we caused, but Donnie at the front gate helped us correct our mistake. The staff is on top of the mask wearing by reminding people politely and they are good at keeping the recommended spacing in lines. Then to top it all off, we lost our car keys and Universal arranged for a cab to get us back to the hotel. I figured it would be another $75+ or so but to our surprise, Universal picked up the tab for the cab. Thank you Maria at Guest Services. I cannot say enough about the staff at the park. I've been in the past but it really feels like they're going way above and beyond. I will definitely be back.

Best day this year so far! We went yesterday, 9/6/2020. I took my 14 year old son, 6 year old daughter, and 3 year old son. This was their first time. We all had an equally great time. My little guy even got to ride 10 rides which I didn’t think was possible at Universal Studios, and loved every one especially Harry Potter. All my kids in unison said it’s way better than Disney! Posted wait times were overstated. We never waited for any ride for more than 25 minutes and it goes by so fast. One of my concerns was that we would not be able to ride the Harry Potter ride which was part of the Virtual Line rides, and we didn’t have express passes. I kept checking throughout the day for times to return to no avail. I already gave up on riding it, and was really disappointed, and we were getting ready to leave when they opened up the stand by queue!!! I was SO HAPPY even though the wait was close to 2 hours long. I didn’t care. I was sure it was worth it. However we didn’t have to wait even 5 minutes because we were one of the lucky few that got pulled out of the line by a Harry Potter angel named MIRANDA and taken right up to the ride by a “secret passage” with an elevator, and when we got to the boarding area we were the first and only ones there and at my daughters request got to ride in the first row! I cannot in words describe the gratitude I felt and actually cried after we got off the ride because I was so touched by Miranda’s actions and her interactions with my kids. She said she’s taking us a secret way because my 3 year old had the cutest mask on and kept it on the whole time with no complaints. I will forever be grateful for this experience that not only made my whole day, but our whole trip! Because of this we still had time to ride the minions ride and shop at gift shops. The only reason for 4 stars is because our dining experience was less than perfect. We got to the Krusty Burger at 2pm and did not get our food until 3:43pm. And that was after sitting down at our assigned table with a number for over 20 minutes, at which point I had to ask an associate more than once to please check on our order which was placed over and hour ago. With 2 young kids that act like they haven’t eaten in months, while watching everyone around them eat, it was not a pleasant and relaxing lunch that I anticipated. Other than, 5 stars all the way!! I am now seriously considering season passes as we live in Palm Beach County and I can totally see coming here at least once a month, and definitely for special events.

Our day was practically ruined!!! So we go into universal studios and it was all fine but then we find out that there is a thing called virtual line which Is for like all of the good rides, and we were ok ok we just have to make a reservation that’s all. NO let me explain how it works. Basically you have to make a time reservation for the ride you want to go on but when we tried making the reservation but there were non available and when there finally was I clicked it super fast and it said oh sorry another person already booked it and it says that every tine so we couldn’t go on any rides in universal studios but I do recommend islands of adventure there is no virtual line for anything and is waaaay funner for kids😄

We just returned from a stay at Royal Pacific with a 4 day park to park ticket option. We enjoyed our stay at Royal Pacific but this review will specifically be for the parks only.  Our stay was from 09/03-09/07. We went in knowing that our stay would include a weekend and a holiday weekend at that. We anticipated larger crowds but we were expecting some better precautions in place in regards to managing crowds.  Once the parks hit capacity for the day it was apparent that there were just too many people in the parks. I understand that the parks are following state guidelines but capacity limits need to be reevaluated. It was especially difficult to distance ourselves from other groups in Diagon Alley, Hogsmeade and as a whole, Islands of Adventure. It was apparent that staff were extremely overwhelmed by the crowds and were having a difficult time managing everybody. There was also just no way to maintain 6 feet away from the party ahead of you or behind you in certain areas of the park and in certain queues once they extended past where the floor markings were. It would have been helpful if there were team members stationed throughout the queues monitoring guests and separating as needed.  Again, we truly did anticipate and prepared ourselves for dealing with higher than average crowds due to the weekend and Labor Day, but we were surprised by the capacity allowed in the parks right now, especially if it can't be managed appropriately.  With that said, we still had a wonderful time but would definitely advise those who are traveling to Universal right now to avoid the weekend if at all possible.

our 1st family vacation in 6 yrs. Had a great time, just a few problems that came up. Parks opened up at different times. Our early entry pass was basically no ggod because the rides didnt open up until 2 hrs after the park. The transformers oicture was not delivered to our hotel as promised, and we still havent gotten it. Said they would mail it. Watch your charges on the hotel bill. We stayed at Lowes Royal Pacific. Although it is a wonderful hotel and the staff was great, they overcharged, and duplicate charged us. Our bill totaled 531.61, even gave us a credit back, on paper. When I chececked my account it was double chared and for more than the bill, by 131.40. I cant get zhold of anyone in accounting because of the holiday so my money, 760.00 is sitting there and I cant use it. Took me a year to save up for this vacation, aand they want to do this to me.

Booked our trip to Universal in late July for Memorial Day Weekend. We knew there where limited spaces etc so we wanted to be sure to reserve our space. If the park was operating at partial capacity I hate to see what it looks like at full capacity. We waited 2 hours to go 1.5 miles into the parking lot. Once inside it’s very confusing of which way to go to get to what resort. Finally found our way over to Universal Island of Adventure. Went to Kiosk and entered code for Will Call tickets, printed and proceeded to gate. Scan tickets “Voided tickets must go to Guest Services”. 35 minute wait at guest services, reprinted tickets and off to the island we went. Ride one ride with Xpress pass and head to next...”Sorry, this Xpress pass is for Universal Studios, you must got back to guest services”. 45 minute wait at guest services ticket reprinted and off to ride another ride... “Sorry, weather in the area no rides can operate”. Wait another 45 minutes to pass ride a few rides and then go to next ride and it doesn’t except Xpress Pass and no Virtual Line availability. Constant strike after strike. Our day for 2 was $528.00 for 2 tickets and 2 Xpress Passes. We rode 5 rides and called it a day as the place was packed, their is construction everywhere, the place is filthy, the staff walks around in regular clothes just to harass people in between drinks of water or bites of food to put their mask back on. The rides are mediocre at best. Nothing gives you a big “wow” factor. I have been to Universal Studios side before and it was much better and seemed cleaner and more friendly. City walk is great but they are renovating a giant area of it so it’s not what it normally is. Overall it wasn’t that enjoyable but the show will go on and many people will enjoy it.

Note: The trip was actually in August 2019 but was not able to select it in the drop down list. This is our family's third trip to Universal Studios Florida. I would select Good as a rating vs Very Good but the option is not available.  Areas of improvement • High cost of parks • Rides not being in operation. In the five days that we were at the parks, multiple rides were not in operation. The most frustrating ride that was down that had the most impact was the Hagrid’s Magical Creatures Motorbike Adventure. • Rides are closed at the first sign of inclement weather, even when there is nothing seen or if the storm is 15 miles away. This includes pools at the resorts as well and water taxis. • Standing in line many hours for the popular rides means paying for the day and going on only a few rides.  Keep doing • Parks and resort clean • Staff mostly friendly and courteous

We visited Universal Studios in late July to celebrate our daughter's HS grad. We want to commend Universal for how safe they made us feel at the parks, hotels and on citywalk. Everyone kept their masks on, socially distanced and kept things clean. The only part I would have them improve on is the hand sanitizer they use in the parks smells very bad. Disney's hand sanitizer is like purell and adds something to it to make it smell pure or good. I think they must be using a cheap version and I would say for them to review what type they are forcing people to use as it stinks and feels terrible on your hands. We didn't stay at a hotel this time to get the free Universal Express as there were no huge lines. We rode rides multiple times and had a great day. There are places to rest if you want to take off your mask and eat/drink and I would advise to do a sit-down lunch. We ate at the Leaky Cauldron and the only part that was strange is you are seated and order at your table as they don't want lines outside otherwise everything was really good. The only other suggestion for Universal in general is stop making people use lockers on rides like Men in Black. I do like the new locker system since our last visit to get your items in/out as it was much quicker than the thumb scan but make sure you keep your park ticket with you to reopen your locker. Weekdays are less crowded than weekends if you are from out of town like us.

Painful, irritative and troublesome service from the park. Each ride is more than 60 min wait time(wait 60 min under hot sun and have a ride for 5 min) . You have to buy the full fare of the maximum priced ticket offered or else they will make sure u will leave park disappointed. We bought 4 day promotional offer at 320$ per person. And we were not able to complete atleast one park for two days. Terrible experience. Six flags would be far better cheaper and far better thrilling.
I sang there with my chorus it was really fun because afterword we got to do the whole park we had so much fun with my family.

Where to start, this exceeded my expectations in every way. We decided to book a two park pass and do them both in one day, we also upgraded to fast pass which was the best thing we did as it wouldn’t have been possible to get on all the rides if not. We started off in islands of adventure and worked our way through the park and then over to universal studios. Each area was done spectacularly but the stand out area for me was the world of Harry Potter, the simulation ride in the castle was my fav ride of the whole park. I can’t wait to visit again!!!
My family had a great time at universal theme park. They make sure they clean and sanitized the rides. We will come back.

I never was able to go to universal before, one day I randomly got the Florida resident promotional pass, so I’ve been there a few times now since they have opened back up a few months ago. I see other people complaining about wearing face masks in the heat all day and blah blah blah, but considering myself and every single staff member at universal ALSO has to wear their face masks for our entire shifts (I work at Chickfila, taking orders outside) NOBODY SHOULD BE COMPLAINING! I admit when I had to first wear a mask all day at my job it was uncomfortable to get used to, but now it’s like I’m not even wearing one. GET OVER YOURSELVES. I would say “first world problems” but considering the whole world is going through this pandemic together, it just shows how spoiled Americans really are.  I must commend the amazing things universal parks are doing following CDC guidelines. I for one absolutely LOVE the social distancing stickers because I don’t have people breathing down my neck, and can be comfortable while waiting in line.  Speaking of lines, if you go on a weekday, they are nowhere near as busy as weekends. So feel free to come during the week if you want to complain about wait times, or fork it over for the fast pass. You cannot blame the park for wait times, if the park is busy.  I honestly have been about 5 times and will most likely go again tmrw, because I am absolutely loving every single experience I have had so far. All the staff have been so friendly and inviting, and I am actually really glad that ALL the staff is being so serious about everyone wearing face masks.  Thank you universal, I really appreciate your effort and each time I’ve gone it’s been so much fun.

I took my husband for his birthday with a Florida resident promotion we had too.for Tuesday Sept 1. The parks were empty until after lunch. We only waited for the train in both directions and then it was 15 minutes in ac. I absolutely loved hagrid ride. So fun. My husband did not feel great due to the mask being so hot. But We still had a ball.  All the staff was super friendly. Yes they asked people to pull their masks up. That is their job and duty. If you cannot abide by this then wait until masks are not being mandatory. No one likes wearing them.  We did not like the butter beer and $8.50 is crazy. Parking is also expensive st $26. I know they all charge. Be prepared to walk a lot but there are so many cafes and air cond places.  We can't wait to come back.

We visited Universal on August 25 (Tuesday). We arrived around 10:00 AM. We experienced everything except the ET ride and Bourne. We stayed until 5:00. We did not have express passes. It was quite empty. If we waited, it was because we had to wait until the next show, etc. Which was never more than 20 minutes. We had been here five years ago. Nothing seemed new. We enjoyed Diagon Alley because no one was around. So easy to navigate. What we did notice is that the qualify of the virtual rides have diminished. We loved the Simpsons five years ago. Rode it many times. This time, just once. At first I just thought it was my eyes getting older :) but my teenage daughter complained that the screens were not that clear. Even the Harry Potter was blurry. We were really disappointed by this park for that reason. They need to invest in updating the graphics every few years apparently. (Spider Man was great at Islands of Adventure and that was updated recently) Jimmy Fallon was the clearest one at Universal.. We ate at The Leaky Cauldrin. It seems they want everyone to order with the app. It took us a bit of time to figure it out but it worked nicely. Butterbeer, $8 REALLY! The food there was okay. It was a nice place to cool off and have nice scenery. Wearing masks is very hard in the heat. Be aware. There were times when someone in our party felt ill due to it. The staff is great at cleaning. Great at reminders to distance. Since it was really empty, it was so easy to distance. We stayed at Surfside because it provided transportation and early entry. However, we found out that early entry is one park for a whole week. It was Universal Studios all week. So do not pay the extra if you want the extra hour until you know which park will have this when you visit. We visited Volcano Bay, amazing place without crowds on August 26. Islands of Adventure 27, 28 and no lines until later in day Friday. No need for Express tickets. Loved Islands of Adventure!! Also, there are areas where concessions are shut down. We just wanted water once and could not find a place. Loved they have lockers at each ride for free. Without crowds it was great. Could see it being annoying if you had to wait in lines to go to lockers and pick up stuff.

We spend 3 days at Universal and it was amazing! First day we didn’t do the express passes but decided by the second day to do it. We were SO happy we did! Got through the rides so fast. ONLY downside is not seeing the cool stuff you see while waiting in line (mostly the Harry Potter stuff) Express passes we’re kinda expensive but well worth it for us. Universal was so detailed and fun. Very glad we went and will definitely go back!
Overall, lots of fun, but make sure you get the two-park pass and take the Hogwarts Express between the two parks. This "ride" is a hoot@

I love universal ! It’s just amazing 😉 The rides are out of this world and the experience is Fabulous We have been twice on two different occasions and different times of year Feb half term for uk is good as it’s quiet And queues are not too bad Food in the park is decent The security Q can be long but that’s fine!

A park with something for everyone. From nostalgic shoot-em up's in Men In Black to the Minions ride at the entrance of the park. The rides are kept in great condition and I rode many multiple times as they are that fun. The food choice is good, I would recommend a trip to Moe's Tavern in the Simpsons section of the park for a 'Flamin' Moe'. It is definitely worth getting one of the refillable freestyle bottles as the stations are all across the park and you will drink a lot of fluids due to the heat. If you have park hopper, definitely jump on the Harry Potter train to do so as its fun/interactive and the journey changes depending what park you are coming from/going to. Also recommend the purchase of the fastpasses. These work on almost all the rides except one or two and are good for the whole day. You'll normally get on around 8-10 rides if you really try per day whereas I was getting on around 20 with the fastpass.
We went to eat at bubba Gump but ended up eating at margaritiville. Had a great time and voodoo donuts is amazing

So we purchased the Florida Resident Season Passes and Volcano Bay as an add on. All I can say is it's POINTLESS to go! While the lines were not very long the COVID "precautions" are ridiculous! For example Shrek 3D has 30 seats but they load only 7! They literally show you the seating on the entrance sign to the ride so I am NOT exaggerating... Therefore, it takes more than 4 times as long to move through the line! We arrived just after 11:00am and only managed to do Shrek 3D, Hogwarts Train to Adventure Island, Eat a quick (late lunch), and go on Jurrasic Park River Adventure - then the park was closing! 6:00pm! Most of our time was spent in line with Universal (Nazi) staff yelling at more than a few people to "cover your nose" as just wearing the mask was insufficient even when we were all seperated by more than 6 feet (as shown in every line with stickers on the floor). Anyway, save your money until the park fully opens otherwise I suggest just skipping it totally!!!!

My wife and I went to Islands of Adventure and found that social distancing was largely ignored. The rides seem to be a bit better, but people can't seem to read where the social distance line is and stop piling on top of you. A couple of the rides weren't even wiped down after people exited the ride. We thought the access to the parks were supposed to be limited at this time, but that did not appear to be the case. Universal should take a hint from Disney and keep people who are drinking and eating stationary. The wait times for rides were ridiculous. You really can't get on most without a long wait unless you spend the extra money for the express pass. The Hulk coaster had an 85 minute wait 2 hours after the park opened. Hagrid's ride was a 2 hour wait. We are Florida residents and probably won't go back for a while.

Lines were fairly short and rides were easy to get on. The park was pretty much empty and the normal game attractions were empty for long periods of time. I don't think Universal needs that booth that is trying to offer time share to people in the park. Maybe they could have a booth with just a computer for people if they would like to see someone about this. I saw the people at the time share become very pushy. I understand it is sales. Right now people are just trying to keep their heads above water.  The tickets weren't good to go from theme park to Diagnon alley. So we couldn't ride any of those rides. It required another payment of $55. per adult. Don't know if kids price was cheaper. Was a real bummer.  Volcano bay. Was very pretty, but lacked signs for lockers, and the mask wearing issues was very tough. You had to have a mask to get a drink or order food in the park, but did not need it for rides. Where the heck are you supposed to keep your mask? on your lounge chair it will just blow away. The other thing is they were supposed to have cages for service animals while the people were on a ride, and they told us they could provide us one so our dogs could be safe. Why aren't there like areas to take your service dog. They are supposed to be with us? Why isn't there a place for them and their owners? Dogs would like to cool down also.  In general the parks were very good about getting water for our service dogs. The warm concrete was hard on them as we couldn't get boots prior to the trip. The dogs rode the carasol with us.

Universal << Disney  That being said, Universal is still fun and Harry Potter World is EXTREMELY good. Harry Potter World is well worth the prices of admission.  Some of the other areas in the parks are pretty outdated and will need to be changed soon otherwise people will stop going.  Another thing I noticed was that Universal struggles to create a special experience in the same way that Disney does. It definitely isn't easy to do.
A fun and enjoyable experience. About as much activity as you can cram into one day, 2 days would be better.
They need to have more discounts for the tickets More bath rooms They need there bus to the park more different rides to experience

I know that universal has to do what they need to do to open and stay open, but the mask nazis are needing to take it down a notch. No more than getting through the gate at opening, I simply ask my wife whixh direction we are headed and scratched an itch on my nose. The mask came down just under my nose for no more than a second before I re-adjusted it "correctly" over my nose and was immediately and very rudely confronted by an employee. The rudeness of the employees at most rides on our trip was uncalled for. Some of the employees were very nice and courteous, but are outnumbered by the bad. In the 90+ degree heat the masks are already hard to deal with, but having that plus the employees attitudes is uncalled for. The hand sanitizer they require you use before each ride leaves a residue after until you wash your hands thoroughly to remove it. I DO NOT recommend attending until this "pandemic" is over and NO MASKS are required.

We stayed at Lowe’s Royal Pacific Hotel which is amazing. We have encountered nothing but wonderful helpful people from our hotel to our stay at the parks. Daily temperature checks, hand sanitizer before every ride and of course mask through out. We have experienced a couple of technical difficulties. For someone reason my food app works everywhere but at leaky cauldron and 3 broomsticks. But again, someone was right there to help. The photo pass has given some difficulty adding and activating but again very kind and helpful people. If you are from Louisiana like us, do yourself a favor and bring salt or Tony’s. I hope to come back soon.

Good job Universal with all your hard work during this pandemic. I wasn't sure if I would feel safe coming to the parks but now I do. I would say about 75% off people were wearing their masks correctly but I would hear cast members reminding those guests that were not to cover their nose and mouth. Cast members were constantly wiping down handrails . Thank you for keeping us safe.

A few attendants ruined the overall experience for my family and I. I’m aware that masks are essential at the moment, but the nature of which they treated us was uncalled for. At one point I had been taking a sip of my bottled beverage while waiting in line and the attendant scolded me for doing so. She said that if I couldn’t keep my mask on, I’ll wouldn’t be allowed to enter the ride. I was shocked. I apologized and said I was under the impression there was a 30 second drinking rule that I had been following. She snippily replied “Well I don’t know about that, but you’ll keep it on or be removed.” I did as she said, but this is not the experience I signed up for. I understand bad days/rude customers, and how it can take a toll on someone, but this strict attitude was consistent throughout the park. Then we were approaching the line for Shrek, my dad took a sip of his water and immediately placed his mask back up, while to my left another male let his mask hang down completely, and yet she only got onto my father who was actively trying to adhere to the rules. I don’t want to cry racism, but she saw both men and chose to get onto the minority:/ Both people should be held to the same standard. There were more instances of just overall rude/wrong behavior, but for now this is all I’m going to write about. I really hope Universal goes to better lengths to ensure their customer service is up to par because as of now I am thoroughly disappointed.

Sorry to write that we had a disappointing day: 1. Crowds were horrendous. Unlike Disney which requires a reservation and therefore crowds are manageable, Universal doesn't have any limits and their current "buy a day, get the rest of the year for free" promotion for Floridians is packing the parks with locals. Look for 30-75 minute waits for the most popular rides 2. After ordering simple chicken sandwiches at Mel's DriveIn we waited 27 minutes only to be told that they're still not ready. We cancelled order and moved on- having wasted half an hour 3. The new ride Hagrid's Motorbike was down the entire day (Friday, 8/14) 4. Unhelpful staff. We asked how to get to the Bourne Stunt show are were told, "that's not here, that's in California." Wrong. 5. Not enough shade, misters, and air conditioning for 90 degree humid weather 6. Not your fault, but the 6 foot rule has made lines even longer and pushed them out into the hot humid Florida weather
Great for teenagers and adults compared to Disney. Giving 4/5 as rides were having issues all the time. But it was fun still.

We're big Disney fans and were staying on resort there, but thought we'd do two days across the Universal parks. It's easy and convenient to get a Lyft over to the parks, and we had a great day in the park. There's a good range of rides to try, but overall we always found the theming and general vibe of the park is more like a 'theme park' than to the calibre of experience at Disney. In my experience over several visits across the year, it's never worth getting the Express pass if you time you visit and rides well (or certainly it's not worth getting in advance until you see the real park crowds on that day). We enjoyed our visit and wouldn't advise anyone against going, but if you're at Disney it's a lot of money to spend in addition to take time away and I'm not sure how worth it this is. The difficulty being that the tickets only become cheaper when you buy multiple days, but there isn't enough to do in the parks to warrant more than one day per Universal park if you're hopping between.

We did the Wizarding World of Harry Potter Package July 25-28th. Found the staff to be super helpful and friendly. The face masks were a minor inconvenience but in no way interfered with the fun experience the parks offered. I felt that the safety of my family was a high priority to each member of the staff both at the parks and the Endless Summer Surfside Resort, where we stayed. Although we didn't use them enough, the You Rest Area's were a great way to relax without a mask. Due to COVID-19 the crowds were smaller and we were able to ride every ride we wanted to several times, giving my grandchildren an amazing first experience. Can't wait to return.

Social distancing, hand sanitizer, and facial covering is required for all attendees. Parking is free anytime after 6:00 P.M. Free boat ride to all guest after 8:30 P.M. Live entertainment, great food, and bathrooms are clean constantly especially, during this (COVID)-19
lots of fun, noy very crowded did IOA and universal in the same day rode all the atractions some twice, lots of social distancing, felt safe the entire time, friendly employees. just an awsome time.

We really enjoyed Universal Studios Orlando with my teenagers. There are a number of attractions for all ages. If you're staying for multiple days I would encourage you to get a pass to go between the parks. You also need a two-park pass if you want to ride the Harry Potter train. If you are with teenagers you don't want to miss The Mummy. The new Borne Stunttacular is the best I have ever seen with special effects don't miss that either.

Enjoyed Universal’s studio even with the safety guidelines in place. The crowd was very aware and followed guidelines. Crew members was making sure hands were sanitized before entering the ride. I felt safe and still able to enjoy. The wait times seem longer than they actually were.

Went to Orlando for a honeymoon extravaganza in August 2019 involving Universal Studios, all Disney parks, SeaWorld, A Manatee Expedition and Busch Gardens. Universal was absolutely amazing, beautiful scenery, well maintained rides, helpful staff and not unreasonable wait times if you plan carefully (made more bareable by fans and air con in the queues!) We even got an extra go on the new Hagrid Ride after a looong queue as it was our honeymoon which was great! Loved the Harry Potter section, being British it is exactly how I would have pictured it, Hogsmeade, Diagon Alley and Hogwarts Castle and the entertainment there were wonderful! Would definitely recommend but plan carefully to avoid long queues!

I would not go to Universal Studio Parks until they stop requiring people to wear masks at ALL times. It was horrible!! We wore our masks as instructed, and our family was mask-shamed by employees even when we took our masks off to eat/drink or breathe. Not to mention it was way too hot to wear a mask! We are medical professionals, and there was no need to wear a mask in a 1/2 empty amusement park outside when it is almost 100 degrees. It causes more harm than good. #FactsOverFear

The Harry Potter rides and exhibits were definitely our favorites, from Escape from Gringotts, to the ride inside Hogwarts, to Hagrid's Motorcyle rides. But there's a lot more to enjoy at Universal Studios, too. The Bourne Stunt show was simply amazing, a seamless integration of live action and CGI that left us wondering when one ended and the other began. Even for adults, the Shrek and Minion shows were a delight.  For those who are wondering, everyone wore masks, and the people in line practiced social distancing. The employees were constantly cleaning and spritzing hand sanitizer on everyone's hands before each ride. Everyone also had their temperature taken before going into the park. My family felt as safe as one can in these strange times.

I visited the park with my husband and 3 kids yesterday. Before that I visited the park with my husband 15 years ago and liked it much better now. There weren't many people at the park which meant little or no wait time at all. We were able to do most of the rides twice. Please mind that the park opens at 9am and closes at 5pm. I wish it would close later. Wearing a mask is a must,hand sanitaizer before every ride,temperature check before entering the park. No paper map, you have to download their app. Harry Potter part was our favorite. My 2 year old could do only 2 shows. Most of the kids zone is closed( mini water park and Curious George part).It was a problem to find turkey legs. Overall we had a great day.The only negative is that one day at the Universal studios costs a fortune. Paid around $140 per ticket. The food package per person is $35 which includes water bottle( unlimited drinks) one meal and a snack. We stayed at the hotel across the street from Universal( very convenient).
Hardly nobody visiting and getting in early was an plus. Few lines and interaction with others was super. The Irish pub Fennigans was delish! Street actors were adorned and easily watched.

The service at the quick service restaurants is terrible now with the new procedures in place. It will take at least 20 minutes after you order to get the food. Even longer if you have to pay cash at the register since they really don’t like that. There’s also a line just to get into the restaurant with no option to take it to go. Eat at the fire eaters grill in ioa as it’s the only place that doesn’t do these things although you will have to eat outside. Universal needs to stand up against fear and do things using common sense.
Our trip to universal Studios was very awesome the characters and the rides was great.seeing spiderman. dinosaur s and all different characters you can imagine.

Stayed at Universal's Adventura Hotel this past weekend with my family and had a great time visiting Volcano Bay for the first time and enjoying the parks as always. Universal has been doing an excellent job in creating a safe environment during COVID and making sure guests have an incredible experience.  Most of all, I want to recognize two team members that went above and beyond for us this past trip. First of all, shout out to Savannah who worked the register at Urban Pantry in the Aventura hotel. She provided us excellent service and went above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of -- even though we came right before closing for the night. She really made us hungry and tired guests quite welcome and she should be recognized!  The second team member I want to shout out is Scott over at the Hollywood Drive-in Mini Golf. When we were deciding whether to golf before dinner at Bubba Gump Shrimp Co., he advised us to come back once it got dark and gave us some great tips as well as a voucher for a free appetizer for the restaurant. His overall cheerful and helpful attitude made for some excellent customer service skills that should be recognized.  Universal's Team Members are some of the best around! Thank you for your great service!

Definitely the best part about all of the experience At Universal Studios Orlando is the fact that you can pretty much go anywhere and they keep the park very nice neat clean and they also do really good safe upkeep of making sure customers feel safe with everything going on through COVID-19. If you’re gonna be in town or for any length of time and you’re gonna come by definitely consider upgrading your tickets at the customer service window before you come in and get the season pass now I do you save money everywhere you go during the time that you’re at the park you also save money at all the stores for merchandise.The rides are exceptional and extremely enjoyable

Not as good as disney world in my opinion. Still amazing all the same. Love the mummy ride, and the men in black ride, as well as everything else! But those are my two favourites. The horror makeup show is a great laugh and I love that you can get a duff beer in the park. Its a must do!

Given that our entire lives have been taken over by Covid-19, and the constant onslaught of media attention covering the surge of cases in Flordia, to say I was conflicted about going to Universal Studios in an understatement. Ultimately, my family of 7 decided to go. We even flew there. Here is what I learned and how we controlled for as much risk as possible...  Airport...We decided to avoid shuttles and shared spaces as much as possible. We also bought double-layered masks for extra protection. We parked in self-parking, which allowed us to walk into the terminal without taking a shuttle.  In the airport, we were able to keep 6 feet or more distance at all times. Traffic is low, so this was easy. Rather than sitting at our own gate, we sat at the next one over (which was empty ) to stay away from others.  Once on the plane, which was only half full, we asked if we could move to the back two rows. There were at least two empty rows ahead of those, so we again felt we successfully maintained distance.  Upon arriving at Universal, we rented our own car and set off to Universal's Surfside hotel. The hotel was at less than a third capacity. We were the only ones in our hallway.  Pools got a little busy at night, but still very manageable.  Rather than take the free shuttles from the hotel the next morning, we asked the front desk if we could park at one of the closer resort hotels for the day. We explained we were just trying to reduce our risk. They allowed us to do this. So we parked at the Royal Pacific hotel each day and walked the private path up to universal. Again, not sharing bus rides was nice.  At the park. Universal does an excellent job with spacing and hand sanitizer going on to the rides. They keep distance between rows on the actual rides by allowing every other row to be empty or by separating groups by car. You are never riding with a stranger.  We felt most at risk getting off of rides and departing the Hogwarts Express. While they take such care getting you on rodes safely and separately; it is a free-for-all after the rides. I wish they would have controlled that part better.  Also, the locker situation is probably the riskiest part. There is no way to not need lockers. Some rides even require that you leave your phone. I wish they would change that. I could easily leave my bag, but you need the phone to book virtual line passes. Even though they try to space out access to the lockers, these are tight spaces that are touched by everyone. The easiest fix is to allow people to keep their phones and to recommend all bags to be left in lockers.  The dining facilities are mostly mobile order. Groups are well spaced, and outdoor seating is available. Mealtime was a great chance for a safe mask break.  We are now home and we are quarantining. I have read that at the earliest, we could take a Covid test after 5 days for 60% accuracy. There is still a 40% possibility of a false negative. We will likely take a test on day 5, results usually take 2-3 days and we will decide from there.  The isolation is hard, especially on kids. Our kids play with the neighbors a lot, and now we are watching them out the window. However, I do take seriously my responsibility to not spread the virus if we have it. I hope they come up with more accurate tests that can detect the virus sooner. Most people are not going to self-quarantine unless they know they have it.  In sum, we had a great time, and if you are ok with controlling for all the variables that you can, wearing a mask all day, and responsibility quarantining when you get back...I say go. We walked on rides all 4 days. It was pretty awesome to get to see and experience Harry Potter world and the rest of the attractions at a leisurely pace.  FYI...NO FAST PASS NEEDED...I wouldn't waste the money on a more expensive stay at the more expensive resorts, Surfside is the best deal by far.

Let me start off by saying that due to the pandemic, I am awarding 1 extra star to my reviews due to the difficult situation. Universal has improved on a number fo their rides but the draconian attitude by some of their employees made this a miserable vacation. I'll excuse the fact that most of the employees we encountered were just plain rude but there were a few stand outs such as Robert, the team leader at Bank of Gringnots who jumped in front of my wife (violating social distancing guidelines) taking a picture screaming that face masks were required at all times. We tried to explain that we already asked and were told it would be OK provided we kept in mind social distancing guidelines and did it quickly. Robert though remained in our face even when requested to step back and threatened to have us removed from the park if we took anymore pictures. There were others during our visit who we observed who treated guests just as Robert treated us. The hand Sanitizer used at Universal before the rides smells awfully strong of gasoline and is like rubbing snot on your hands. My youngest son hands started to peel and burn after the 3rd day. When we asked if we could apply our own sanitizer (which exceeds recommended requirements), we were told we were not and that failure to apply it could result in being removed from the park. The rudeness of Universal employees plus the disgusting hand sanitizer is a instant zero in my book. The two stars comes from Volcano Bay and the fact that masks were not required and employees were not behaving like Masks Nazis. People kept their distance and enjoyed themselves. As for the main parks, I won't say that we won't return but it will be a long while before I do...

Called today to make a hotel reservation and spoke with RANIA in Reservations. She provided OUTSTANDING top-notch customer service, which is hard to come by these days. She was patient, willing to help answer all of our questions and went above and beyond in offering her help and support. We priced several different Universal properties, and ended making a reservation at our all-time favorite location - Sapphire Falls. But Rania helped us understand what each of the other properties offered and the pricing points of each. Thank you Rania for your help and professionalism.

I was highly satisfied with their safety precautions during the entire time there. Every ride we got on someone was wiping and spraying after every group.There are signs and everywhere about staying ft apart and there pretty vocal about it if you don't. We went there to surprise the kids for there birthday.This might sound crazy but going during COVID was pretty tight. Although some of the parades and shows was not going the lines to the ride wait was 20 mins at max. Only ride we wasn't able to make it to was the mummy it was virtual and speed pass only and it was all booked up so if you go download the app and virtually book that first.

The objective report: Every, I mean EVERY safety precaution is in place. Temperatures taken before entering the hotel or park, wristbands to ensure you went through the temp checkpoint. The six feet distance requirement is serious business...if you're 5.75ft from the next party, a staff member will pop out from nowhere to kindly have you step back. Same with masks...cover nose to chin or you don't go in. Guests are extremely proactive and compliant, staff are kind but mean business. Our boat captain to the park stopped our ride because a kid had his mask on his chin. They are 100% on top of their game.  The perspective: Crowds were tiny in the mornings, no lines for anything except the new Jason Bourne show. This line stretched all the way down the street...UO might need to rethink this strategy as we showed up 3x to try to see the show but it was full every time so we gave up. Walked right onto Hagrid's motorcycle coaster, King King, and Escape from Gringott's.. We had an express pass with our hotel key, but it wasn't necessary as the morning crowd was so small.
