Heat and masks were fine before noon...afternoons were sweltering and miserable with increasing park crowds.  The verdict: Definitely glad we came, its a much needed respite. Personally, I loved the lack of crowds and spacing for the most part, it almost felt like we had the park to ourselves at times. If safety is the issue. I feel safer here than at my local supermarket. More precautions are taken, and there is a neverending supply of hand sanitizer.

Other than Rip Ride Rock-it, the Harry Potter area, and the Mummy, this half of the park is crap. Ditch the Simpsons ride, it’s awful, the fast and furious is junk, the transformers is ok, and the rest are for little kids. Add some more indoor coasters like the mummy to help people enjoy the park while the rain comes each day in the summer. The food is way over priced!

My family and I were down in Ft. Lauderdale to attend a wedding. We thought that since we flew all the way down to Florida we might as well go to an amusement park. We chose Universal Studios for our visit and could not have had a better time. While Florida is hot even in October the park itself was a blast. All of the older attractions were well maintained and performed. Any of the new rides/experiences were certainly cutting edge. The actors were are very professional and since we bought the express pass our waits were not too long.

We have been WDW APers for years but decided to also get UO passes as well since they offered 3 free months. Since we're blocked out until August at the other park, we decided to do a three day trip. The ease of getting the annual pass was a breeze and all CMs were pleasant and accommodating. It was my first time on a lot of rides (I visited once about 10 years ago), and Hagrid's did not disappoint. We were happy to get virtual queue passes to it, even when we did not arrive until almost lunchtime. One day we rode it about 4 times - although I will say that, on the fourth ride, the CM pulled us off the ride after we were seated to walk all the way back to the simulator to make sure someone in our party could fit into the seat. I find having to do this drill as everyone in the queue watched is unnecessarily humiliating - move it somewhere else! Social distancing was enforced and announcements were made while waiting in line as CMs using cameras could see when people removed their masks. We stayed at a hotel on property that was sub-par, but that's another review .. Definitely looking forward to using our passes again soon.

It was a beautiful day in Florida with my family it was 5 like my grandchild and my handicap son they where the first set of questions and the second step of questions where how was this park going to handle covit 19 before we entered the park we got there about 9:00 in the morning we where all brite eyed and bushy tail some of us where. We started at the main garage heading up to park it cost 25 dollars to park for the day we did this for 5 days with tickets with water park option on tickets and our tickets had to be used consecutively no gaps in the week straight our the tickets our no good . we where told the rules in line at customer's the mains entrance of the and garage. Must where a mask at all times unless you go to the rest areas they or eat choose you can. take them off if child 1 to 3 did not have to where a mask but if you have medical condition you did not have to either like my one son who is handicap i had to where his special blue and white band show he does not have to where one .because of his conditions that and have to carry a handicap pass around. my neck to show on the rides but there is. a but in everything we do in life .it is you must where a mask in the main line of the ride you our standing for that is everyone handicap our not even on the ride it self. only for the area can they not where a. mask he did not.so all the rules out of way and checking in with tickets we started our way to islands of adventure .with marvel rides like doctor d doom,spiderman, hulk,great start of the day kids love the rides here lots of eye candy the water rides our good,and Harry Potter area with haggard's add to the. mix family's new favorites even staff where great through all this covit 19 .it was so safe no problems on our end here one of the best places for your handicap child or adult i can not say any thing else about this park great job with your help and customs training thankyou for always reaching out to the people's fo what i seen hope they keep with this care for the long hall thankyou universal. For giving my handicap son and family a good time we will be manny more times keep up the good work and safety of all customer's so everyone a must to always in Orlando. All i can people go out and have fun here

I've been to Universal Studios many times, but never have I been as disappointed as I was this last time. Many employees were very rude. I almost wanted to tell them that they needed to go to Disney World to get an etiquette lesson. I understand that employees may be overwhelmed with Covid, but not being able to treat your guests correctly is an issue. My family was 6-8 feet away from two people in front of us. The lady complained that my son did not have his mask on (he sneezed in his mask) because he took it off to wipe his nose. She told the Male worker at the Hagrid ride. The worker asked us for him to put it back on, which he was in the process of doing so. When we got to the hand sanitizer (after putting it on all day with zero issues with employees), my husband's hand was dry and he asked if he really had to have it. He wasn't mean about it. He was very nice. The girl told him yes, so he did. He put it in his hands and rubbed it in. She immediately said "sir, you wiped it off" and caused a fuss that was inexcusable. He told her that she could smell his hands and that it was wiped in. She continued to fuss loudly. The Male employee who previously asked for my Son's mask to be put back on (since he was wiping his nose from sneezing) came over and loudly TOLD US to get out of the line and we had to leave. We asked him why and he had zero answers besides being a jerk and telling us to get out of line loudly again. We asked for his name and he refused. We asked his manager for his name and she refused to give it. This is very unprofessional. We did end up riding the ride but to cause an inexcusable commotion was ridiculous. The staff was horrible. Had there been a serious issue, I wonder how they would have dealt with it, but they were horrible. The service was horrible the last day we were there as we were there for 4 days. I've never had treatment like this before at any Park and I cannot believe Universal would employ such horrible people.
Amazing, everyting about it is great. Transformers ride is superb, MIB also great, in fact it's all brilliant, Diagon Alley is by far the best. A must do when visiting Orlando

I thought long and hard about this review. Do I post do I not?! Does it matter?! So here it is. The issue I have was the height for the rides. No no I am not wanting my child unsafe but I read the height requirements for my son as this was a trip for him since we did Disney for my daughter. He loves dinosaurs, super hero(hints the spider web in his hair in sport of Spider-Man), sharks, and more things interest him there than Disney. So I check and see most the rides I think he will enjoy and take note of the height requirements. I also take him to the doctor in February for his 4year old check up and made sure he was the height he needed to be before even thinking of booking and planning this vaca. Finally after knowing he was tall enough and knowing the cost we book a June vaca. Note I took him in February to the doctor and he was 1/4inch taller than what he needed to be and of course he only could grow as June approached! So we arrive and we did both parks and my son cried in sadness as I did too(while he wasn’t looking cause I walked away as my husband consoled him) but only out of rage that as a parent I did all I could to make this go as planned for him! At one point we went to the line that measured him and ok’d him but once we arrive to get on the ride they brought another measure stick and it was literally an inch different. I had one of the ride people walk back with me to the beginning of the line and we all saw the difference and she literally said “ you will Have to take this up with a manager as I am to go off this measure.” I was shocked as so was the other guest in line who witnessed this. This particular ride was the Popeyes water ride. I feel I wasted my money his trip wasn’t all it should be. I feel the park took something from us which is our great experience we should have been able to witness as parents and he live and remember as a child. We live 17hours away had to take 2 days to get there with the cost of a layover hotel and this place needs to keep that in mind and check that all of their ride measure sticks are correct and match their online postings. Also I think they should bring back the jaws ride. It is better than fast and the furious in my opinion which was one of the few he got to do.

Seems silly to write a review of such a well known place but this is worth taking the time to do. I don’t know if I have seen any other business taking COVID so seriously. I was not worried for my safety even once. They actually took our temperatures and took their time to look at them and look at us. They gave us hand sanitizer before EVERY ride and wiped everything down EVERY TIME! No noses sticking out of masks for guests or workers and they carefully seated everyone to keep social distancing. A+ Universal, we were impressed!!

Right now the wait times are nothing. If not scared of getting CV, now is time to come. The parks are super clean and they take the mask wearing seriously. We have watching people spray down everything multiple times daily. We normally stay at one of main resorts to get Express passes but switched to sapphire falls since not busy and saved tons of money. No need for Express most rides are walk ons even if they say 20 or 25min wait. The mummy usually says 20mins but it's a walk on. Hagrids is only one that is virtual line but throughout day can get multiple rides. We have ridden hagrids over 20 times this week. Insane.

This was a family 👪 trip and the ages ran from 7 to 80 (me). I brought our own mobility scooters for my wife and I. That helped because there is a lot of walking 🚶. The park was not very crowded so that was nice. The old folks even road Spiderman and Jurassic Park. The only bummer was the shows were closed and for the price I was disappointed 😞.

How Can you rate something so unique and excellent as Universal Orlando resort.. It was Absolutely amazing, theillibg and breathtaking. We vane all the way from Dennark and will definitely come back. Second to none!

We visited during the pandemic. I was highly impressed with all the staff was doing to make things safe. Lots of social distancing, staff are giving you sanitizer, they are cleaning rides. Crowd levels were pretty low for us at least. I felt pretty safe there and had a great time.

Universal did a great job with keeping the parks clean! Here are the things they did: - Morning parking is every other space, so when we got out of our car, we are distanced from other cars. Eventually the spots are filled, as there are cars next to us when we return. - temp check upon entry - Continuous disinfecting of moving walkway railings. There are people at one end of each walkway, continuously wiping the railings - 6ft social distance on most places - using ID (instead of fingerprints) for the ticket identification - virtual lines for long lines, so even if you wait, most of the waiting is outdoor. The queue move swiftly indoor, limiting the time spent in a crowd indoor - 12 ft distance on indoor queue, often skipping a row, so you are always at least 6ft away from other parties - mandatory hand sanitizer prior to boarding every ride - roller coaster: roughly 3 rows apart between parties - theater like seating (shrek, bourne, etc): at least 3 seats apart between parties and every other row seating - compartment ride (hogwarts express, gringotts, simpson, spiderman, etc): one compartment per party. - Rides are sprayed after every rides. - Most store doors are open to minimize touchings - door knobs, surfaces, railings are wiped often - order food via app and we take the plates from the tray to minimize touching - everybody wears masks inside the park - some decor are removed to provide more space for people - reduced crowd, I am not sure if this is intentional. There might be a crowd entering the park, but once inside, the crowd dispersed throughout the park.  We had a great time there and felt safe. Thank you Universal! We especially love the Wizarding World of Harry Potter, the low crowd really enabled us to enjoy the details of Hogsmeade & Diagon Alley.  And Bourne Stuntacular is really awesome! They just opened last week and it is a must see!  I hope this helps with your decision whether to go during this time!

I’ve been going since a little girl and it’s always the best experience. I’ve seen this place transform over those years in so many ways and it only gets better and better. Due to COVID my trips have slowed, and events have been cancelled but that’s okay because they do a great job keeping you connected and in the loop. I went recently after the state lockdown and while it did feel a little weird, they did an amazing job ensuring guest wore their mask properly, social distancing was in full effect and the trip was still just as fun as ever. Wait times weren’t too long and the cleaning and disinfecting after rides or throughout public areas were on point!! I always do Universal first then head over to islands for the more thrilling rides.

I’m a larger fellow sitting at around 5’11 and weighing around 300lbs. Many of the thrill rides were inaccessible to me. I spent thousands between tickets and hotels and food and transportation and when I asked for a partial refund because I couldn’t access nearly any of the rides I was interested in I was told that because it was so late in the day they were unable to help me. But it took nearly the whole day walking around and waiting In line to even find out that I was too big for the rides in the first place!

Stayed at the Sapphire Falls, great choice, and easy access to the parks by boat. Purchased a 3-day pass and for 2 of us around $600.  June 8th was the first of 3 days. Was nice having a ticket where we could bounce back and forth between the two for 3-days.  Just opened I believe a few days prior. May have been a bit more chaotic..so new for everyone and having to deal with COVID. Precautions were taken everywhere....everyone was masked up and hand sanitizer at every turn.  I have not been to Universal since they first opened...so yes, things have defiantly changed. We did enjoy the parks being quiet, with the heat and having to wear a mask, at times it got a little overwhelming.  Many attractions have very little wait times, so nice. The downfall of COVID, parks closed early (I believe there was a curfew in effect also). We are huge Disney people and night time is the best...so we were looking forward to all the lights of the evening hours. No parades and much of the other entertainment was canceled. But still, much to do and see. As time goes...I am sure more this will open  This was a last-minute trip, because all of our other choices kept on getting canceled. I did not get to do any research in this area...but I am still glad we got to see and enjoy Universal.  My only real "huge" gripe. and this pertains to attraction anywhere....WHY do you feel the need to charge SO much for water.... I know you have fountains. ...but warm water and not the best tasting 😞.

Most of the rides they did good at keeping 6 ft apart. Except Jimmy Fallon escape from New York. Multiple kids working there said to stay 3 feet apart! I of course moved 6 ft from person in front of me and young girl working told me to move closer, needs to be 3 feet away. I tried to explain safe distance is 6 feet but she didn’t listen or care. I was amazed in today’s environment multiple kids running the ride thought 3 feet was the requirement. This is too important to have teenagers running the place. With all the unemployment in the state, can’t they hire more adults?

We bought military universal tickets $204 an adult for both parks and it was OK, the first day and yes social distancing was in full force. The food app. doesn't work in every restaurant a fast pass was useful it wasn't to crowded. The next day was better but for what I paid the fun just wasn't like universal fun. I 'd recommend waiting unless you want lots of peace and quite.

We did the two parks in one day with three teenage boys and had a blast. It wouldn't have been possible to get that accomplished if the crowds were normal (non-Covid time). The park did a good job of keeping everyone safe and distanced while still providing a fun environment.  All of the Harry Potter rides were amazing and so much fun. There wasn't a thing we did all day that we didn't enjoy. Really glad we still made the trip.

Had Fass Pass from the Hard Rock Hotel.These are suppose to be good up to and on the day of check out. On our day of check out we stowed our bags and headed to the park. The first ride was to be the HULK coaster. Showed the Fast Pass Hard Rock Room card and the attendant said it was expired and took the card and told me to go to guest services if I wanted to "get ahead of the line" as if I had done something wrong manner.Needless to say lost 2 hrs park time lost doing the social distancing thing while wondering what went wrong. Long story short also it rained half the day so we missed alot of new rides because of someones error. I have saved alot and sacrificed alot to make this vacation happen for my family and park personnel seem to not care one bit.

My family and I enjoyed a wonderful time at both Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure. Both theme parks did an excellent job with social distancing and ensuring people wore their masks in a friendly reminder sort of way. There was no overcrowding. They offered virtual lines for some of the more popular rides like Hagrid’s Motorbike Adventure but that too was great as we just showed up at our self chosen time and proceeded to the ride. While the line was long when we returned to this one particular ride it was very very quick. Each ride operator delivered each rider with a fresh pump of hand sanitizer prior to getting on the ride. I felt both parks did an excellent job of offering a great experience with germ control! FYI I am very particular when in comes to cleanliness and both parks exceeded my expectations. So grab your mask and head out to the parks and enjoy a day in the Florida sunshine once again.  Me and my family can’t wait to go back!

This trip was taken shortly after USO reopened during the Covid19 pandemic. The whole facility and staff made sure that EVERYTHING was sanitized and clean. Face masks are required and temp checks are done before you step foot in the park. Some stores and events were shut down but that was understandable. The longest we had to wait for a ride was 55 mins which was the Kong ride, all others were less than 20 mins. Spent a lot of time in WWoHP as we usually do and never get bored. Didn’t get to ride Hagrids ride as a bad lightning storm rolled in. The only thing we didn’t like was the shorter operation hrs (9-7). We understood why though. All in all, USO and IoA is an amazing vacation spot and can’t wait to return.
Additional procedures for safety very good, some guests could use reminders about masks being on. Overall felt safe and had a lot of fun.

We are a family with adult children. All of us are fortunate survivors of mild cases of coronavirus. As a celebration of our good health, we spent the July 4 weekend at Universal Orlando and Islands of Adventure. Both were immaculate. Yes the face masks and hand sanitizer can be a pain, but they are necessary to keep everyone at the parks safe. We thought the staff did great in enforcing safety measures. Lines were short and the parks weren't crowded! We had a perfect weekend enjoying most of our favorite attractions and those wonderful Harry Potter fish 'n chips.

2nd trip since reopening. (Annual pass holders) Visited over 4th weekend. Lots of hand sanitizer and 6ft markers and always have ur mask on...got the cooling covers u can wear around ur neck that keep u cool and we soaked them in ice water occasionally which helped with the heat, because honestly from 8am until noon was all we could endure with masks in the FL heat-I dunno how the employees tolerate it. We hit the pools mid day. And sadly since the parks are closing early it wasn’t worth getting changed and going back to the park for our express passes that start at 4pm...we have basically lost that perk, previously we had 5-6 hrs express pass. We did enjoy an almost empty park. And thanks for the AP line-this needs to stay. No shade if ya wanted to line up for Bourne, so with a mask on in the heat-couldn’t do it. Why does this NOT have a virtual line? Overall we always have fun here. Enjoyed Sunday morning in an almost empty park.

Be forewarned, if you are a person size, as I am, you will not be able to ride 50% of the rides. I can ride every ride at WDW without issue, the rides at Universal were made for people no taller the 5' 6" and under 250 lbs. If you are outside of those dimensions you are out of luck as far as rollercoasters, or strap in rides go. It's a shame their main competitor can accommodate individuals of all shapes and sizes, but Universal decides to cut out people of size. If you have a choice, go elsewhere.

Universal needs a face lift. Buildings looked “tired”. Park attendance was minimal, hardly any one walking around. I guess because everyone else was at Harry Potter land in Islands of Adventure. Universal looked very much like a concrete fair. Not many rides which interested me. Was disappointed in atmosphere.

First let me say that there should be separate parking costs to just walk through City Walk if you don't plan on going to the theme parks but anyway. Nothing was really open when we arrived. Yes it was during COVID-19 so I wasn't surprised but I felt like I wasted money on parking. MASKS ARE REQUIRED, there are sanitizing stations throughout and temperature checks. I appreciated the staff enforcing proper masks wearing as well. You could only pull the mask down while eating or drinking. We thought maybe we would go to Islands of Adventure but with the Florida heat plus masks - we will try that again hopefully next year.

Universal Studios We were there when the park first opened with all the Covid 19 measures in place. I work as a NP and I was very impressed!! There was always someone cleaning and sanitizing on every attraction. Note: Face masks are required!  I highly suggest staying at one of the on site hotels. We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel and it was very convenient walking to the park or catching a boat! We also were able to enter the park early. At the time we were there, a 7:00pm curfew was in place. Check before you arrive and try to make reservations especially for dinner.  Download the app so you can schedule ride times. I would also get the dual park ticket option.  We had a fantastic time and sincerely hope you will too!  Safe travels!

We didn't wait longer than 30 minutes to ride any ride. Crowds are small due to the fear of covid. This made it great for us, as we were able to ride every ride in both parks, some twice, in a day and a half. They do require face coverings which was the downside. It is hot and uncomfortable wearing them. They have employees walking around monitoring that will tell you to get your mask up over your nose. You are also required to use hand sanitizer before boarding every ride. If you're not worried, now is the time to go.

We spent a fun filled day following UA’s strict social distancing guidelines. They are running at 1/4 capacity to avoid crowding. All the rides are open. The only negative was the horrid fast-food burger and fries we ate at one of their app places. We were under the impression that these were the only we could use but it was an erroneous impression since many sit-down restaurants and food trucks started to open up after twelve but it was too late. The app should strive to explain that the fast-food was not the only choice.

We enjoyed visiting this park, even during the Covid crisis. It was not crowded as capacity was limited. With three kids including a four year-old we were able to enjoy pretty much all there is to do and see. Wearing a mask and adhering to the health and safety protocols we felt pretty safe. The Hollywood roller coaster is an absolute must.

Only one of the best places to go and visit without a doubt since, as they say in the other opinions they have seen so far, it is fantastic because it has the attractions of most of the movies and some for Children, Youth, and even adults.

My favorite part of this attraction was how safe I felt being in the park amid the COVID-19 pandemic. They ensured that people wore mask and sanitized their hands before and after each ride. We were able to get on rides w/out extreme waits in line as the number of patrons was not excessive.

The park is super cool with great attractions. Ridiculously priced though, they nickel and dime you for everything. It's crazy lockers $2. To ride certain things. Drinks food all of it is insanely expensive. They need more shaded areas too. The mask requirement thing during Covid 19 is beyond annoying. Staff is very customer friendly though.

As part of our family holiday we visited Universal Studios and loved it. having visited the Shrek, Minions and Simpsons ride we queued for the Transformers ride. I loved it. A hug transformer fan I had my photo taken with Optimus Prime and then Bumble Bee came out. My favourite, I was caught up in the whole magic. I cannot fault any of the rides, but Transformers was my favourite. We enjoyed some ice cream and bought some souvenirs, the photos are really overpriced, but the staff will take photos with your phone and /or camera if you ask. I did buy some of the photos as souvenirs.

What a blast!! First time at the park! My family appreciated the obvious efforts of the staff to keep the park sanitized and covid safe. The patrons seemed respectful of the rules and guidelines. Lines all moved swiftly. Such a great experience.

We felt so safe here beause they are so diligent about wearing masks, using hand sanitizer before entering each ride, social distancing, and cleaning. There were team members everywhere standing by to answer questions also. We had purchased the express pass and one day two park ticket. We were able to get on every ride we wanted and eat breakfast and lunch by 1:30, and we reallt didn't need the Express pass except that we were trying to do both parks in 9 hours. We were in Orlando for a long weekend with only one day at Universal and one at Legoland, but I would certainy recommend you spend a more leisurely day at each of the three parks. We had heard reports of difficulty using mobile ordering, but at the Leaky Cauldron and the multi-food place in Springfield, we were escorted to our table by a TM who helped us mobile order. The highlight was the single family experience at Ollivander's. My grandson was able to have the full wand experience by signing up for a timeslot, so someone in your party is guarenteed to be picked. Although there are a few rides I would skip (Fast and Furious, Shrek 4D, ) most were fun. We loved the Gringott's ride, the interactive wand stations, and Men in Black. We also loved the characters that were stationed everywhere, either on floats or platforms.

My partner and I were here a couple of years ago and were blown away. Universal Studios is significantly better than all of Disney. The rides and experiences are phenomenal, especially the vr rides. Would 100 percent recommend spending a few days here!

Great experience! Hardly any wait on rides. EVERYONE had masks. Staff was friendly and greeted us with hand sanitizer before entering any ride and ALWAYS reminded to pull masks up to cover nose etc. seriously I washed my hands a gazillion times per park policy. Lots of distancing and sanitizing observed.  Kids playground area was closed, but rides were operating. Lots of food stations had limited hours.  We enjoyed our experience and would recommend going now. Lots of memories made and had a blast. Walked through rows and rows of what would be wait lines sooo ya... now was a good time to go for us.

Our trip to Universal Studios was ok just average, I definitely think it would of been better without all Covid stuff going on as we had to wear a mask the whole time in the hot humid air however they do have sections where you can take a break from your mask. One thing that bothered me is that they do not do a good job explaining how things work there such as their app, we bought the tickets at the booth and the lady in the both was only interested in trying to up sale us. Hindsight I thought this is where she could of at least told us about the phone app that you can do many things on. I think if I would of known about the phone app right from the get go our experience would of been better. I will say that the staff did a great job with the social distancing they have it down and made us feel safe. One other thing they should update you on before you pay admission is what attractions are closed we were disappointed by this because we were looking forward to seeing everything! So in all they need to work on their communication other then that the park is fun and like I said if all the Covid stuff was not going on I think it would of been a lot better.

We just got back from a Florida trip and had a great time at Universal on June 14th. As we had limited time, we did the VIP group tour. I did the VIP group tour a year ago and compared to post-Covid, the experience was just as fun. If you are on limited time (say you can only spend a day at the parks), the VIP is a great option.  VIP sounds pricey, but when you add in all the benefits it's worth it. It's not just a fast pass, you're literally given front of line access to every ride during the tour (even on a slow day this will save hours of time). You also get breakfast and a full lunch included (starter, meal, dessert).  The main differences are first that you currently have to wear masks. If you've not worn one in a park like this all day, I recommend you try this out first. I recommend a highly breathable mask and it can't hurt to bring a motion sickness tablet if you get woozy, as it can take a little adjustment depending on the heat. Second, the tour guide used to be able to put your items in a backpack and now they have to be placed in lockers. Third, the buffet-style options of the past for food are now a sit-down service for each meal. However, you get more than your share of food, so I did not see this as an issue.  Finally, if you can get Paul for your tour I would highly recommend him! Paul had some great experiences and stories that made it another wonderful tour. He was so kind and an expert at gauging the group's mood and interest in terms of what we wanted to do during the day. I would be happy to do this tour again and especially with Paul.

We visited the park June 14th - 17th and had an awesome experience. Sunday was busier than the rest of the days, but even then it wasn’t bad. Having to wear a mask the whole time is a bit annoying, but you’re able to sit down and take a break from wearing them when eating / drinking, or in the U-Rest designated areas. We rode every single ride in both Universal Studios Resort and Island of Adventure, and the longest line that we had to wait in was 30 minutes. I highly recommend purchasing the refillable cups for drinks throughout the day. It’s worth the cost. I also recommend eating in a restaurant where you make a reservation and actually sit down to eat, instead of the cafeteria style restaurants. You will spend almost the same amount of money and eat much better food. Also, some of the rides require you to store your items in a locker. Here is something to remember with the lockers: IF the locker requires you to scan your fingerprint in order to access it, then you will need to store everything in the locker, including your cellphone, wallet, fanny pack, etc. If the locker requires you to scan your park entry ticket (whether it is a physical ticket or a mobile ticket on your phone) then you can wear a fanny pack on the ride, and/or keep your phone with you. Don’t lock your phone up if the locker requires you to use your ticket to unlock it after the ride. Otherwise, you will have to get assistance from an employee and show your ID once you get your belongings out of the locker. I learned this the hard way. :)

Staff is very unfriendly right now. I thought the lines would be faster because not that many people at the park but some rides take an hour still. You have to wear face mask all day in the heat. They say stuff to anyone that has it to low. You have to order food through your phone you can't go through line anymore. Definitely a waste of a few hundred bucks today wait til life is normal!!!!

Okay, so Universal totally stole Mr. Disney's idea. The plan from Universal was this: build an amusement park in Orlando and get patronage from tourists who were already here for Disney World. (You can tell I'm pretty loyal to the Mouse.) But I must say, I enjoyed my time here even more than my day at the Magic Kingdom during my last visit. These are big words, but here's why: -Crowd management is key. Unlike the Magic Kingdom, I never found myself flabbergasted at the amount of time I spend in line. Considering I was here during a holiday weekend, the lines really weren't bad at all! -Harry Potter. They have tripped the area dedicated to JK Rowling's illustrious franchise, and it is completely epic. The Hogwarts Express, the (overpriced but delicious) frozen butterbeer, the fish and chips at Hog Head's tavern, the new state-of-the-art VR-type rides, and the lights show on Hogwarts castle at night make for a completely magical experience.  There is too much to do here in one day! It's a billion theme parks in one! If you're in Orlando, you'd be a fool to miss this. And--unlike Disney World--the lines are so short that there is no fast pass nessisary.

Fun family time for all ages. Even my 5 year old could ride all the rides except 2. I would suggest get express pass then you have to wait at most 20mins. We have yearly passes so we will go many times. They took care of us even with covid -19 issues.

Our first time at universal studios was excellent! I was pleasantly surprised on all levels - specifically the employees. I have seen many reviews describing rude employees, but for the most part I experienced quite the opposite. Some of the rides were so fantastic that I did them a LOT - The Incredible Hulk coaster 14 times in one day, and Revenge of the Mummy 13 times. This was my first time visiting Universal. We didn’t eat much from the parks but what we did get to enjoy didn’t disappoint. (You HAVE to try the butter beer fudge at Huneydukes!) I am so glad I went during coronavirus - we never waited over 30 minutes for a single ride our entire trip. Having to wear a mask was a little annoying but honestly, I didn’t notice it much. Not to mention Volcano Bay is the best water park in the world. P.S - the employees working at the Hulk deserve a raise, especially Bailey!

Had a wonderful time at universal!! I felt safer there then in the grocery store from covid. Everything was spaced six feet apart. There are virtual lines and the employees were sanitizing nonstop. What a fun day got on every ride.
Universal is incredible. Clean park awesome rides fun for the whole family. Wish i lived in florida i would visit more often.
First time Halloween horrors was great second time more leisurely just as great. Definitely will come back again.

I should qualify this review with the fact that we went on the first day back from the covid outbreak. June 5, 2020. I understand they have to reduce their liability but the social distance crap got old fast. I highly recommend you DO NOT GO TO THESE PARKS until life gets back to normal. That is unless you like wearing a mask or really like EVERY EMPLOYEE nagging you to wear it properly or if you like being made to use hand sanitizer on every ride. (I refused after doing it a few times. I wasnt touching anything and it was drying my hands out). Not to mention that if you take out the 248 restaurants and 367 souvenir shops, there are literally only 6-7 rides for people over 56”. We had fast passes and rode everything we could/wanted to in 2hrs. So we did it again. And again until it got monotonous. Ive been to a great number of parks and i swear i was shocked at how little there actually was to do. We will be hitting up somewhere else next time we need thrill rides.

Being prepared and knowing what to expect is paramount to enjoying the new reality of a theme park visit. Temperature screening is quick. Face covering is required from the temp check forward. The only time face coverings may be removed is when eating (sitting at a table) or dirking. Pro tip- bring two or more face coverings per day, they will get wet, sweaty, and uncomfortable. I recommend two different types. The fishing neck and face guards are a great option to get a break from a mask. Most rides will require you to keep the covering on while riding. We did have one rogue employee tell us to put covering on while walking with a drink.  The major issue we found was a vast amount of misinformation and incorrect information. All queues have blue lines showing where to stand to ensure six feet or two meters from the party in front of you. This will cause queues to appear much longer than they are. All riders must use hand sanitizer prior to ridding each ride (great job Universal). There are also hand sanitizer dispensers after each ride and all over the park. They also spray and wiped rides between riders. Most rides will have rows between parties, this will cause long waits for key attractions. Attractions that require lockers have LONG waits for lockers. Restaurants are at 25 percent occupancy. This will cause long waits for tables. Use the app and pre-order to save hours.  There is no valet parking at the park or hotels.

I was one of first group who had a chance to sneak peak of new normal prior opening on June 5th to the public. First moment we walked in, I felt like coming back to the United States after September 11th. Tears were streaming down my eyes. Thanks Goodness for glasses and mask to hide my emotions. I personally think everyone who works in the park tries to do the best under the circumstances. I felt safe (germs wise) and didn't even need to use my sanitizer. I hope general public follows the instructions of the personnel: keep their distance, use sanitizer, and keep their masks on! We are all in this together!

I solely went to Universal to enjoy The Wizarding World of Harry Potter and it was an awesome experience! Dressing in my Hufflepuff garb, getting my own wand that can be used throughout the park, interacting with the world itself, and drinking a nice cold frozen Butterbeer were among the highlights. Our group was entertained all day, even those less interested in the book series. I'd love to return one day!
My roommate is the biggest fan and in the summer we went there for like a week to explore and I must say, it's a very cool place. All of the kids are going crazy here.

Don't go expecting Disney, it's not, but good in it's own way. Lots to see and I mean a lot. Seems almost disjointed, so, look up what all there is beforehand so that you know.  What was an A+: is Harry Potter (Wizarding World of) with the 3 broomsticks restaurant (food excellent) and all of the decor. The hogwarts ride in the big school - castle was an amazing ride mixed with roller coaster and 3d all in one! man is it fun. Butter beer carts everywhere, the train between parks (Hogwarts Express) were all amazing. Teens loved it and seemed very authentic. Knockturn alley is almost impossible to find, but cool in and of itself.  men in black ride is fun. Juraisic park portion is fun, especially meeting blue and boat ride - wait for the end of the ride, better than Disney's splash mtn. Dr Seuss land is pretty amazing. King Kong ride is worth the wait and another amazing 3d ride, where kong fights over the top of the bus.  Gru came by and it was fun. ET ride is good. Transformers is good. The candy factory by old jaws site.  Super hero area is pretty cool with heroes coming out and riding around, letting pictures being taken. If you like really fun roller coaster rides, go on the "Hulk!" It is fast, thrilling, upside down shoot you into the sky type ride.  Overall a good experience. Plan on spending money. Plan on a lot of time. On equal par with Disney for fun and memory making.

We visited with our 2 young kids prior to visiting the Disney parks. It is definitely geared towards older kids, teens and adults but there was still plenty for young kids as well. Everyone loved it and the food in the Wizarding World of Harry Potter was excellent!

Wow, it's already reopening! Can't wait to return! Were getting a 3 day pass soon! This place is amazing. So much better than Disney. Stuff for the whole family. Gonna take my mom and sister for the first time, I'm sure they will love it! The staff are amazing and the food is surprisingly cheap and delicious. Rides are SOOO fun! City walk is also really neat. And that's already open. Amazing times can't wait to return! Definitely the best theme park in america! Because when you wanna woah, there's only one place to go!

They have 3 parks; Universal Studios Florida, Universal’s Islands of Adventure and Volcano Bay. Volcano Bay is a water park, other 2 are theme parks. If you are a crazy Harry Potter fan, you MUST visit both the theme parks. We went during a week day and were able to finish both parks in 2 days without express pass. There's a Hogwart’s Express train that takes you from one park to another but for that you need ticket to both parks which allows you to visit both parks on same day. Butter beer in the Hogwart’s castle is a must. I would suggest finishing Harry Potter rides in Universal’s Islands of Adventure first as soon as you enter Universal, lines start growing between 11 & 2. You WILL get completely wet in Popeye’s ride, there is a dryer outside the ride for a $5. Volcano bay water park has multiple tube rides, they check your weight before you ride so that it is safe to ride. Aqua Coaster ride was the highlight. It is a roller coaster water ride which allows 2 to 4 riders per tube. They have a wave pool with beach like sand and chairs. There's a lazy river and a crazy river, you have to wear life jacket. It has a 80 degree slide from top of volcano mountain. You stand inside a tube and the floor beneath your legs opens. It scratches your back, I could see everyone’s back getting red rashes. There's a Bus stand for Universal between universal studios entrance and universal parking. Free shuttle buses run to universal hotels. There is also a free shuttle for Volcano Bay park.

Just mind blowing. They have 3 parks; Universal Studios Florida, Universal’s Islands of Adventure and Volcano Bay. Volcano Bay is a water park, other two are theme parks. If you are a crazy Harry Potter fan, you MUST visit both the theme parks. We went during a non holiday season in February during a week day. We were able to finish both the parks in two days without taking express pass. There is a Hogwart’s Express train that takes you from one park to another but for that you need ticket to both parks wherein you can visit both the parks on same day. Butter beer in the Hogwart’s castle is a must. I would suggest finishing Harry Potter rides in Universal’s Islands of Adventure first as soon as you enter Universal. Go as soon as park opens, lines start growing between 11 to 2. Shreik in Universal Studios Florida was a literal torture, we did not like it. You WILL get completely wet in Popeye’s ride, so make sure you carry additional clothes for the ride. There is a dryer outside the ride for a $5. Volcano bay water park was just fun. It has multiple tube rides, they check your weight every time before you ride so that it is safe to ride. Aqua Coaster ride was the highlight. It is a roller coaster water ride which allows minimum of 2 and maximum of 4 riders per tube. They have a wave pool with beach like sand and chairs. There is a lazy river that you can relax on a tube. There is also a crazy river with water flowing at a faster rate, you have to wear life jacket to go in. There is a 80 degree slide from the top of volcano mountain. You stand inside a tube and the floor beneath your legs opens and you slide down fast. Almost every one complained that it scratches your back, I could see everyone’s back getting red rashes. Overall universal studios was a total fun. I highly recommend if you are visiting Orlando.  There is a Bus stand for Universal. This place is between universal studios entrance and universal parking. Free shuttle buses run to universal hotels. There is also a to and fro free shuttle for Volcano Bay park.

I liked when I went to this theme park. It holds up to its name that when you ride the attractions in the park it does feel like you're part of the movies. The one store I liked going into was the Ciber Store that sold movie props from classic Universal Movies.

Omg !!! Universal studios is absolutely amazing !!! Beat DIsney by far for my whole family . What an incredible day of fun , so exciting . The themes and the certain lands were so awesome so well done and creative . Simpsons land , not a big Simpsons person myself but man did they ever do this right . I loves it ! Every ride is unbelievable and sooo much fun . The whole atmosphere was out of this world that great . E.T. Well I’m a huge ET fan and couldn’t wait to come and buy some et stuff . And I think I bought it all ( stuffed ones, sweaters, tshirts, pen, towel, socks , lanyard .... omg made my day and the ride still one of the best I have been on . They did it justice for sure and you can’t just go on once believe you will ride it again and again it’s that great . The rock it roller coaster amazing ! Pick your own song and have a hell of ride ( limp bizkit does it justice Haha ). The mummy ride incredible , I mean everything is just that much fun and that incredible . And we waited 5mins-20 mins the longest how awesome is that . Can’t do that at Disney . Get the one meal pass definately worth it , you get fries burger and you can switch pop for a milkshake and pick a dessert ( like the big donut from the Simpsons and others definately worth the price . I really recommend it . We also bought the picture package which I probably didn’t get as much as I should of to make it worth it but oh well still worth it in the end got some family pics . And some places can take pic automatically without a person doing it . So I would recommend buying it . But definately don’t miss out it’s a must see and then a must see and do it all over again lol .

I asked my partner for adjectives to quickly describe the experience we had at Universal Studios Florida: Exciting, Imaginative, Transporting, Epic, American! Which actually does pretty much sum up this park. I was very excited about visiting Universal Studios because there is nothing really comparable in Europe. Suffice to say it does not disappoint! The park and its attractions are world class, from the huge thrill rides, down to the smallest details you notice as you are walking around, you are totally immersed in movie land!  As a big Harry Potter fan (and a Londoner) I was delighted by how accurately London was represented outside Diagon Alley and the seamless transition into the magical world behind the passageways. I use Kings Cross Station regularly, so to see a scaled down replica of it standing at the back of the park was very surprising. Even more surprising were the real to life announcements of trains to Peterborough, calling at Stevenage and Huntingdon! They have a team working on the attractions who seem to want not just to add some fun rides and thrills, they want to go above and beyond to present unique and joyful experiences.  Being located around a large lagoon meant it was very easy to get our bearings and to make our way around the park without too much foot traffic. We were lucky when we visited in that we had fairly low crowds, so never waited much longer than 20 minutes to get on a ride (apart from Gringotts)!  The food offering is fairly standard theme park grub, but there are a couple of stand outs such as Florean Fortescue's Ice Cream parlour (I recommend the peanut butter and strawberry ice cream sundae), Voodoo Donuts (which is actually just outside the park on Citywalk), and the frozen butter beer from the Fountain of Fair Fortune.  We ended up spending a lot longer at Universal Studios than we anticipated because we also had tickets for Halloween Horror Nights which made the visit unforgettable!  I cannot wait to go back next year and jump on all the rides again!

For anyone 7 years + thus is a great park, majority of rides are simulated adventures, over family had an amazing time. We can easily say this park was our favourite even over Disney. Staying at a universal hotel gave us quick access to park with no additional parking fees.  We thoroughly enjoyed every ride and the new harry potters section is so cool (I’m not a Harry Potter fan).  Will definitely be back.

were hoping to be coming back this year to this fabulous place we are bringing with us the whole family as we want them to experience this fantastic brilliant uplifting place we love it i urge every one visit at least once you will not regret it

Universal Studios was fun, a lot to see and extremely crowded. We allowed ourselves a full 12 hour day for the one park and discovered that we could of used even more time to do everything that we would of like to do. Some people paid extra to jump the line and if you have children or teens I would recommend this even though it does cost more. As any park bring your wallet!

I just read the review of the person who was complaining about the Fear Factor eating contest. All I can say is that I did it too, and it was great. I don't know what was wrong with that person who wrote the review, but it sounds like somebody who's a whiny baby. The milk was not actually sour, and it was mostly fish, and insects are good for you, as there are countries everywhere who eat them as their source of protein. There was nothing in that mixture that would have hurt anybody. They say what they say to get the ick factor from the audience, and it's all part of the show. If you can't handle something like that, then you shouldn't bother to enter the contest. It's called Fear Factor for a reason. The park was great, and I enjoyed my day, but entering the Fear Factor contest was the highlight of my day. It's true that all you win is a cup with free refills, but just being part of it was worth it. Right after that contest, I went and got on a roller coaster. It didn't turn my stomach at all.
Love universal, best parks in Orlando. Great rides, something for everyone.  Can't wait to return next year.

When we visited we were only supposed to go for 2 days but ended up going an extra 5 times during our 2 week stay. I have nothing bad to say about the parks. We went to universal, island of adventure and volcano bay. Because of coronavirus we have had to cancel our holiday for this year but are using the money to come back to universal next year. We are hoping to stay at one of their hotels because this also looked amazing. I would highly suggest buying the Coca Cola refill. You can have anything from water to fizzy drinks. Can’t wait to ride the Mummy again next year

Lots of amazing rides- especially simulator rides which was perfect for me as I don’t like rollercoasters. The theming is great and there is so much to see. Tickets are very pricey however you do get lots of rides for this. I did this and Islands of Adventure in one day so took the hogwarts express to here. The refill drink is worth the money. The shopping is great and we loved the shows. The park is so much quieter than Disney apart from the Harry Potter parts. These have such brilliant theming. Tip It takes over 10 mins to walk to where Lyft/Uber can pick you up so allow time for this. The espresso passes meant we did not queue for anything! You will have to sue free lockers for some rides to leave your bags but these are easy to use.

What an amazing day we had here, a group of six, we all really enjoyed our day at Universal Studios. Having not visited the park in six years we were excited to see what was new. We enjoyed the Fast & the Furious ride as it put us right in the center of the action. This park has fantastic roller coasters, characters, shows and street performances. The Diagon Alley area in the Harry Potter park is fantastic, where every little detail is spot on. There are also a lot of simulator type rides which are fabulous. There are lot of different food options spread throughout the park, so plenty of choice. Our favorite part of this visit was the Mardi Gras Parade, the costumes and the floats were breathtaking. There were so many beads being thrown into the crowd, we came home with heaps. A fantastic experience!

We visited Universal in January. We purchased the hopper pass solely for the Harry Potter Hogwart Exress between the parks. In addition the one experience we wanted to see was Jurassic Park. First of all, Jurassic Park was closed for updating. We accepted this, but it wasn’t noted prior to purchasing our tickets. Next, the Hogwart Express was closed for planned maintenance, which is solely the only reason we purchased a hopper pass. There were other issues as well. The absolute inexcusable issue is that these items were sent to Universal in a letter in January. As of yet, we have not received a response to our concerns. Consumers deserve the respect of a response.

What a place!! There is so much to see and do! There is plenty to do and see for all ages. Staff are so friendly and very helpful. The Harry Potter section is well worth a visit only problem is you can not enter Hogwarts school. You can not walk around it as it is a ride. The prices have increased while we were there so bare that in mind and it is $25 for parking.
An amazing holiday that is fun for everyone. There is so much to do there, from roller coasters to live performances on stage. Definitely going back!

I went with my 33-year old daughter and her dad, and we had way more fun than we expected. There is so much to see and do; we were there for three days and it wasn't enough time. My favorite part of the park was the Harry Potter section. Even though I'm not a Potter superfan I still truly enjoyed that place. My only complaint and the reason I gave Universal Studios four stars is they need a shuttle service. Even though our hotel dropped us off at the entrance of the park, you then have a VERY, VERY,LONG walk to get to the main park entrance. After a long day that walk seemed even longer!

I’ve never seen a theme park like this one! You could spend every day here for a week and still not see it all! Wizarding World of HP was hands down my favorite. I enjoyed the Jurassic Park section also. I would love to see them offer cheaper tickets for smaller areas (passes strictly to Wizarding World, etc). Also, we stayed at a Universal hotel and despite taking the shuttle it was a LONG walk from the drop off location to Wizarding World! They need some kind of in park transportation?!

We were in Florida for the last two weeks of February. We enjoyed a three day park to park passport at Universal Studios. This gave us a day at each of the attractions. We also purchased the Fast Pass, as I have a disability that made waiting in lines painful. This was well worth the cost, as we spent little time in lines. The park was clean, bright, a little loud for my taste, but it didn't bother my son or husband. We enjoyed everything we could squeeze in each day. The rides/attractions are very interesting and fun, though my son was too large for all of the Harry Potter rides on both sides of the train ride, and that was the main reason that he went to Universal.He has Autism, and this was very distressing for him. We found lots of various souvenirs to purchase, including our family crests and histories! My son worked on his key chain collection, and managed to get several items from the Harry Potter collection for his "House". We had a fabulous time, tried all different kinds of food, went on wonderful rides and attractions, saw amazing things, and can't wait to come back?

Where to begin! This place was incredible....The rides, the ambience, was all incredible. Less expensive than Disney, but really geared toward teens and above, a truly memorable vacation. Even being there when it was too hot and humid at that time, we still had a blast. Tips for travelers; the Universal Pass or staying in a hotel on property that offers the Universal Pass will really save you from standing in line too long.

We returned to Universal Studios Florida for a third time to experience Hagrid's Magical Creatures Motorbike Adventure ride, and it didn't disappoint! We've remained nothing but impressed at the detail of the attractions, there. We're consummately smitten with the Harry Potter attractions, but it doesn't stop there. This trip, we also braved Hurricane Dorian as it hit landfall. Fortunately, we were able to fly out before it got too bad. Extra tip: Try to get to the Leaky Cauldron™ in Diagon Alley™ for their breakfast. It is delicious and plentiful. Whether you want to gorge like Harry and Ron on their fresh scrambled eggs, sausage links, black pudding, English bacon, baked beans, grilled tomato, sautéed mushrooms and breakfast potatoes. Or, stay a 'Merican and dig out on some fresh scrambled eggs, breakfast potatoes, crisp bacon, and link sausage with butter croissant. The freshly baked flan of apples and oatmeal served with yogurt and fresh seasonal fruit was also a delight.
lovely place to walk round, queues a bit long for what we are used to, timing is everything here. kids enjoyed it.
Loved it here, even though I am in my late 50s. Didn't do all the ride but the ones I did were great.

My husband and I enjoyed our visit to Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure. It is fun to walk around the areas. The food isn't too expensive and the fast food ordering is well organized. The main draw for me was the two Harry Potter areas: Diagon Alley and Hogsmeade. I really got into the mood of the movies. The shops are fun to browse, and the shows were entertaining, especially the Beedle the Bard show, which I watches twice. Many of the shows have ASL interpreters. If you are a Simpsons fan, the Simpsons area was very fun, with Lard Lad, Quik-E-Marts, etc. The Simpsons ride was amazing. I almost wish the lines for the attractions were slower because the entertainment in the lines was very amusing. Even though I am too large for the Gringott's ride, the staff was kind enough to recommend that I walk through the line to see Gringott's bank lobby (fabulous) and some little shows along the way. Be sure to stop at the Knight Bus to chat with the shrunken head. The Jurassic Park area was very clever. It is next to Hogsmeade, so we went from one John Williams theme to another. There were lots of benches to sit on, some in the shade. Lots of walking just to get from the parking garage to the entrance of the park. To save money on drinks, bring a water bottle. There are drinking fountains near the restrooms.
I had a very great experience with my family. Even though we had to walk a lot we really enjoyed it and I recommend for you to go on a family vacation with the people you love here.

Universal is a full day out. The rides are mainly geared towards children 8+ and adults.  Parking is easy and costs $25, cost covers the whole day. Make a note of your parking space because the lot of huge.  The best area is Harry Potter, we are not fans but thought the area was very well visually designed with a lot to see. It’s easy to miss the entrance to the area, close to Kings Cross train station. Definitely worth trying the Butter beer, it’s sweet with an milkshake texture.  Harry Potter train was very good and recommended. You will need a 2 park ticket as the ride takes you to Adventure island’s park next door.  We didn’t have Express passes and managed to get on most rides easily in a day. Most rides no more than 20-25 mins.  A lot of the rides are 3D or simulator rides. Some great rides include: Transformers- simulator ride while is a very jerky but fun. Mummy - roller coaster in the dark Simpson’s - 3D simulator fun ride Men in black - shooting the Aliens while in a car ET - helping ET escape while on a bike Sherk is a show - good fun  Fast and furious was boring and not worth the wait.  Plenty of places to eat and drink, we chose to wait and eat at City Walk.

The parks are always great. We love all of the attractions. The crowds were very low due to the virus. Our trip was interrupted due to the covid 19 outbreak. The parks closed to the public after two days of our nine day trip , and I don't know yet how they are handling the situation. I hope they will honer our passes when we can return. I'll update everyone when I find out anything.

Like thousands I had our family spring break vacation planned to start by the week of March 17, and canceled due to the parks closure, and flights cancellations. Had booked Disney and Universal, both tickets and hotels paid in full. Requested refund by March 15th, and Disney + Marriott sent a refund to my credit card by NEXT DAY. Universal (tickets) and Hyatt (room) are still thinking about it 11 DAYS LATER. NO EXPLANATIONS, NO CONTACT.... That's how companies loose customers for good.

So much to do here. Lots of cool simulated rides. Lots of things to keep you happy all day long. Fun for all ages. Wear some good shoes because lots of walking and bring a disposible poncho in case of rain

We visited Universal Studios and Island of Adventure. This is the place to go if you are a Harry Potter fan for sure. Great parks and lots of fun. We are seniors and noticed that there are quite a few rides that we couldn't participate in. Since these parks are family oriented and we saw many families with grandparents it would be nice if there was some kind of monitary consideration for them. All in all a great time.
Loved going round Universal, they have put a lot of thought and detail into their streets and rides. Spent an extra day (than planned) here as we enjoyed it so much.

The classics are still here - Revenge of Mummy, MIB and SImpsons, which now has been expaded to include eateries. Linked by the Hogwarts express to I of A there is the Gringotts ride to give you a taster of HP - its a great ride! Rip Ride for the daring - 100% virtical rise and a drop that will literally take you off your seat!! It's quieter here than I of A - so you can pretty much do everythnig you wish. But what is Fast & Furious all about - how can Vin Diesel be larger than a helicopter????

I was shocked at how disgustingly dirty this park was. When one pays as much as one does for admission, you at least expect the restroom trash bins to be emptied. They were overflowing, the sanitary bins in the stalls were stuffed and overflowing, there was urine on the floor - and the "Sharps" bin was full to overflowing. Just nasty.

This park is all types of fun, friendly staff and a ton of things to see. I enjoyed all the things they offered. Universal has spared no expense when it comes to quality. The paved roads, the buildings, bathrooms, automatic runway, food, attractions and staff was top quality.
We had such a great time taking a group of 160 students from Texas there last week, and really enjoyed all the rides. My two favorite ones have to be the Rockit, and The Mummy Returns!

Universal used to be my favourite park, however now every single ride is a similar 4D experience -- typically some moving car, 3D screens, and at least one moment where you'll get hit with a squirt of water. Wish they would offer some more varying experiences. Still, the rides are a lot of fun.
We go to Universal every time we go to Orlando and Disney World. This year we found Universal was a better time by far than Disney.
Enjoyed the park but after 5 hours there the 3D rides became too much for us all, majority of rides are 3D and it just a bit much but that said some of them are awesome
AMZING great place to go family friendly would go again the foods good the hotels clean. Most magical place in earth

Just like adventure island this park is all types of fun, friendly staff and a ton of things to see. We were lucky enough to be there for the Mardi Gras parade which was spectacular, the music the floats filled with guests from the park all dressed up throwing beads to everyone the amazing dancers and stilt walkers.

The big attraction for us was Harry Potter. The park has 2 separate areas devoted to HP:- Hogwarts & Diagon Alley, connected by the Hogwarts express. Firstly the train is very authentic with a different video/window view in each direction - the corridor windows also show images passing. I chickened out on Hagrid's ride the first day, but after other rides I figured I(in my 70s) could handle it if on the bike. Yup, no problem, just watch what is coming ahead. The Quiditch ride purportedly takes guests to the quidditch pitch from the school. It is more a video simulation with tipping & turning. A short segment in the dark does NOT have any violent movements. Diagon Alley is even more of an immersion invert convincing vintage London. The Gringott's ride is excellent. The queue through the bank offers photo ops of an excellent lifelike simulation. The route of the ride is not identical to the movie but similar & therefore fresh. Again a video sim with turning tipping cars. A definite "don't miss". The approach from the opening brick wall is the best for pics of the Dragon spouting flame. Schedule - every 10min warning dragon noises to get camera ready. MIB was also very good. Spiderman was well orchestrated but a bit improbable. Transformers was excellent, but so quick changing I would have to do it twice to review. Kong. Oh Kong, we queued for 20 min & left after" a brief interruption" changed to long. Later in the day we got to within sight of the cars when it broke down again after an hour in line. Of course we felt cheated when we left.

My wife and I are in our late fifties and enjoyed 2 of the 3 Universal Parks. We did not go to Adventure Islands due to time restrictions and prefer beaches instead. This was our first time to Universal but have been to all the Disney parks in the past. My wife is not big on Roller Coasters but she enjoyed all the 3D rides which pleasantly surprised me because for the most part I really enjoyed them also.There were plenty of eating options and the parks there laid out well.There were some long lines but nothing to crazy. I can go on about our favourite rides but that would be a matter of opinion.Suffice to say we feel although it can be quite pricey, we had a great time and felt it was worthwhile experience.

A visit to this place can certainly turn back the clock as a 62 year old kid once thru the gate I was running about like a teen-ager if you can stay in one of the park hotels worth the extra money because you save on parking and. The free fast pass is invaluable as well as the transport and early entry

We went to Universal Orlando for 2 days with a park hopper pass. We had fun but less so than other parks.  There were some great rides with our favorites being Revenge of the Mummy, Escape from Gringotts and Transformers. However, we found the park relies too much on 3d rides than other parks including Islands of Adventure. You have Jimmy Fallon's Race Through NY, Fast and Furious Supercharged, The Simpsons Ride, Despicable Me Minion Mayhem, Shrek 4D.  If you experience motion sickness, this may not be the best park to go to.
I love universal and they nail it. This review is in hopes that they see how unhappy and insulted park goers are by this. I've had a better time passing kidney stones. Get it together, Universal.

We spent 14 days in Florida and enjoyed Disney and Universal Studios. As for queue times and the amount of people we found Universal a lot more bearable than the Disney parks.  The new Hagrids coaster was amazing, we knew the queue time was going to be excessive so we got there early as soon as the gates opened. There was already a 90 minute wait at 8.30am so we decided to do the single rider, well worth it if not fused about being with your own party. It is also interesting to see the way thrill rides are heading such as King Kong Skull Island and Fast and the Furious, the King Kong ride was a way better experience than Fast and the Furious, the wait time for this ride was very long and the ending was somewhat disappointing. Harry Potter world is amazing from the characters to the overall land, not to forget the Butterbeer.  We also spent half a day at Volcano Bay which is the new water park. WOW !, this beats Blizzard Beach by far and just a whisker past Typhoon Lagoon. I can imagine during the summer months the queues could be pretty unbearable but the weather played ball for us and we could get on most of the rides within 10 - 20 minute wait. Taputapu is a great idea and I think many theme parks could learn alot from this, you just tap it against the ride you want to do and when you get a reminder just head back to your allotted time, easy !!.  Not only do you get to do a lazy river but you also get a crazy river, which had be be done a couple of times.

So we came here because we had a cheer competition to attend and decided we’d make the most of trip and stay at one of Universal’s premier resorts so we could get free express passes to skip the lines. We also purchased Dining passes since there is 5 of us, 3 children and 2 adults which my son son who is 10 is charged as an adult. That is $69.95 per person per day for the full dining plan. We purchased 2 days worth. I thought that would help me save money rather than paying the overpriced food at the park but I wish I just would have paid while at the park because we would have paid less. If you do the math on what I just said for the dining passes it comes up to $700 for 5 people in 2 days. When I added up all the money of what we actually ordered with our passes including some expensive meals at Margaritaville 2 nights in a row with some meals that cost over $20 a pop, it only came up to like $495. So really I feel like I’ve been robbed of $200. It’s all good, I know now. Thanks Universal for everything that you do to overcharge families. Everything else about the trip was great, but I don’t like the feel of not getting my money’s worth or feeling cheated which is what I do in this situation.

as usually both parks were awesome we made sure to buy the park to park hopper so that we could ride the train back and forth. Hagrids was so very awesome we got to ride it twice and was so worth the wait each time!
Everything has been given lots of thought, as far as people's needs. Lots of food, hotels, and the rides are fantastic. Lots of good suveniers. Staff very helpful.
Universal Orlando was lots of fun and the rides are awesome. All of the Harry Potter attractions are top-notch and very authentic.

Found this was more of an adult oriented park I loved the 3D aspect of all the rides that I went on although I would have gone on the big roller coasters if I was younger.The Harry Potters Diagon Alley and the train ride to Hogsmeade to Hogwarts was excellent ,also found the food choices much better than Disney.Make sure you get the fast passes on your ticket as it cuts out waiting in line,expensive but worth it.

We traveled with three teens. The Harry Potter fans could have spent both days in Hogsmeade and Diagon Alley. It is detailed and true to the books. Hagrid’s ride was everyone’s favorite and limes were reasonable over the lunch hour. The child who is not a Potter fan rode roller coasters instead. However, there are not many real roller coasters at these two parks. Most of the rides are 3D simulations. One kid liked them but the rest of us got tired of it after a while. There is plenty to do and see for two days. Take ear plugs. The story set ups in the lines are loud, the sound effects on the rides are loud, even the roller coasters have speakers blasting music in the car (when did roller coasters start needing music to make it fun?). We left the park and ate at City Walk and that is loud, too. The light show at Hogwarts is fantastic
Worst experience of my life. Rude staff. Long waits for attractions. Seems like miles between hand sanitizer

We love Universal. Have visited several times now, and it never gets old. The lines weren't overly long, which was great. We skipped the Transformers ride as the wait was super long, and had to wait longer than expected for Fast and Furious as it broke down temporarily while we waited in line. The ride wasn't even that exciting when it was all said and done. We left it feeling like that was it? We really enjoyed the shows at the park. Make time to watch the Beat Builders, Fear Factor Live and The Horror Makeup Show. Highly recommend the Makeup Show, not at all like it sounds but hilarious.. The host and guest were very funny, and made it worthwhile. We also watched the parade and checked out the Tribute store which was a nice new added feature.

WOW! What an amazing theme park. I was here with my husband and three children in February 2020. We had a 5-day multi-park Universal pass, and we still didn't get to see and do everything we wanted to because there is just so much fun to be had! We already can't wait to go back.  Highlights: - If you like thrill rides, you will not be disappointed! Don't miss the Hulk coaster. My husband and I are huge roller coaster fans and we have been on dozens all over Canada and the US. We even got engaged on a roller coaster! The Hulk coaster ranks right up there with the best of them because of its speed and duration. - The Harry Potter World is beyond what I could have imagined. My two older children and I are huge Harry Potter fans, and we had been told that the park was incredible, but it's even better that I was expecting. It's just like stepping into the movies or books. Everything down to the last detail has been thought of and is themed exactly as it should be. And the rides too, WOW! - There was plenty for my youngest child to do too (age 2). She enjoyed meeting all of the characters, and I liked that we didn't have to wait in a huge line to meet them unlike at Disney World! There are also plenty of surprisingly fun smaller rides for young children. - The child swap system is genius! It allows you to ride the big thrill rides even if you have a small child with you. You simply split your group in half, and while the first half enjoys the ride, the others wait in a comfortable air-conditioned room. Then, you get to swap places and the second half of your group gets on the ride without waiting in line again. It worked like a charm every time, and the child swap rooms always had some sort of movie playing or other entertainment to keep kids from getting restless. They even featured water fountains and change tables. A lot of thought and planning went into the child swap system and it was definitely appreciated! - Despite being fairly busy, we were amazed at how quickly the line ups moved for all the rides. Even better is that almost all of the longer line ups featured themed entertainment along the way, so the waits were much more enjoyable. - Even with heavy use, the restrooms were always surprisingly clean and well stocked. They even smelled nice! - The food in the park is a bit pricey, but there are lots of options available and some of them are quite reasonable. We found several good places to eat, all with different menu options and themes. If you want to pay a bit less, walk across to City Walk and you'll find great quick-eats options. - The staff at Universal's parks were incredible. Everyone was friendly and helpful, and one performer from the Mardi Gras celebration even went out of her way to dance with and entertain my toddler! My daughter was absolutely thrilled.  Overall, my family was so impressed with everything at Universal Orlando. It was just non-stop fun and we cannot wait to go back!

Visited Universal Orlando park for 3 days last week. The park was not to crowded but the temperatures were in the 90 degree range for 2 of the 3 days. We are not coaster riders and high speed ride types but all of the other rides were really enjoyable. The Harry Potter sections of the park were the most enjoyable and consumed the majority of our visit. Overall a fantastic visit and am looking to return sometime in the future with the grandchildren.

We were at both parks at Universal last week. The CDC is stating that hand washing is important in the fight against the Coronavirus. I was surprised that there was no hot water in the restrooms in either park that our family visited.

Had not been in 15 years, and took my 8 year old son for first visit. Unlike Disney, didn't have to say excuse me 15 millions times a day. Crowd was busy, but not uncomfortable. Food underwhelming, but City Walk restaurants looked tasty. Loved all the virtual simulator rides to enjoy as a family! Looking forward to Islands of Adventure visit over Spring Break!
Universal & Island of Adventure provide fun attractions for all the family and is a must if visiting Orlando.
Was pretty pricey for Canadians due to the exchange rate. $382 on short notice with exchange. Enjoyed the day but been there done that kind of visit!

My mom and I always love seeing the Animal Actors on Location show whenever we are at Universal Orlando. Not only is it such a great show, but the team members who greet and help get you seated are always so outstanding, especially Georgiana. She’s so wonderful with both children and adults, always going above and beyond to make sure you have a good time, even before the show gets started. Her customer service skills are top notch. Kudos to your company for hiring such a phenomenal individual.

This was our first trip to universal studios. Definitely a different feel from WDW. Could definitely do US and island adventure in one day with the express pass. Grounds are not as clean as WDW and just not as many rides. My teens and I prefer Disney.

This is a world class attraction with an amazing adventure between in the Harry Potter worlds. If possible, you need two days at these parks and you need a two park pass to experience everything. My only warning is that during Mardi Gras they charge for Valet, even for Premium Annual Pass holders and it is a NIGHTMARE trying to get your car at the end of the day! You are way better off walking to the parking garage (save time and money).
