A great day out in the Universal park. Always love the vibe you get from entering the park and the amazing staff that meet you at the entrance. Lots to see and do.

We decided to take our grandson to Universal Studios for his seventh birthday. What a great choice! We all had a wonderful time. The park is very well run! Strongly urge the express pass. It is well worth the investment!

My sister & I met here for my birthday & had the most wonderful time! I had never been here before, but will absolutely come back here before I return to any of the other area theme parks. The whole complex (all 3 parks) is the best, & I particularly enjoyed this particular park.

Loved the park and rides! However, we found the IT department was struggling today and if not for well-trained guest relations people we would have turned around and left. I bought tickets online the night before and got email delivery. We went straight to the gates as the tickets instructed and were told they were blocked and to go to guest services. Jasmine was our amazing representative and she went by the book taking care of us and realizing the computer infrastructure was causing our issues. After 20 minutes and two calls to the IT department we were in our way. Then at our first ride, it was apparent the e-ticket image wouldn’t open the lockers you are forced to use. We had to go to an attendant to get a ticket to use. What’s the point in issuing the e-tickets if they aren’t going to work. We’d love to go back but next time it’s paper tickets.

I decided to take my wife and three daughters (6, 4, and 18 mo) here for an extended weekend trip and we had a blast. We stayed at Loews Royal Pacific for three nights and spent three days in the parks. We used Xpress Passes and park hoppers which allowed us to experience everything multiple times and meet most of the characters. There was something to do for the whole family. The best part is that there’s a child swap room for every attraction, so it doesn’t matter if you have small ones who can’t ride. They can relax and hangout right off the loading area. That’s a big deal for families.  We held the Disney annual pass for a year and visited all the parks many times. Somehow it always resulted in frustration at their guest service, construction, crowds, fastpass system, and so on. We would be exhausted before we even entered the park. Not at Universal! No rides were down and no glitches that caused us precious time spent at guest services. As far as transportation goes, water taxi was able to get us in the park in less than 20 minutes from our resort. Fantastic. To receive this level of service at Disney, you would need to spend at least 20K on top of being in their vacation club.  I feel that we definitely got our money’s worth at Universal and this will be our new family destination. My kids are still talking about our trip and are already planning for next year!

Universal studios has got to be my favourite place to visit in Orlando Florida. I am a huge Simpsons fan and visiting Springfield USA was beyond mind blowing. I love the interactive atmosphere, the Duff brewery, the kwikie mart, Krusty land, And so many of the loveable restaurants from the TV show are there and feature some pretty good eats. I love the fact that you can get the big pink donut with sprinkles add lard lad.  The characters are so friendly and it’s great to get your picture taken with so many fan favourite individuals like Scooby Doo, the Penguins, Poppy and The Simpsons.  The wizard in world of Harry Potter really feels like you were in the movie sets and you believe where you are to be real. The shops the food, the experience was mine blowing for my Harry Potter fans in the family and it something they will definitely remember for the rest of their lives. The parks are clean And very safe to walk around with great concessions and washrooms available almost everywhere.

Was my first Blue Man group show. I was entertained for the most part except for a short twinkies skit in the middle. I would recommend this show if you have never seen one but personally I think once would be enough for me.
Good street entertainment, excellent novelty gifts, especially the Harry Potter areas. Rides and sections for all ages.

Diagon Alley in The Wizarding World of Harry Potter is the best part of this park; it is amazing!! If you love Harry Potter then definitely make the trip! Unfortunately, the rest of the park is pretty boring. The theming is very out of date. Many of the rides are based on movies that are 20-30 years old and today’s generation doesn’t even know what they are. Also, the screen and 3D ride concept here is extremely overused. This park needs more up to date theming and actual theme park rides.

This was our 3rd visit. We always have to visit Harry Potter World. We did spend more time in Dr. Seuss than usual, the book store and a couple of rides. The weather was perfect and the crowds minimal. The best part, because of where we stayed we got the express pass. That pass is worth every penny! Pricey but we were in and out of rides in quick time, even on the days more people were coming. We could have done it all in 2 days but stretched it to 3.

Well... I don't know where should I start beacouse too many amazing things happened whid me at the park. The rides were crazy! I visited the "adventure park" and my favourite ride was the Jurassic Park ride but all of them was amazing! I also bought Hermione Granger's wand beacouse I am a Harry Potter fanatic. I also really want to celebrate my birthday in the park whid my classmates but unfortunately I am not form Orlando so it is impossible. But I will check other parks out whid my family, I just can't skip them. Thank you for these amazing, Unforgettable memories! I will never forget them 😍💕

I think universal is better than Disney world. At least for adults. Higher intensity rides. Both parks are amazing. Islands of adventure is the better of the two parks in my opinion. Obviously everything is over priced but that is to be expected. Very good restaurants on site throughout both parks. Highly recommend going during the offseason when kids are in school. I have two kids and we just pulled them out for a week. SOOOOOO worth it. Lines were minimal. I think the longest we waited for any ride was about 40 mins. And that was without fast passes. The entire experience is so much better when its not crowded. We went the last week of January.

We loved the 8 hour private VIP tour. Our guide, Taylor, made our day perfect. We booked the tour so my elderly father wouldn’t have to wait in lines. Taylor worked tirelessly to make sure we had a perfect day, planned just for our needs and personality. The ability to ride whatever we wanted without waiting was awesome! The day also included three huge, very nice meals. We recommend using the restaurant vouchers for the Chocolate Imporium because they don’t limit their menu. Lambardi’s limits what you can order with the meal voucher, and considering the cost of the day, that was unacceptable.

Visited with my 10yr old and my 15yr old. This was my daughters double digits birthday trip. Absolutely the best time to come!! Because we stayed at a universal hotel we were able to get into the park an hour early. Unfortunately most attractions didn’t open until 9 so it was kind of a bust. However we were able to do minions immediately. The park was not as busy as it normally is during peak season. With that being said we hit the attractions 3 times with less than ten minute waits. My youngest daughters favorites mummy, minions, Jimmy Fallon, transformers. My oldest loved them as well but really enjoyed the Rip Ride Rocket. She went on alone and it was fine. We would definitely come back again.

Really enjoyed Universal Studios lots to see and do loved Kong Skull Island, some of the food options were not that great wish they had more characters walking around didn’t see to many Harry Potter World was pretty cool

there are some really cool rides, but many of the new updates Harry Potter rides went down a lot! in both Universal and Islands of adventure. That was very frustrating especially when you look forward to riding something and you can not because it's down for the day. The Staff on the other hand, if I 4-5 staff smart mouth me and my friend for no reason at all! If I was rude or not following directions that still wouldnt happen at Disney, but we are in our late 30's and just had a quiet girls trip and gave no reason to be talked to rudely. Gonna be a while before we think about visiting Universal again.
Strolled around the park entrance, sightseeing, no tickets needed. Plenty of shops, restaurants, clubs, and vendors.

We just finished two and a half days here. We loved the parks overall. I need a bit of help with mobility and everyone was more than willing to help with assisting me. That being said be aware there is a serious lack of benches in both parks. It was hot both days and there is a lack of affordable water options especially in the wizarding world of Harry Potter. The rides were wonderful! Characters remained in character the entire time we saw them interacting. On the Universal side a few more bathrooms would be nice. If you have young children take advantage of those bathrooms.

Islands of Adventure is a great park to spend a day. My wife and I went early on a Sunday in February. Not crowded, maybe a 20 minute wait for the Hulk roller coaster - which, btw, is a ridiculous thrill ride, glad I did it, would never do it again! (but that's just me). I love the references to old cartoon characters throughout the park and there are super heroes around every corner for the kids (and kids at heart).  The park was not crowded until the afternoon at the Harry Potter Hogsmeade town which is the most popular area. Loved the Popeye raft ride (you WILL get soaked!) The Jurassic Park River Adventure was another highlight. The detail in the Harry Potter Hogswart castle is amazing.  We ate lunch at Captain America Diner because they had the Impossible burger for my wife. I had a regular burger which was pretty tasteless and way overpriced.  The shopping is pretty good - if you're a comic book buff, they have a great store for that with great prices. All in all, a great day and you can easily take in the whole Islands of Adventure area in one day.  We didn't bother with the express passes and really didn't need them - longest line was Harry Potter - but I can see how they may be worth it if the park is more crowded.

Definitely recommend getting the multi-park ticket so you can go between Hogsmeade and Diagon Alley! The Hogwarts Express train ride is fantastic and great for all ages! We loved all of the rides, unfortunately the new Hagrid Motorbike ride wasn't working but everything else was so much fun! My daughter had a memorable wand experience in the wand shop and this was a wonderful family trip!

The park is very fun. However I would never go with fast passes again. But better save up it’s not cheap. I wish it was more affordable because I did not plan that much extra in the trip budget. Minimal rides due to long long lines. But know better for next time.
So much fun for kids and us. The lines were not too long, except 1 attraction. it was our 3 time and kids still want to come back again.

Was in Orlando for a trade show in Orange County Convention Centre.  Decided to unwind after show was finished and on the first “free day” went to park with a colleague.  Weather was brilliant. Great fun and craic. Tested our fear boundaries on the Rockit, were transformed into Minions, and overall had a superb time before getting g he train to Island of Adventure.  Only complaint was it is so expensive.

The two Harry Potter parks are a wonder and the train ride between them is not to be missed both ways. Waited hours to try to ride the Hagrid Motorbike Adventure only to have it break down time after time. Spiderman and Hulk Coaster among many great attractions at these amazing parks.

This was our first time to visit. Seems like we could stand at the entrance and almost see the whole park which is so different than what we were used to at Disney. We experienced every attraction and were finished by 1:30.
Amazing rides for all with enough to keep you going all day! Universal always keeps the wheels going with new attractions.
one of my best day ever universal one of the past parks in Orlando and Disney world I like it more than Disney

It was raining and a cool side. We started with "Despicable Me" then we stopped at "Jimmy Fallen". As we continued to walk we also enjoyed "Transformers", "E.T." and other enjoyable rides at Universal Studios. Then we took train over to "Island of Adventures" to ride "Harry Potter", "Spiderman" and "King "Kong". These are just a few rides filled with fun. Although it rained a little, a light jacket was needed. We had a nice time.
We did not go there it was very expensive for us. To go there for two people you have to expect to spend at least four hundred dollars to do the park.
great park experience, plenty to do in each park. no need for park jumper ticket. unless you want to ride on the Hogwarts express

Impossible to see it also in one day so get multi day or if you live close enough go for the annual pass. We have the annual passes and it’s so nice to be able to go whenever we want and don’t have to rush. Everybody knows about the attractions and rides, but I think the quality of restaurants for a theme park is probably the best around, which many people don’t know. Expensive, but so is everything in theme parks. Anything you can think of can be found between city walk and in the parks. Hulk coaster is probably my favorite ride. The water rides are awesome on a hot summer day but unless you’re wearing quick dry clothing save them for the end or you’ll be walking around wet and miserable because FL humidity isn’t gonna dry your clothes anytime soon. They do have giant dryers for people to stand in for a price but you’re not gonna be dry if you’re wearing jeans or any heavy fabric. Overall, I highly recommend.

I had a decent time at Universal Studios. I paid extra for the park to park ticket so that I could ride on the Hogwarts Express and I would suggest doing that. The replica of Hogsmede, Hogwarts and Diagon Alley were impressive and the primary reason I went. I did find that the theme park overall was very much geared towards getting you to spend money with more shops with overpriced items and restaurants than rides. In order to leave every ride, you have to walk through the gift shop associated with that ride. The rides are primarily 4d with lots of video effects. I was disappointed that the lightshow on Hogwarts did not run and no one notified attendees that it was cancelled so a lot of people spent over an hour waiting for it.  Note: When either park closes, you cannot ride the train to the other park that remains open.

This is an awesome place for Harry Potter fans!!! There is Diagon Alley in the Universal Studios part - then “hop” on over to Islands of Adventure to Hogsmead. We have season passes - but if you go with regular tickets, make sure you get the park-to-park tickets that allow you to transfer between parks so you can take the train!  This place is completely different from Disney in terms of the rides - lots of simulator rides.

Did the VIP tour- THE BEST EXPERIENCE EVER!!! No waiting in line, lunch was included- they really went above and beyond. Great if you only do a one day ticket and are short on time or just want to skip the lines. EXCELLENT PARK!!

In my personal opinion the actual rides are definitely more appealing and exhilarating than a majority of the rides in Universals neighbouring Disney parks. However, compared to Disney slick design across their entire repertoire of parks, Universal just doesn't cut the mustard. 90% of the set design amd production of the park seems very basic; a wooden cutout on a painted background just doesn't cut it anymore, and the characters walking around the park look like they're wearing a budget costume you could find in your everyday supermarket on the lead up to Halloween

My husband and I just returned from 5 fun-filled days at Universal Orlando. I've been on a ketogenic diet (low carb/high fat) for seizure control for more than 5 years. I was concerned when I looked at their online menus bc everything is high carb. I emailed Universal prior to going and asked about keto options and never got a reply so I packed my KetoVie just in case there was nothing I could eat. Turns out I didn't have to be concerned. Starbucks prepared my 2/3 coffee, 1/3 heavy whipping cream every morning. At the on-site restaurants (Leaky Cauldron, 3 Broomsticks) I learned that when you order the cashiers/waitstaff at Universal can not stray from the printed menu items but will gladly call for a head cook (who knows whats in the food) to come out and discuss your needs with you and have the food prepared just for you. I have been on keto so long that I follow rules and don't need explicit carb counts so if you are counting carbs it might be a problem. For example, at the 3 Broomsticks I ordered the American breakfast and they substituted bacon, sausage, and sauteed mushrooms for the potatoes and bread. They did the same for me at Citywalk's BigFire restaurant where I had delicious grilled brussel sprouts, grilled mixed veggies, and trout. My order included only the veggies I can eat - no picking out potatoes, carrots etc... BigFire had lots on their menu I could eat and the food was delightfully fresh and simple.

We specifically went here to see Harry Potter World. Which was disappointing (in another review). Outside of that, we went on the water raft ride at Jurassic Park, which was OK. Rest of park was uninteresting. Lots of flashy buildings and shops, only a few rides- coasters and virtual reality rides are painful. Compared to Kings Island in Ohio, this was an overpriced waste of time. We spent most of the morning in Harry Potter, then drifted around to other areas. A lot of walking and not that much to do or see. Pretty Disappointing!!!
Universal is great for those looking for thrill rides. Line ups are not bad at all! Arrive early and you'll be able to get through the rides pretty quickly!

We've been going to Universal Studios Orlando at least once, sometimes twice a year for the past 12 years ... Our most recent trip in Feb 2020 will be our last. The employees at the parks have been consistently rude, disrespectful, and condescending each and every time. The first few times, I thought maybe it was just a fluke, that they were just having a bad day. But now that these interactions have happened every single time, I know now that the issue is a company-wide one. They aren't trained properly in how to interact with guests. You can't ask any of them a question without them instantly getting defensive.  We had a particularly negative experience this last time while in line for Hagrid's in the Harry Potter area. We saw several families with small children heading into the single rider's line, so after waiting an hour in line with our two whining kids, we decided to follow suit. Our mistake. A 20-something female employee with shoulder-length black hair promptly informed us that line was closed, that "all those other people were going to the restroom" and that we needed to "head back to the end of the line because cutting is bad and I can kick you out of the park for that." Those were her EXACT words. WE DIDN'T EVEN ASK TO CUT IN LINE! We were 100% cordial/pleasant after realizing our mistake. She just automatically said that to us!! "Cutting is bad." And she exaggerated every syllable in such a condescending tone. I've never been spoken to like that by anyone in my entire life. She spoke to us like we were troublemakers trying to get away with something. And while we walked back to the exit, she GLARED at us. GLARED. This was at 10:15am ... we hadn't even gone on a single ride yet. And it really bothered us the rest of the day to be spoken to like that by a Universal employee when we'd made an honest mistake and hadn't been snippy with her in the slightest. Maybe all the families before us made the same error we did and some of them had bit her head off so maybe she expected we were going to do the same, but we were 100% pleasant and she came at us with such a hostile, defensive tone right off the bat. Completely unacceptable!  We've had several other unpleasant interactions with staff over the years, but this last one takes the cake. It has left such a bad taste in our mouth and we won't hesitate to tell our friends/family about this disgusting experience.  From now on, we're sticking strictly with Disney parks. Those employees are happy, pleasant, and speak to guests in a courteous manner regardless of the situation. You can tell the employees at Universal hate their jobs, are annoyed at the tourists, and don't want to be there.  If we're dropping thousands of dollars on a vacation, we want to guarantee a good time. From now on it's Disney for this theme park loving family.
We came here with our teenagers and they loved it. A lot of walking but very clean and nice. Plenty to do and lots of food places.

We brought our tickets at our hotel as not staying for two weeks. Deal was for park to park and we got 4 days for the price of 3. This means we can visit any of the 3 parks on the same day and get the hogwarts express. Parking is 24 dollars a day so bear that in mind Universal I have to say is much better that Disney far more choice of restaurants and better laid out. Amazing Harry Potter area and rides were incredible. We queued for around 25 mins to over and hour for each ride but that can be more at busier time’s. avoid spring break Easter and thanks giving All rides at universal really good and lots of variety of rides for youg children’s to terrifying rollercoasters. meal at Chicago rock cafe really good and free re fills We stayed for Mardi Gras parade so glad we did as excellent lots of fun with the floats throwing necklaces great vibe. there is also a firework display on the lake. Restrooms spotless and staff helpful. Would definitely come back great memories made !

My wife and I have seasonal passes and regularly go there to spend the day. The park is always clean. I have never encountered a negative or rude staff member. The rides are well maintained. The atmosphere is fun and upbeat. This is well worth the price of a ticket or a pass...
Visited here for one day, the awe this park offers never dies, would highly recommend a visit here, even if you have been before.
No comparation with LA Universal studios, Knowing LA, bad surprise. All working arround. No transport facilities. Harry Potter and 4D cinema acceptable.

We really enjoyed these parks.... in particular the Harry Potter ride..... Hagrids motorbike ride is stunning.... well worth the 2 to 3 hour wait plus the occasional breakdowns.  Lots of great food offerings but all are expensive..... even an ice cream cost $5 ......  Just couldn't get over the amount of eye for detail these guys put in to everything they do.  Highly recommended this Park...... buy your tickets well in advance and you will get 2 weeks roaming ticket for around £330...... past passes are available on the day if the queues are long at £60 each.....  Stunning.

We enjoyed our day at universal studios. Our top picks of the rides would be the rip rockin rollercoaster, the mummy ride and escape from gringotts. The most impressive part of the park though is the Wizarding world of Harry Potter, this is a big area that’s completely obscured from the rest of the park, it’s clever how they’ve done it. The area is so well created, it really feels like you are there. The dragon breathing fire every 15 minutes is a great touch too. We spent a long time just exploring this area and taking it all in. Be sure to look up the “hidden gems” too, which includes things like using the phone box to call the ministry of magic. We would also recommend fear factor live, this was great for us because my wife and son volunteered and got to take part in shooting water cannons at the contestants. One thing to avoid though is the fast and furious ride, we went through it once and the ride didn’t activate, the second time around it did and it was pretty awful, not sure why this one is there. We went on all of the other rides and they were good too, the majority of the other rides are immersive and interactive. Overall we had a great day at the park, would recommend.

Our family LOVES Universal! Here are the favourites for us... Harry Potter World (all of the rides, the feel of the area, the Hogwarts Express between the two parks, and the dragon), Transformers, Shrek, Minions, Marvel everything, the Simpsons, and MIB.  The food options are great! The parades are fun for the entire family. Unlike Disney the characters properly interact with the kids and will stand still for a photo op where you don't have to buy a photo package.  Wait to purchase the Express Pass until the day of your visit. If the park isn't packed, then you may not need it. Here is the comparison of Express Pass vs Disney's Fast Pass. Because Disney allows you to select your Fast Pass uses up to 60 days in advance you may not really get the fast pass experience for a lot of rides. The day we went we could only use fast pass for 2 rides. Universal has Disney beat on this where all of the rides (except for the new Hagrid's Motorbike) are eligible for Express Pass. It is so much more value and simple to use than the Disney system which is prone to a disappointing experience.  At Universal there is just so much to do and it is fun for all ages!

Just left Universal and stayed at the resort with all the bells and whistles. Spent a decent amount to get fast pass, early admission, added on character breakfast and dinners and meal plan and Harry Potter breakfast. Talk about a disorganized place. I would have thought Universal just opens last week. The Harry Potter Breakfast is no other benefit other than prepaying for your breakfast, no reserved table just another line to wait in for your “reserved” time. I must have missed that in the fine print. The meal plan is not worth purchasing because numerous cashiers throughout the park do not know how to scan the card correctly and if you do not pay close attention you will get charged for a meal like we did on 4 cards instead of drinks. But they only printed 3 receipts so we made the mistake of thinking the 4 th card was ok, nope. After wasting 45 minutes of waiting for them to fix the cards the first time instead of using that time waiting on Hagrids motorbike when it was actually open. I found out at lunch that I did not have a lunch left and the manager advised me that I could take the it to guest services to have it corrected. So know we are looking at close to 159 minute wait time for hagrids and I walk down to guest services only to be greeted by the girl at the counter stating they only take valid park complaints with a valid picture ID. Like really-really? I am staying on their property with $5000. + package and my room key is my fast pass that is connected to my picture, and my paper ticket for five days is linked to my finger print(which funny enough only worked half the time- would get in the front gate walk to the train and they would have no record of me getting in the park that day) and my separate meal plan card. I figured since I was staying at a park hotel and had my finger print daily and picture and not planning on any trouble, the ID would be ok in the safe. So at this point I could not stay calm. After getting slightly loud and being told without and ID they would do nothing for me and not get me a manager, my demanding to speak to a manager on the 4 th time worked. Really Universal what happened to customer service? You now have a pissed off customer that will did not spend anymore money at your park on his final day and will buy his souvenirs from amazon. All over a $15 meal at most that the manager in the restaurant should have handled the first time but not even the second one could have handled. Yet your guest relations did not want to take my complaint and it was obvious. In the future, I will take my business to Disney. I will not go into my other issues here as I am sure Universal does not care about them either... Beware of the meal. Check your receipts
Recommended if you are in Florida. One of the best theme parks in the area. We loved it. What could be better on a hot day seriously?

Amazing time in the studio. My daughter so happy, after 3 days she just didnt want to go home. The rides are amazing and staff are so helpful and professional. Harry porter world was just breath taking, not only for kids even we enjoyed so much. Would be back soon with friends. This is a must visit in Florida area.
This park you will need a couple days to see all the attractions. The food offerings are very good along with the drinks they offer.

Wait to buy the Express ticket because it might not be necessary. The park was really empty on the first day we visited it, so the lines were really short. The park was a little busier on the second day we visited, but we still didn’t think it was necessary to purchase the Express ticket. There was 150 minute wait for Hagrid’s Motorbike Adventure, but we did the Single Rider and only waited 40 minutes. We also did Single Rider for Harry Potter and the Forbidden Journey and that was only a 30 minute wait. Many of the little kids rides in the Dr. Seuss area of the park had a wait of 5-15 minutes.

This is a great park that offers alternatives to the usual thrill rides you will find in other places. The rides here are set up like you are part of a movie. My family and I have been here several times; each time there is something different as the rides change. We especially enjoyed the Mummy ride. Plan ahead so you know which rides to go to first and learn how to lower your wait time. The Express Pass is worth it if you are willing to spend the extra $$$.

Great amusement rides with high attention to detail. It is really an full immersion experience. Everything is clearly marked out and there are a lot of people to assist Take very small bag to store personal belongings and lock in lockers as you go around. If you are into Harry Potter - then there wizarding world is a must see.  We bought the fast pass access. I would say it is essential to enjoy more of the rides.  Tip: The website can be confusing. You need 2 tickets if you want to access the fast pass. The entrance and the fast pass ticket.

This was a interesting way to do this park. They have a couple $ of VIP tours. My daughter and I did the cheaper one ( much cheaper unless you have a large group ) includes park to park tickets ( have to have to ride the train ) , wonderful breakfast buffet and a fantastic buffet lunch also. I truly cannot say enough about the food. Depending on what time of year you go prices probably differ. I think a park to park 2 day was about $285.00 for each of us. We paid including tax of everything with tickets for parks was $590.00 each for the VIP tour. Yes that sounds like a lot to many, it was well worth it. Not only do you get to go straight in the back entrance to the rides, shows ,means only maybe 3 minutes of wait time. The biggest problem people might have here is that fact you have NO wait time at all , means you do a heck of a lot more walking than the 98% of the people just standing and waiting, even express pass. Oh which also, when you leave the 5-7 hour tour for the day , you get to use your VIP pass to get thru the express pass....so don’t buy extra express pass. The food would have cost about $50 for this wonderful buffet, ...so breakfast & lunch exquisite taste figure $100 for food, free water bottles at eating time...take them!., tickets $285.00 that leaves only $200 extra that is not bad. If your handicap in anyway , they do accommodate for you on everything! If you get motion sickness....do NOT do most of the rides here!., this park is fantastic on rides for roller coaster, neck jerking people!! The group would ride the rides for my daughter and I and tell us yes or no for us...like I say below, you make many new friends. So you might be thinking now, why did we do the tour if we don’t do rides. Well, we thought there would be more behind the scenes telling how the buildings were made or where they were brought in from etc. It was pretty much rides with our tour guide, not sure that all do the same thing. Even though with maybe 2 rides for us we enjoyed every else having a great time. It actually turns out to be more of a fun family- friends tour , as buy the end of the day you hate to say good- bye to all the great people that take the tour, 12 in group.. You eat together in a nice restaurant type area, just for VIP only. You talk and learn who why and how with them, lots of fun stories! I would do this again- hands down without even giving it a second thought. Disney is out of my price point. One family with a 14 years old boy said it’s the only way they do the parks now, which tells you they had money ( which I do not, this was a treat ) but we’re wonderful fun people that didn’t flaunt it.

Kept us waiting over an hour at will call messed Heights are a lie... 51 should equal 51 we waited in line for an hour after going through one check point only to be denied 10 seconds before getting on after paying 240 for the day to skip the lines... I won’t return as this was a miserable experience

I am a travel agent and I accompanied a group to this park for a day. The park is medium in size and this allows you to stay even one day to save on the very high cost of the ticket. The attractions are a lot of fun and are for both adults and children compared to Disney parks made especially for children. However, I recommend visiting especially Universal Studios in Los Angeles (California) because it is a better park for the reason that it is located in Hollywood and is more in tune with the themes of the various films as there is a shuttle that takes you directly to the sets film

I was with family without any children so for us, the wait times didn’t matter. However, if you have children of any age, BUY THE EXPRESS PASS. 30 and 45 minutes doesn’t seem too bad, but it adds up and definitely affects how much you can do in one day. Even if you have multiple days to spend at each park, sadly, because I hate giving in to these things, if children in tow, buy the passes.

I've written another review about Universal under the Harry Potter area but now one more specifically for Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure.  In general, this place is a feast for the senses. Aesthetically pleasing to the eye and lots of interesting things to do. Most of the 'rides' are cinematic simulators which are nice and clever but after a few of them you recognise the format and it starts to grind a little. My teenage son wanted to feel real gforce and found the attractions underwhelming. For the very few rides that there were in both parks, be warned that if you are of a 'non-normal' shape and size, you'll be unceremoniously kicked off the ride and made to wait at the exit. This happened to me three times because the slim seats fits but the safety bars wouldn't go down "3 clicks". Yes I get that this is a safety feature which is right and yes you can check beforehand on the seats and yes I could lose weight etc etc but actually this is irrelevant, why can't Universal use a better formula to be more inclusive of different shapes and sizes? Disney manage it fine, is Universal on a budget? A guy standing with me just had wide shoulders and wasn't even that large and he was upset that he got kicked off the Mummy returns. I can see why.  Anyway, by the third time this happened, I felt absolutely dreadful and started to cry at the exit of the Hatry Potter escape from Gringotts ride. A really lovely ride assistant toom pity on me and worked hard to try and cheer me up which was kind. She also offered to treat us to some gifts from the candy shop in Diagon Alley which she didn't have to do but as I mentioned in my other review, the thing that stood out for me was her gesture of making me feel valued and cared for, so thank you Nikki, you made a horrible humiliating situation much better!  I suspect the other two rides I didn't try, Hulk and RIP ride, would have been the same story.  I did have a good time at the Studios overall although I felt ripped off for the express passes and ride factor. Universal must have hundreds of thousands of people coming through their doors and I cannot believe they have built rides without different shapes and sizes in mind. I'm not even that large but looking some others who were large and managed to fit on, I can see that it's a bit of a lottery as to whether you'll fit. I'm not sure I'll want to come back again as it made me feel as though I didn't fit in. Something I thought Universal movies were meant to moralise over. You can do better Universal, much better.
The express pass and flying with Harry Potter More than I’d hoped for as part of my bucket list. I’d go again in a heartbeat!

I was in Orlando for work and decided to go to Universal Studios Florida to see the Harry Potter (Diagon Alley). It took a good 45 minutes just to walk from the parking lot to the location and then there is only one ride in the Harry Potter area – one ride for the mob of people that are there visiting. It was just shops and overly priced food. I ate at the Leaky Cauldron and spent a fortune just for myself for a small dish of cottage pie that came with a salad. The line was so long just to get food. In the total part of this park, there are a small amount of total rides and the majority are inside where you sit in a seat that moves (Shrek and Minions). There was one big roller coaster and it was a long ride and tons of twists and turns and very fast. If you have neck issues, you should consider avoiding this ride or try to sit with your back as straight back against the seat as possible which is not easy to do with all the movement. There were lots of characters around the park, which would be fun for little kids. But I just think the amount of money they charge is so not worth it and the walking is outrageous. You go through an entire area of restaurants (City Walk) before even getting to the park. Be forewarned, if you are overweight, you may have a very difficult time getting on the Harry Potter ride – Escape from Gringotts – the seats are very small and the bar must come down all the way; they had to turn people away who were really not even that overweight – so shame on Universal for creating a ride without proper seating for all guests; they could easily remove two seats on each car to mark for a larger person. The security to get into any Universal area was quite long when I was there and everyone was bunched together in a central area and the lines started almost when you were at the location to be scanned – very poor planning. Would have no desire to ever return. I had been to the other park a few years ago and again would have no desire to go back.
Definitely worth it! Yes it's expensive but you wont experience anything like it anywhere else. It's great for adults, kids and couples. It's huge so a lot of walking, be prepared.

The Hagrid ride and Et ride was closed as they were broken and all the Harry Potter rides (which is why we went there), were very extreme roller coaster rides. If you have a bad neck or back or motion sickness, don't go on the Harry Potter rides! If you go there I highly recommend the valet parking. It gets you thru a shorter security line and puts you as close to the park as you can get. It is $40 more than the regular parking fee and worth every penny. We ordered our tickets online and printed them at the will call kiosk outside the park , which was easy and also saved you from long lines. We also purchased the express pass and it qas wirth every penny. For instance, the Gringotts ride was a 65 minute wait and we were in and out in 10 minutes!  I would not go to Universal or Islands of Adventure again. The Disney Parks offer more for your money.
After our cruise we spent some time at Universal Studios City Walk. Lots to do including put putt golf and Blue Man Group, both we did.This place is great for people of ALL ages.

We spent four days in Orlando and went to Universal on our second day. We loved it! We have two teenager boys who also really enjoyed it. Because it was Thanksgiving week, we purchased a fast pass. It was a great investment to be able to get on the rides quicker during the peak tourist season. The Christmas decorations were a fun touch too.
We went to Rock the Universe to see the best Christian musicians. Great family fun at Universal Studios.
While it was pretty expensive for two parks in one day for the three of us we still had a great time.

The only reason I bothered with Universal was because my husband REALLY wanted to see Harry Potter World. And I do have to give them kudos--HP was done really well! The rides are great and the scenery is fantastic. But in order to see both sections of the Wizarding World, you had to pay for admission into BOTH parks, which was an outright ripoff. As for the rest of the park, hoo-boy. Sad, sad, SAD doesn't even cover it. Nickelodeon Studios is long since gone, having been replaced by the Blue Man Group. Just....UGH. I had the "pleasure" of seeing this show back in 2010 and was bored after what seemed like the first ninety-bajillion minutes of similar tricks and antics. As for the remainder of the park, well....it desperately needs a MAJOR overhaul. The majority of the attractions are no longer relevant. Seriously, The Simpsons is far from popular anymore. Dr. Seuss World is mediocre at best. Although I love the E.T. ride, I wanted to cry--Hubby and I found ourselves getting onto said ride without any wait and buying a souvenir in the abandoned gift shop next to the equally cobweb-laden SpongeBob Storepants. Feivel's Playland on the opposite side was a ghost town (I actually saw tumbleweeds). (Honestly, is there a soul younger than 30 years of age who even KNOWS who Feivel is anymore?) Please, PLEASE, Universal. Be wise. Refurbish. (I do have to say that the one--and only--thing Universal did better than Disney was City Walk. That area is a great idea and wisely located, especially since the parks close so friggin' early and people still want to hang out and have dinner and such.)

We were trying to figure out whether to but two days at Universal or one day. We choose the 1 day - 2 park with express pass. This saved us a day in the park as we were able to see and ride all we wanted easily in a single day. We considered 2 day - 2 park with 1 day express pass so our savings in the park was one day food, parking and about $120 per ticket.

It seemed like every "adventure" was just another simulator with a different theme. I was really, really disappointed . Seemed like the excitement that I remember from several years ago has gone.  On the positive side, the lines were very reasonable on the day of our visit.

This was a nice park with fairly good rides, but the experience was somewhat ruined by the "express pass" concept. This was incredibly unfair, and Disney handles this so much better. What they don't tell you is that your tickets do not guarantee you get to ride their rides, they just get you into the park. At that point you essentially have standby tickets. If there is nobody in the express line, they will let some of the regular people (90% of the park population at least) onto the ride. It's maddening to watch these people cut in front of us again and again, and they make no effort to hide the express lines from view. They just walk right by the normals over and over again, while we wait hours for a major attraction. If you don't pay for the express tickets, you are limited to either the lesser rides in the park (and still waiting 15-60 minutes), or to waiting as much as 4 hours to go on a major ride. Yes, I saw them at 240 minutes. Meanwhile, the express passers can walk right onto any ride. If you don't pay the extra for the express pass, you've basically been fooled into buying standby access.
So fun!!! This is my second time coming here and let me tell you about it! Their are a lot of things to do, Simpson’s land, Etc. it’s really big and fun for the whole family!

Two parks of pure family fun, something for everyone without the Hassle of enormous crowds and extreme overpricing !!!! We went during Christmas and yes it was very busy but still acceptable and yes some things are pricey but not every thing !!!! All ages can enjoy both parks. City Walk does have Expensive Restaurants but there are average eateries as well and you can shop and mini-golf too !! Guest Relations and Employee's are "AWESOME", they will work out any problem that may arise !!
My boyfriend & I have been passholders for years now and we love this park so much! They have great rides, good food, tons to do in City Walk, and there are some cool perks being passholders as well.

If you can, go early. Place fills up quickly. Harry Potter was done beautifully, and it feels like a page out of the movies. We got the park hopper to be able to ride the Hogwarts Express. That entire experience was phenomenal. Definitely get the express pass. The lines are worth it! The only reason it doesn't get more stars is because compared to Disney where friendliness and service is notable, you can tell here that such things are not that high on their list. They're just looking to quickly move the masses from one thing to the next. And the table cleanliness is a joke. Be prepared to clean every area you plan to sit and eat on.
Universal in Orlando is a great time!! Parking is efficient. I had trouble finding the uber station. Package pick up was great and easy to use highly recommended instead of carrying all your stuff.

My wife and I have been to Disney MULTIPLE times so we thought that we'd try out Universal Studios without our kids. In our opinion, this should not even be called an "Amusement" park. The value of entertainment that you receive for the high price of admission and parking is very low compared to other options such as all of the Disney parks or even a place like FunSpot. Universal only has 1 true roller coaster, which was closed on the day that we went due to high winds, and every other ride is some sort of Virtual Reality experience. For my money I'd rather go to Cedar Point in Ohio and ride 10+ roller coasters all day than spend $120+ on a ticket here.
Great place for the family! One day is not enough time for all the fun things to do! An absolute must!

We spent one day at Universal with a ticket good for both parks in order to see all of the Harry Potter attractions. First, you will need to buy a ticket for both parks to see both Harry Potter London and Harry Potter Hogwarts. I will say that both areas are nicely done, especially Diagon Alley.  Expecting long waits for the Hogwarts Adventure we arrive around 8 am for a 9 am opening and were among the first 50 people to enter the park. We made a beeline for the ride only to be told there was an hour or more delay. We decided that this would still likely be the shortest wait of the day we stayed in line for 2 and 1/2 hours before giving up. The ride did not not start until 4 pm in the afternoon. We later learned that the ride had been down the day before. Why would they keep you hanging on if they knew there were serious problems?  Having lost two hours of time, we had to prioritize the rest of the day. Rides are a mixed bag. Skull Island was a lot of fun. The Mummy and Poseidon's Adventure are dated. Jurassic Park was closed.  Despite being at the park in late January when crowds are fairly low, lines for the main attractions were at least 30 - 50 minutes.  The Universal version of a fast pass is an additional $79 and omits the Hogwarts ride! Did not seem to be worth it.  If you want to ride 5 or 6 of the main attractions you will spend 4 - 6 hours in line. It is a tough slog to have fun.

Was not impressed with Universal theme park. Not enough rides as Jurassic Park was blocked off. We had no warning that a big part of the park was closed. Gift shops were all open as were food and drink stands. 1 day ticket for 1 person cost $195.00, same $ for each theme park. We have been in all of the other parks and LOVED everyone of them. We now wish we had repeated another park. Universal was sorry!

This was our first trip to Universal. We have always done Disney and love Disney, but wanted something different and also are obsessed with Harry Potter. We were absolutely blown away by Universal. From the parking to the dining and shopping. Everything exceeded our expectations and then some. For the money, we enjoyed Universal as much as if not more than Disney. The theming was immaculate, the park was clean and easy to get around. If you like Harry Potter then you absolutely have to visit the Wizarding World at USF and IOA. It was incredible. We can't wait to go back!

Even with the park without many people, most of the attractions with 5 to 10 minutes of line, the unfair policy of Express to skip lines takes place. Even in Attractions 5-10 min line, with 2 or 5 people in the line, we are put on hold to 30 to 60 people in the Express line pass you. The most cool and newest attractions 1 to 2 hours of line. Every 2 to 3 persons in the regular line goes through, 30 to 60 goes trough the Express line, totally unfair, taking out the joy of being there with regular tickets, and it is blowing mind to pay twice to enjoy the park even with a few people in the parks, is totally unfair to do that. That way me and my family didn’t enjoy many attractions at all.
Great mix of attractions for my 10 and 13 yr old boys. Better than Islands of Adventure. Ride cues are well covered (good for hot and cold days). Clean park. Fun shows.
So many shops and fun rides. Good time to go before the heat and spring break crowd was not bad. Still like California better tho it’s cool to have been to both.

The attractions make this park worth the visit - especially if you have Harry Potter Fans. We booked the Wizarding World vacation package and liked the perks that came along with it.  Be ready to wait on line - as the good rides do not all take the Express Passes. Be ready to wait on line for food. Be ready to wait to on line for everything. Not sure why but no ice cream location other than in the Harry Potter section was open. The guest experience left a lot to be desired if you expect a Disney type experience with readily available guest services and good eating - you will be disappointed.

During our Orlando vacation we decided to spend the day at Universal. We bought the one-day, 2 park pass which allowed us to go to Universal Studios and Universal's Islands of Adventure. It is totally doable to go to both parks in one day as long as you start early and finish the day late.  We totally recommend spending the extra to get the Express Pass. Most of the rides had about a 30-45 minute wait time while we were there and the Express Pass usually resulted in a 5-10 minute wait instead. This allowed us to enjoy the park and not spend half the day in line ups. We did make the mistake of getting the unlimited Express Pass. The regular Express Pass allows you to go on each ride once which was enough for us. However, for those wanting to go on the same ride more than once it doesn't really cost that much more for the unlimited Express Pass.  While the tickets are very pricey, we agreed that the cost was well worth it. If there are any Harry Potter fans in your group they will feel like they've gone to Potter Heaven. The rides and sites for HP are out of this world.

Fork out the extra money for the express pass. Much shorter lines. Worth the cost. And then just know you will have to wait in lines even with the pass. Just chill out and enjoy. Every time we were in line we met some nice people. The Hobbit is a must see and easy to miss if you’re not watching out for it.

Universal Studios is fantastic by far the best selection of rides! Brilliant child swap service, unlike Disney which has a non existent child swap service! And all round a fantastic day! Highly recommend especially with children that can not ride!

Our Universal Studio experience was ok until my daughter and her best friend got their iPhones stolen from a 'secured ' locker. My daughter was required to store her purse and their iPhones at locker was NOT secured as her purse was stolen along with their iPhones. The locker was empty when she used her ticket to open it. If the riders are REQUIRED to store their valuables before they can ride, then there should be more attendants present to monitor the lockers. I called back that evening as instructed to see if any purse were turn in, only to get a message about filling out the form online. I find the requirement to store items without monitoring is unacceptable. Also lost my refillable cup while I was helping my young daughter catching beads at the parade. A lot of dishonest people there! Will leave update after I hear back from Universal Studio.
Indoor rides are really seeing the videos at each turn , swoop or stop of the car you ride in- not for preschoolers, in my opinion. Wait till kids are 8 years old and up! Expensive and worth it!!
After two days of disappointment at Disney we really enjoyed universal, smaller lines less crowding not such a cash grab for everything.

Our son loved it. Our pockets hated it :) Yes, its like in the movies, yes you feel the magic. However, for me, an adult joyning my son and not interested to get into any of the carousels or other experiences, I felt extremly frustrated that I had to pay 170 USD just for being a pedestrian in this park. I think there should be lower price for the accompanying adult who is not interested in the experience as such. I spent anyway money on food, merchandise etc.

My husband and I went here for our 10th anniversary and had the absolute best day! Crowd was low and we were able to go on every single ride and we watched all of the shows. We even went to the NBC Media Center and watched and rated a tv show and earned a gift card. We used that pay for lunch, so that was a nice bonus. This has definitely become our favorite theme park.

First time to Universal parks. Went particularly for the Harry Potter experience - Diagon Alley. Every section of the park felt like we were walking onto a movie set. Had lunch at the Leaky Cauldron. Love that all of the staff members stay in character so that you get the true experience. Well done, Universal!

Universal receives A++++ in regards to their customer service. My son has a seizure disorder and the Park was amazing handling his needs. He received a card with return times for lines greater than 30 minutes. If line was less than 30 minutes he was able to get right on; and they gave us multiple return times at the same time so we could do an area of the park and move on to the next when done.  Hats off to you Universal for making my son feel like a King for two days. He finally felt like he was “special” and not “different” I wish I could say the same for Disney.... where we could only reserve one “fast pass” with the DAS at a time. We spent most of our day sitting around doing nothing.

Universal Studios was pretty quiet our first morning and found it not well suited for toddlers for a full day. Too many rides in a shaking box but my family made the most of both parks. As we traveled a long distance, the Express Pass was worth it.
Third time to Universal and as always, we had a great time and so much fun. We went in February and it wasn’t too hot to walk through the park.

Visited in February 2020. We purchased the two park ticket for Universal Studios and Islands of adventure. It was not a particularly busy day but still a lot of people and lines. The thrill rides are great and you can save a bit of time using the single rider lines when they are available. Most rides that we used single rider we ended up being on the same car just different rows. We got to go on all the rides and see all the attractions we wanted to except for the Harry Potter ride which had 3-4 hour wait times and some points during the day broke down.  My issue with the park is the outrageously expensive prices for any food/drink, and the attitude of a lot of the staff. The staff particularly those working at food kiosks are all very monotone and disinterested and make ordering a drink a bit of an ordeal.  Overall we had a good time but felt as if we had paid too much for the experience and had been coaxed out of as much money as possible.  If you’re a family paying a lot of money to visit, plan your day very carefully to try and get the best value from your ticket.  Tip: leave the Popeye ride for last otherwise you will spend the day wet with soggy shoes

The best part of Universal was walking through Wizarding World of Harry Potter & I still think there were missed opportunities. Rides really weren't that impressive. Actually kind of disappointed that I spent the time & $. Hate that every time you want to ride you have to pay more $ to put your stuff in lockers (free ones, when you could find any, weren't high enough to put a small backpack in). Really? Lockers? Never returning.

Stayed at the Hard Rock so got Express passes which were well worth it. Seemed busy but never had to queue more than about 25 mins for a ride. Was with kids aged 6 (who’s 45 inches so couldn’t go on any rides over 48 inches much to his annoyance) and 9.  Some absolute highlights and our 6 year old could go on most things. Spider-Man, Jimmy Fallon, Gringotts, Minions, Transformers, Hippogriff, huge red rollercoaster, Revenge of the Mummy all outstanding. Park was clean, service was good. Really, really enjoyable.

Had a great time here so much to do loads of rides. Even came back in the evening to city walk there’s no parking fees after 6pm. And you can even go into universal until 9pm. City walk have some fab restaurants and some of them have groups singing definately will come back again.
After visiting for many years and seeing most of the venues I spend a lot of my time with my family at CITYWALK. We love the Bob Marley restaurant with a great menu and music.
Loved visiting Springfield, diagon alley, New York, and got absolutely fired up on the rip ride rock it. Could easily spend a week there exploring and seeing new things.

This was a fun day .... definitely pay the extra for express pass!!!!!! Only attraction that is unorganised and a complete waste of time (we walked out half way through) is The tonight show with Jimmy Fallon. You wait downstairs, then when you eventually get sent up stair case you enter a hall filled with hundreds of other people sitting around & you don’t know where you are meant to go or what you are meant to be doing ..... nor HOW LONG YOU NEED TO WAIT HERE. .... they started calling various coloured tickets to enter the next show area .... but ours was 4(!!!!!) colours away from being called .... there was no one around telling people what to do or what to expect so we just found nearest exit and left - complete waste of time! Best attraction by far is the Harry Potter section - we’ve never read the books nor seen the movies but we were hooked. It’s truly incredible! (We said we would read the books now).

I last visited 6 years ago so it was very different for me, my fiance hasn't been since he was 10 so it was majorly different for him. The Harry Potter updates are excellent - Gringots was one of our fave rides. Simpsons is a must do for me, its one of my faves. This year we did both the Animal actors show which was cute and also the Horror Makeup Show which was excellent. I will make sure to pay a visit to both when we return! We where there whilst Halloween Horror Nights and we visited 2 nights. Both nights where excellent, we loved the 80's heavy theming through out the houses and scare zones. Stranger Things being a particular favourite of ours. The show on the lake was amazing. Nice surprise for us - The Jimmy Fallon ride after reading not so good reviews we loved it!! Can't wait to visit again soon!!!

We had park to park passes and had a great time. No need for express passes because the wait times are reasonable. The characters are walking around and interact with you. We got through Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure in two days and were able to ride almost every ride and interact with multiple character. We wished we had booked more time here and less time at Disney.

This was much better than Disney. I'll never go back to Disney but I would go back the Universal. The characters are walking around and interact with you. The wait times for rides are reasonable. We were able to get through both parks, interact with multiple characters and ride almost every ride in two days.

We last visited about 5 years ago, so there have been many additions to both parks since our last visit. We love the new additions for Harry Potter. We enjoyed Diagon alley and Escape from Gringotts, the train ride connecting the 2 parks and our favorite was Hagrid's motorbike ride. We love that there are also food chains within the park so you don't have to eat the same old park fare. We had pretzels at Aunt Annies and a turkey leg at Thunder Falls. We enjoyed riding some old favorites, like Men in Black, The Mummy, Rip Rockit, and The Hulk. Be sure to get a fast pass by either staying at a resort hotel, or purchasing since it allows you to get on many more rides and avoid the long lines.

Universal studios was lots of fun on our girls adventure trip. We were in Orlando for 3 nights and visited Disney on day 2 and universal on day 3. We covered a lot of ground ( 11 miles in Disney) but we’re able to see/ experience many things we’d hoped to see. Universal studios was full of fun rides, great photo ops and adventure.  Parking was much easier at universal vs Disney. They offer a parking garage and lots of moving sidewalks making it much more accessible vs the buses/ teams etc that Disney has.

Universal Mardi Gras parade is a must see. Floats,dancers and beads everywhere. I was lucky enough to get a reservation on a float to throw beads. When in the park check out the Universal park App for Mardi Gras parade . Two hours before they will open up times to be on a float. But be quick because they close out fast!!
I really enjoyed the time we spent, the coolest rollercoaster is the ¨Hollywood Rip Ride Rockit¨ and The Harry Potter World was fantastic the food was greta and the client attention was good.

Universal studios is the place to go! Spent several days at Disney (unfortunately) and were very disappointed and felt cheated. Universal was wonderful! No ridiculous lines, lots of fun rides intermingled for all ages. Good restaurants with nice variety and fair prices. Can’t say a bad thing about. Employees were friendly, helpful and playful.

We had heard good things about the VIP Experience Tour and decided to go for it since none of us have patience for long lines. While there are a few things that could be improved, the whole experience was phenomenal and I would never recommend anything but the VIP Experience.  We arrived at around 9:00 am on a Friday for a 9:30 two-park tour. We had not had any communication from the park, so it was a bit confusing and we had to ask around to figure out where to go for check-in. Once we checked in, we were given badges and walking directions to La Bamba, the VIP Experience restaurant. With security, check-in, and walking to the breakfast buffet at La Bamba, we only had about 5 minutes to eat, so I'd recommend giving yourself a little more time. The breakfast buffet was underwhelming with styrofoam plates, a plastic tablecloth, and a meager selection. That being said, it was nice to have a few minutes to grab some eggs and bacon. Our group was two other families for a total of 9 people. All were very go-with-the-flow, so it was a great group.  Once we got going, we hit 12 rides over both parks from 9:30-4:00 pm. My daughter was unable to ride the taller rides, so we skipped the Hulk, which was the last ride for our group. The experience was great, and there was virtually no waiting at all, with very limited exceptions. We typically entered the rides through the exit or back-lot and walked right onto the rides, skipping the lines entirely. Our tour guide was phenomenal and very accommodating, particularly with our 6yo, and made sure everyone had a great time. Overall, it is less of an informational tour and more about getting a curated experience with zero lines.  Pros - We were able to ride 12 rides in one day, including all of the “greatest hits” (Hagrid’s Motorbike Adventure, Forbidden Journey, Escape from Gringott's) - True VIP experience: our guide made sure that we hit everything we wanted and more. He steered us away from the bad rides and even allowed our daughter to ride the Hippogriff coaster twice, when she couldn’t join the rest of the group on the big rides. - Great service – our guide had my daughters wand fixed/replaced at Ollivander’s twice due to issues. - Breakfast and lunch, along with bottled waters - No crowds to contend with and no lines whatsoever - Get to see some behind-the-scenes areas of the rides - Our tour guide was very responsive and made sure everyone was able to do what they wanted - The cost was only about $100 more/person than an express pass and worth much more - VIP pass turns into an express pass after the tour and gives you discounts on merchandise everywhere in the park - Ponchos for everyone on the Jurassic Park ride, which was helpful given the cooler temps that day  Cons - The communication beforehand was not great. There was not clear direction about where to go for the VIP Experience, even in the App. It would be nice to have some level of guidance. - La Bamba - The breakfast food at La Bamba was not great and the Styrofoam plates were not a good touch. The restaurant was very dated and the décor feels sad and tacky. The service was pretty lacking as well. - We did not spend enough time at Diagon Alley, which was what our group wanted to do. I understand that tour was about rides but it would have been fun to have a little more time to explore. We did get to go back afterwards and explore on our own. - There is some part of the experience that you miss by not going through the lines. For example, we didn’t get to see any of the inside of the castle - The experience has ruined us from ever doing anything but the VIP Experience in the future
Fast passes are a must to enjoy the rides and we’ll worth the extra cost. Ages 6-adult enjoyed moving quickly through the lines. A Fav park for us

First of all we had a good time but it was just my husband and I not an entire family! Parking is $26 and the ticket price varies but is a lot of money for most people. We had a one day pass and not the 2 park 1 day pass. We did Universal Studios and enjoyed the rides, especially Hogwarts and Jimmy Fallon. Luckily it was a quiet day and the lines not very long. We could have gone on rides multiple times if we wanted and if we had purchased the two park pass, had plenty of time to see the other park. I'm not sure how families afford the high food and drink prices along with the expensive tickets. We had a good time - but once was enough since there wasn't all that much that would bring us back to that park.
Arrived early, it was cool, and no crowds. Parking too expensive and did not eat. Jurassic Park good, Hulk roller coaster was wonderful. Poseidon's Fury terrible.

The park execs need to go over to Disney and figure out the benefits of having a much better app, queuing system and electronic wristbands. I feel like the park hasn’t updated itself in 15 years. The odd staff are outstanding, especially the performers and the characters. But overall a poor experience which is a shame because the rides are more fun than Disney but the overall experience is “needs to be better.”
Looking forward to going back. Everything was very good. Good rides, great interaction with Marvel characters. Nice change of pace from Disney

2 years ago we visited all 4 Disney parks. This year we tried Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure (me, my husband and 10 year old son). Universal was amazing! There's something for everyone - big coasters and tons of 3D and 4D rides and experiences. The Harry Potter experience was stunning and far exceeded our expectations. We went on a Wednesday, 85 degrees and sunny, and they longest wait was 25 minutes. If you're willing use the Single Rider line, it was 3-4 minutes. We rode most rides 2 or 3 times. We did not buy express passes as there were small crowds. If you haven't tried Universal yet, I highly recommend it!

Completely overrated and overpriced! Their staff is rude, clueless and urgently needs training!! I don’t mind paying for quality but paying $13 for a slice of pizza or $25 for inedible pasta is ridiculous. The worst part is the attitude of their employees. It’s like they don’t want to be there! My DD has food allergies, which was a non issue at WDW, but At Universal they made us feel like we were being difficult. The staff was not only clueless as to what ingredients were in the food but they were rude about it. One lady took forever to go get a manual, flip through pages to finally say well the burger you want is not on here. Another gentleman refused to serve us two scoops of ice cream - mind you the price was for 2 scoops- because he said it was going to fall off because the flavor we wanted was too soft and the cups were too small. How ridiculous is that! The $18 margarita we ordered tasted like bitter lemonade. For that price you’d think it would have some alcohol in it. So many examples of awful service but the worst was that we got a virtual ticket for jimmy Fallon ride for 8:10pm which is 10 minutes after the park closes. (See pic attached) You cannot wait in line for this ride. You need a virtual pass. However their system gave us a time that didn’t exist basically. So we couldn’t go on the ride at all!!! When we went to guest services to complain, instead of giving us a fast pass for another day, the lady just said it’s a technical issue, nothing we can do about it. You could tell she did not want to be there at all. I wish we would’ve stayed at WDW!! Horrible customer service at Universal!!!
This is a great place for older children and adults. The rides are great and the parks are very clean and well taken care of.

Our group of 10 enjoyed all the Universal Studios rides. Their favorites were Despicable Me, Fat and Furious, Escape from Gringotts, Hogwarts Express, !!!Hollywood Rip Ride Rockit, Men in Black, Race Through New York, Revenge of Mummy, and Transformers. We stayed at an AMAZING hotel, Hard Rock Universal, which gave us the privilege of front of the line access to rides, which is great for our group of 10. Hard Rock Universal is within walking distances which is absolutely wonderful, especially since the weather was beautiful. All in all we had a wonderful trip to Universal.

Wow, has it changed! Mostly for the better...  Shame that Back to the Future has been changed to the Simpsons ride.  MIB was good fun, and we got to visit the immigration room!  Last time I was here I was 15. This visit was for my 40th, and I was trying to picture the park in my head as it was, as I was walking around. Would have like to have seen somewhere that showed the park over the years, pictures & maps etc. Mels, with the cars outside, was a welcome sight. I remember the Jurrassic Park vehicles being near it in '95. (I still have a JP tamagotchi I bought at the time!)  So much to do, and something different for everyone.  The food in some places is very questionable, and not worth the money. Simpsons land (Krusty Burger) is one example of don't bother. Pizza slice from one of the vendors however, delightful, plentyful and worth the money.  Stayed for one of the Mardigras nights, and had a great time. Floats were great, dancers; Spectacular.  If you haven't been in a few years like me, then now is the time to go!  Last note: Get the fast pass, we were on rides within 20 mins for most parts, rode most twice within 30!

We spent four days visiting Universal Studios, Orlando and enjoyed every minute of our experience. By staying on property at Cabana Bay, we were able to maximize our experience, by being able to access the parks earlier than the general public. I have been a Disney fanatic, since 1972, but will no longer visit this them park, because of overcrowding and because Universal is a better theme park. It is constantly updating its attractions, so the park NEVER gets boring and although it has large crowds, we were able to get on EVERY ride we wanted to, unlike Disney. The water park, Volcano Bay is one of the best water parks, we have ever been to with lots of greenery to provide cooling shade and a great mixture of water activities for people of all ages. We have been Universal Studios on 5 different years and have never grown bored or tired of going back.

I visited last summer with my 12 year old son and we had a fantastic few days in this park. We managed to get in early, even though we weren't Universal hotel residents and got on three rides before 9am which was a bonus! The Minions ride is hilarious, as is the Simpsons ride. My son loved Transformers and we got to meet Optimus Prime, Bumblebee and Megatron at different times during our visit. When you come out of the shop, look to a shutter door to your right and that's where you'll find them. Harry Potter is FANTASTIC! Loved the way you walk through the wall to get there. We loved that experience and Escape from Gringotts was fantastic. Given that we were there during peak times, the queue times were really good and we got on lots of rides. Such a fun place to be, love it there.
1st visit, great time. Quick lines, awesome rides. Good family fun. Will definitely come back to visit.

This is the Best Theme Park that I ever go. It make the unforgettable experience for me in a good way. It's better than Disney World where I hope it's good as I expect when I was a kid after went to Disney land Paris but it turned out in another way.
An experience I ill never forget of both fun and wonder! Certainly one of the best parks in the world in one of funniest city ever!

We haven't been to this area in years, but Universal Studios was a highlight of our trip. We didn't buy the speed pass, but we didn't need it on the day we went. The waits were short, and the rides were all thrilling, (and we don't like rides!). We had a blast.

After the walking and stair climbing we did in one day, we felt like we completed the Universe! Would not have changed it for a thing. Universal definitely has the whole fast pass thing over Disney. Yes it is expensive, but only having one day to do it all we did 17 rides in 8 hours. This was worth every penny. Highly recommend going to Universal and spend the money if you don't have the time.

Good stay. Manageable in a day. But we accidentally went into Island of Adventure by mistake because the parks are right next to each other. The signage could have been better because we were very lost. It was our first time. But overall, we enjoyed ourselves and the Expresses passes are highly recommended!

We went to the park on a Tuesday on the first week of Feb. It was very nice to go on a day that wasn't packed and all the rides at the park were pretty easy to get on without a long wait. The longest wait was the Harry Potter ride and that was only 30 minutes. All the rides a great and updated and I am happy to see that compared to disney.

I went back to Universal Studios after 24 years and it brought me back to being a kid again. All the old attractions from then are gone (with the exception of E.T.) but it didn't matter as the new rides are exciting and a thrill to ride. My favorite was probably the Rip, Ride, Rocket roller coaster with The Incredible Hulk at Islands of Adventure being a close second. I would also highly recommend in investing in an annual preferred pass if you are planning on going to the parks more than twice a year. Additionally, it will save you money on such things as parking, concession stand discounts, and most importantly, allow you to ride the Hogwarts express from Park-to-Park! I will certainly be going back and making use of my annual pass to enjoy some of the things I might have missed on this weekend trip.

I've wanted to go to Universal Studio Florida for years. It's been a long, long time since we visited Universal in California and I'm a huge Harry Potter fan. We got the two park, three day resident ticket and stayed at a nearby hotel off the property. Getting to the hotel and the park was a hassle because of the construction. Universal had nothing to do with this.  Parking was quick and easy with guides to show me the way. The $26 fee was a bit steep - not unreasonable. The walk to the gates was reasonable, especially with the moving sidewalks. Buying the annual passes was a bit confusing. It was hard to tell where one was supposed to be.  Then, we got into the park.  Let me start out by saying that Universal is not Disney. Disney is organized by different Lands, like Epcot, Frontierland, and so on. Universal is more organized by different movies or shows. There were two sections dedicated to Harry Potter, the Simpsons, Jurassic Park, etc. Different and not bad. Disney sometimes is too flawless. Universal is a bit grittier. It's not as clean and completely acceptable.  The rides at Universal were, in general, awesome. I'm 69 years old. One of my traveling companions tricked me (by asking me) into riding a couple of the most intense coaster rides I've ever been on. I should have seriously reconsidered the ride when the ride required that prosthetic limbs be removed because they might fly off during the ride OMG. The Incredible Hulk Experience was like I never had before. Except for the Hollywood Red Ride which was almost as intense.  The train to Hogswart was a bit overdone. Hogsmeade in general was crowded - it was Harry Potter. We were unwilling to pay for Express or wait for an hour or so to ride the more popular rides. Almost everything else was simply wonderful.  We exited through Comic Strip village in Islands of Adventure. Very campy.  The next day we explored a bit more and rode the rides that told more of a story. Our first stop was Diagon Alley. It was exactly as I remember it from the movies. The wand shops were great, Gringotts was almost unbelievable. I bought a proof set of Gringotts coins. I expected to see a Quidich game overhead. The escape from Gringotts was, again, as I remember from the movie. I really felt a part of the movie.  Finally, they had a Mardi Gras parade in the French Quarter. I was amazed by the dancers, some of whom were on stilts that looked about 4 feet tall. And they danced. Awesome. We caught so many beads and the floats were well done.  The only hit on the entire day was being charged $5 for a half liter of water. That stung.  I highly recommend Universal Studio Florida. I'll wait until the Stunt show opens later this year.

Was here 15 years ago! Was looking forward to a fun time going on all the rides! Started with the Woody Woodpecker rollercoaster! Would suggest that they bring back the Back to the Future Ride . .instead of Simpsons! Very relaxed fun time.
