Get the park to park.  2. Express Pass. Not necessarily worth it but under certain circumstances a great deal. First, Express Pass is currently not available for the best ride - Hagrid. Second, we only had 30+ minute wait times on a few rides. BUT we went OFF PEAK and SUNDAY through TUESDAY. A weekend or holiday travel might make a speed pass a necessity.  3. Days. We did two days and got a third day free. This was good but not amazing. Frankly, we were done after two days and went back the third day to reride Hagrid, Forbidden Forest and buy a wand with a gift card we had.  4. Extra Hour from Universal Hotels. Meh. Studios opens early but Islands doesn't open early. Additionally, almost nothing at Studios is open before 9 am. So, don't plan on being done with Harry Potter at 9:05 am just because you got in an hour early. The best thing it does is helps you avoid the opening gate lines which can be sizeable and exhausting.  5. Food. It's crap and it's expensive - you already knew that. We bought cereal and milk for breakfast, budgeted park food at $50/day, and figured we could eat at more conventional off site restaurants for dinner....and we still got ripped off.  Eating at the park sucked. Jurassic Park and Krustyburger food was below McDonald's quality - even before considering the expense. Hogsmeade food was significantly better but was limited in selection and more expensive.  But here's the crappy part. The entire zone around the parks is a tourist trap - Fisherman's Wharf, Soho London, Times Square -- all Orlando is overpriced. Not just the City Walk area --- we dropped $50 at iHop on the same meal(s) we get in Chicago for $25. Burgers at Applebees were $10-$18 and only slightly more edible than Krustyburger. It's all a money grab, just try not to feed the monster uncontrollably  If you have off-peak questions I think I can answer but with EPIC already being prebranded -- I'm not sure how long my answers will be relevant.

My wife and I love coming here for the attractions. They have great parades and shows along with one of my favorite rides, Rip Ride Rocket! The park is very clean with friendly and helpful staff. The rides are my favorite part though because I love the 4D aspect. I'm not even that much of a Simpsons fan but I love hanging out in that area of the park. I highly recommend coming here!

The wife and I had one week of vacation. Decided to do the universal parks for two of our days. Worst mistake we have ever made. Four rides had breakdowns over the two day period. One, Gringotts broke down on at least three occasions on the same day. Paid for express pass, waited in line three times and were turned away each time on the 9th. Tried to purchase beverages on three different occasions and their computers were down. Rides are getting old, Simpsons ride, the door would not close on the ride. Very disappointed! Addressed customer service and were made to feel like liars. The gentleman said, [We have no record of those breakdowns]. And were turned away. And there were other issues with this gentleman. VERY BAD EXPERIENCE! These are the people who they put in customer service to deal with issues! Will never return!

As a senior I feel that Universal Studios is worth going to once. I don’t feel the need for a return visit. The best part was the Harry Potter section-it’s worth it to buy the park to park ticket so you can ride the Hogwarts express. I also enjoyed Kong, Spider-Man and ET.  The light show in the Harry Potter section was very good. The parade during the day was OK but I enjoyed the parade at Disney world much more.  It was worth staying at a hotel on site because it was easy to use the water taxi and because we were given express pass tickets. With express passes, we spent very little time waiting in lines.  We did not go on roller coasters so I cannot comment on that other than to say that we heard the newest ride had a waiting list of six hours and that was at 9 AM!  Be sure to order the hot butter beer drink and have the butter beer ice cream - especially if you like butterscotch flavor.  Start at the back of the park and do the Harry Potter sections first, early in the day. It gets too crowded in the afternoon. Do the other sections of the park in the afternoon

Love Universal. Great rides we chose Universal over Disney so we could do the new Hagrid Motorcycle Ride. We figured we don't have any little kids so Disney wouldn't be too much fun and we aren't really big Star Wars Fans.

Amazing! My husband and I really enjoyed all the attractions because most of them are in 3D or 4D very nice! I love going there in winter because the weather is amazing. February is a good month to go, I could repeat a lot of rides and we didn’t have fast pass at all.
180.00 each to get in. Would never go again. Too many other things to do around orlando. Pay 750.00 to wait in lines for 2 hours and so many rude people I couldn't believe it.
Some of my favourite rides are in this park could easily spend my whole holiday here, it's a must if your in florida
My family and I had a great 3 days at Universal. The rides were great and the lines were minimal. Harry potter world was beyond incredible!

We visited Universal Studios Jan 8th-11th, 2020. It was relatively quiet when we visited and we had short wait lines. In general compared to Islands of Adventure, the wait times were shorter at Universal Studios. The Mummy was our favourite ride. The Rip Rockin Rollercoaster- I found it very hard on the head as it was shaky. I will not ride it again although my partner went on it a second time. The Escape from Gringotts ride was pretty good. Be sure to check out the Universal App. The free lockers for individual rides were very easy to use, just scan your park ticket. Some of the locker areas were very crowded though based in layout. The Harry Potter area is very busy.

Only the Harry Potter Part was convincing, for all other attractions we had to wait almost ages to do them, the waiting times varied between 1 and 4 hours for one attraction, thats definitely too long, finally i was very disappointed, fazit: not recommandable

An absolute must for anyone visiting LA. It was amazing to see all those magical sets and rides. The guides were tremendous and very knowledgeable. It was fun being a part of the tv show Friends even though the real characters were absent.

Great parks some areas could you a refresh for sure. I would expect a park that is in competition with disney to be on the same level. I think I saw while I was there maybe 6 employees be polite and smiling the rest seemed like zombies and they were just there to be there. Will I return sure everyone deserves a second chance .

Universal Studios provides fun for all ages. Excellently organised from parking to security screening, access is swift and pleasant. All staff are courteous and helpful adding to the overall positive and upbeat atmosphere at Universal. There are plenty of amazing places to eat (book ahead) with a variety of eating experiences. Our favourite was Vivo Italian Kitchen or Bubba Gumps. Both serving great food, reasonably priced. The Wizarding World of Harry Potter is our favourite place with our two favourite rides. Escape from Gringotts is brilliant, Hagrids Magical Creatures Motorbike cannot be missed and The Forbidden Journey is my all time favourite. The detail of design in every ride and building is incredible. Choosing your wand at Ollivanders is something you will always remember, 55 euro will buy you an interactive wand that can be used through The Wizarding World of Harry Potter with lots of interesting spells to be cast by your own hand. This was our third visit to Universal and ai doubt it will be our last. A wonderful holiday for adults and children. It is expensive and fast pass adds a lot of extra expense however I would only buy them at peak times, short wait times are totally possible at low volume dates. Staying at some Universal Hotels offer fast pass as part of your package and are worth considering. If you are staying outside the park, Parking is 40 euro a day so booking a hotel with a shuttle bus is a great saving. Universal is magical with so much to do. An excellent holiday.

I took my 5 year old daughter to Disney and my 10 year old son here. This is for the older kids for sure. He went to Disney when he was 6 and thought it was OK. He loves roller coasters and thrill rides so Universal was such a better option for him.  We opened and closed the park. We started at Universal in the morning, right at opening. I bought the Fast Passes for Islands of Adventure for 4 pm and later. You can do both parks in one day and if I had to pick a park, IOA has the better coasters and thrill rides. We were able to get right in to a lot of rides by going early. If I hadn’t have gone during Christmas break, I don’t think I would have needed a fast pass at all. It’s very expensive during busy times. $100/ticket for fast passes after 4pm and that’s the reason for my 4 and not 5 star rating. Prices have just gone up so drastically the last few years.  Universal has mostly 3D/4D simulations and mild thrill rides. Perfect for younger children and still fun due to the movie/show themes. We go to Cedar Point in Ohio and the coasters there are super tall, fast and scary compared to Universal. I enjoy both types of parks. My son had a blast and got brave enough to ride the Hulk at IOA towards the end. Definitely a wonderful memory for us both!
Crowded beyond belief..prices has gone sky high. Tickets and food was 1500$ for a day of parkwalking in Line.

Been 10 years since i last went and just short of 20 since mum last went!!safe to say massive floride blues going off right now!! Anyone ever gets the chance to go....take it! You wont regret it especially at Universal fun for all no matter how old or how many times you've been on rides previously!

Love this park, great for young and old. So much to see and do. Grinchmas best show ever. Meeting the Grinch wow wow. All the superheroes great. Staff here was really helpful with our son in wheelchair made sure he got to meet his favourite superhero’s thank you so much. Harry Potter everything is great although gets very packed, wish the shops was bigger because you can’t get in them with a big wheelchair. Only let down is the food places, seems more expensive than Disney and on busy days take ages to queue for food. We was there Thanksgiving week and queued for 40 minutes for food this was after walking around for few to find anywhere with seating.

It’s just an absolutely amazing place to be and see the kids excitement and disbelief at everything that’s going on. The rides are excellent, Harry Potter ones are something else, it is busy, you need fast passes to make the day enjoyable. We had a day of going around slowly and getting all the photo opportunities and videos to remember the place. Then had two days with fast passes and just did everything on offer. Really couldn’t bare some of the queues, anything from 45 to 2 and a half hours. Something to think about. Especially if it’s hot. Would be horrible without them I think. Also be there when it’s dark the place just seems like another world.

Great theme park. We’ve been many times over the years. Buy the fast pass, it’s definitely worth it. Otherwise, you’ll spend most of your day waiting in line instead of riding the rides. Cheap it’s not, but candidly I wouldn’t do it without & I’m a season ticket holder.

I have to say I love Universal better than Disney. I think now my son is a teenager, this park is more suited to us. It was quite busy some days but others we were walking on the rides and managed to go the whole park twice. Spiderman was always my favourite but Transformers and Kong have sneaked ahead. We had the refillable drink which was a god send some days but the queuing for a refill could quite often get frustrating, especially when there's 1 member of staff run off their feet.

Leaving from our 5 night stay at Universal Studios. What a wonderful trip and I definitely had more fun and enjoyment than my girls. We went with a family of four. Myself, husband and two girls Ages 19 and 13. We went for My daughters 13th birthday. I will give you the tips I learned from this trip. 1). Definitely stay at a Universal hotel. Staying in one that includes express pass is the only way to go in my opinion. The Parks are a short walk or boat ride away. Boats run every 10 mins or so until Past midnight. So convenient! 2). To me it would be a big waste of money to come to these parks without express pass. Whether you stay in hotel which includes them or buy them yourself, although ridiculously expensive, it’s the only way to see everything and enjoy yourself with little stress. We literally walked right on 80% of the rides and the ones we waited for was maybe 15 mins at the most. 3). The new Harry Potter motorcycle ride does not take express pass but worth the wait. So cool! 4). Wait to go on the Harry Potter rides a few hours after opening. The lines become a little shorter. 5). Harry Potter area in both parks is always packed with people no matter what time. We rode all the rides for Harry Potter multiple times but then left the area as way too crowded. The rest of the park was not too crowded. 6). We went to the new Harry Potter ride right at opening and there was a 120min wait due to all the people who enter Universal at early 8 am access(another perk to staying in a Universal hotel) take the HP train (very neat) over to Island of Adventure and get on line for the ride. Island of Adventure opens at 9 (no early access there this time of year) and everyone heads right to HP. 7). The wait times for rides that are listed are never that long! The 120min HP wait took us less than an hour and the last 20 mins was inside which is so cool to see and look at that it doesn’t seem like your waiting in “line” and it moves quick. The other HP rides all except express Pass and we rode them all multiple times. Escape from Gringotts is one of the best! 8) Express pass is always faster than single rider line if you have it. If not it’s a good option as well as child swap. 9). Ride the Hulk roller coaster. It’s the BEST!! 10). Enter park early and see Despicable Me. The line gets long quick! 11). I still love E.T. And miss Jaws! 12). Did I mention how express pass is a Must!! 13.) buy an “all day refill cup”. You do have to add $ to it each additional day but you can refill as many times as you want. Best is to buy one and all the stands will refill with cold ice water for all the days there. 14). The only negative thing I can say is that everything is so expensive! Admission. Express pass and the food and drink is really too expensive.
We did 16 rides in one day on New Year’s Eve with the express pass. While the express pass is very $$$ but was so worth it. Cant wait to make a trip back to the area again

When we plan a trip to Disney world, we usually set aside a day for Universal. But many things disappointed me this time and I wanted to post this review to have people consider if they really want to spend the money for a day there. At least so your homework. 1) First if all - if you want to see all of Happy Potter - you will need to pay to get into 2 parks. We payed $185.31 ($174+tax) for a 2 Park one day ticket per person. It costs more if you buy at the ticket booth in the park. I used a mobile delivery and had the ticket delivered to my smartphone. That’s a lot of money for a family of 4.  2) This time of year - the park is only open until 7pm. A lot of ground to cover for 2 parks and considering how much you are paying g for a ticket. 3) So you would expect the rides to be in good working condition. Especially the widely popular Harry Potter section. When we got there, the 2 rides in IOA: the new Hagrid’s Motorbike ride was closed. Harry Potter and the forbidden journey was experiencing delays. So we headed to The Eacape from Gringots ride at Universal. Wait was posted as 55 minutes. The line went slowly. We wished we had our backpack with some drink and snacks - but we had to put it in a locker ! We got to near of the end of the line after waiting in the queue for more than a 90 minutes and they “flushed the queue” due to technical difficulties! They did give us a FP on the way out - but it didn’t seem to cover the time lost (I could have went on 3 Other rides), sore feet and back from waiting in line that long (hey that’s messing with my Health and ability to do other things as a result of pain); needless to say - everyone was very upset. Not to mention that the People in line flooded the streets and now everything else was impossible to get into. Even Hogwarts express train - wasn’t an express and had a 55 minute wait. So we quickly Rushed to the Leaky Cauldron - which had really filled up. We were able to get some good food and rest a while. My Cottage pie came with a salad and was very good. We also got the bangers and mash - and my so. And his GF enjoyed those. Hubby got the fish pie and enjoyed that. We also got a kids Mac and cheese with a side of grapes and applesauce which also was good. They do seat you - maybe because it was busy. But we ended up getting a seat against the wall that was quiet. After we were done - we checked the time for Hogwarts Express - and it was still long ! So we headed to the front of the park where we could use the Front entrance to switch to the other park (IOA) since the Hogwarts Express lube was too long.. Disappointing. I used the opportunity to visit with guest relations.  4) Guest relations and what they can do: I’ll start out by saying the young woman who assisted us was very nice. However, the best she could do was offer us each another FP. I would have preferred a partial refund or another FP. I also brought up the fact that we had to pay for a locker for the ride - she didn’t bring it up on her own. Practically had to beg to get the $2 back. But She did give us $2 cash.  5) which brings me to the lockers. Most of the thrill rides have the lockers. It’s a pain and time consuming to get your stuff in and out. It requires the code from your ticket - but the code doesn’t work from a smartphone and you need to get a paper one from an attendant in the area. On top of that - If you need a Large locker - you need to pay $2 for it. We had a large backpack -So we had to pay it. They don’t take cash. You need a credit card. And you need to spend this $2 for each ride !!! What a way to make even more money after robbing you the cost of your ticket !  6) we finally got into IOA thru the front entrance. We bypassed the Incredible Hulk and the Spider-Man ride so we could get to the back of the park to check out the Wizarding world of Harry Potter before it was dark. On the way - we also noticed the King Kong ride was partially outside. So after taking some pics in Harry Potter world I’m the daylight - we back-tracked to the Skull Island King Kong ride instead of using a FP to ride Harry Potter and the forbidden journey. Since the line was long and the ride is inside, we figured we could come back. We waited a little while in the FP King Kong line - and it was very cool - albeit a bit shorter than I expected.  7) the Hagrid motorbike line was over 100 minutes and had closed on and off thru the day, so...  8) we went back to Harry Potter to find the Forbidden Journey ride closed !! It was 6pm and they were closing in an hour and we had not ridden any Harry Potter rides! We made a bee-line for the Howard’s express - but we first had to wait in line to go thru the ticket line to go to the other land in Universal. After waiting for 10 minutes in the ticket line we the. Went to wait in the Hogwarts express line. I checked the wait times one more time to see if Escape from Gringots might have reopened - holding out little hope - since it was closed most of the day after our wait. Miraculously it was open with a 25 minute wait. We made a bee-line to it after our Hogwarts express ride. We barely made it Into line at 6:58. And after waiting the allotted time - we finely were able to ride the ride! So we didn’t go home totally disappointed.  8) on a positive note - after we were done the ride - we wandered around a mostly deserted Diagon Alley. We also finally saw the dragon breath fire. The dragon didn’t breathe fire thru the day. Which is another negative. I believe the dragon breathed fire all thru the day when we were there last 5 years ago.  Thru the day we also managed to go on the Mummy, MIB and the Simpsons.  That’s 7 rides in 8.5 hours. That’s $26.47 a ride. I guess you have to also account for lunch and ambiance... but still... I can understand that the new Hagrid ride might be done because it’s new - but the other 2 have been around for over 5 years ! They shouldn’t be down. If they need maintenance - please do the maintenance in the Off-hours when no one is in the park. Also note that I read that one of the Harry Potter rides will be down for maintenance Jam 16-17 - so consider that if you plan to go on either of those days.  9) did i mention that you can save some time and get FPs for all the rides by staying on property ($$) or buying a FP ticket for all the rides for a mere $96 on top of what you’re paying already... thanks Universal ...  10) we won’t be going back any time soon. The old rides we’ve done and we’ll wait for the Harry Potter rides to be fixed or for the popularity to wean... if you really need to go - I recommend you do your homework. Download the “Universal wait times” app and monitor it a few days prior to going... check and see thru the day if the rides remain up. And buy your tickets online a day or so before you plan to go when you know the weather will be good and the rides are running. You can use the ticket they send you to your email from your phone.  Good luck !  ... And I hope to see some better ticket discounts and or longer hours from Universal for their customers. Otherwise I believe they are just thinking of making the most $$ for themselves.
We only had one day so we paid extra for fast passes. We had such a great day. The highlight was all the Harry Potter rides & worlds but the Jurassic Park ride was fantastic too. Greatly recommended

We came down to visit the Harry Potter experience but wanted to enjoy the rest of the park as well. My biggest issue with the park is that some of the rides won’t accommodate larger riders. That was a huge bummer after spending the amount of money we did to come down to visit. The attention to detail everywhere in the park is impressive. My husband thoroughly enjoyed the Incredible Hulk coaster. He bought a Spider-Man onesie, and we both really liked the marvel comic book area. The Spider-Man ride was super cute. The mummy was lots of fun. I was really excited for the men in Black ride (I remember it from years ago), but it seemed lackluster compared to the newer rides. The minion ride was cute, and the videos made the wait time not seem so bad. The shrek experience apparently needs new glasses. Everything just looks blurry not 3D. The wait times were a little high for this being the off season. The carousel was neat. The cat in the hat was ok. We ate at the Confisco Grille which was excellent. We had ice cream at the parlor in Diagon Alley, and it was tasty but it would’ve been nice to be able to sample it first. The shop keepers were all fabulous. Fast and the Furious was fun. The transformers ride was fun. We were able to do way more in the same amount of time than we were able to at Disney. The people mover made it much easier to gain access. Going between the two parks was fairly easy until the train had a 70 minute wait. It would be nice to have another way to get between the two parks without having to walk all the way around and re-enter. Security was easy. Guest services were friendly.

Family of five, with mix of teen, almost teen and young child. It was during Christmas week. Excellent experience especially after we visited Disney 3 times before and on the same week we visited 2 parks at Disney and it was terrible compared to Universal. Our only negative comment was the pricing of the fast pass (express pass) was overpriced. Otherwise it was a beautiful experience.
This was our first ever visit to florida. We had the best time ever and are already planning our next trip in November 2020. You must visit chocolate emporium, you will be amazed.

We knew going into the visit the park would be at peak numbers if guest. We still had a day to go and scout out both islands of adventure and universal studios to see if we would want to include them in future Orlando vacations. 1. The rides are very impressive however, very hard to get onto due to the insane wait times. 2. Unlike other parks in the area I feel like at universal their only real options are rides,food, and shopping. They do not offer many shows or other entertainment options that would greatly help reduce the wait times and make the park flow better. 3. We went with our 16yr old and 4yr old. Unless they start offering more shows and Maybee even more rides and attractions to help reduce wait times we will not go back. 4. To be able to meet some of the characters you have to go in the ride first and at the end meet the characters. When the wait for the ride says 120min + not a good choice. 5. They need to be as honest as possible and not out 120min+ and be more accurate with the actual real wait times

We came for Disney, had 2 days spare so tried universal, as the kids wanted more scarier rides. Had fast passes so didn’t wait for anything, thought all the scenery was great, Harry Potter section was really good. Got lucky with minimal crowds. The Gringot ride broke down when we were on it, but we got to go on it again (although sent around the employee section to get back on, so the ‘magic’ was lost there. Really should of just let us stay in the car and go again). The down side to it being more exciting for teenagers and up, is there are obnoxious teenagers and up there. Had a group of 9 push in front of us halfway in the waitline for the mummy- started with 3, then all their friends pushed through and joined them. Lots of 3D and 4d rides, not sure if it’s just me but they feel like the cheaters way out of making a ride, and my eyes were sore by the end of the day. caught an Uber there and back from Disney resort- cost around $20.

I've visited Universal Orlando numerous times in the past 20 years and always enjoyed it. Now as a mom of a 4 year old, I have to say experiencing the park with him was a whole new awesome experience. Now I will disclaim that aside from Dr. Seuss, Camp Jurassic and the Super Hero encounter, other than a lot of site seeing, there may not be many rides you can take a 4 year old on, but to explore the park and to see it bring to life movies and shows you've both seen there is still so much to enjoy. Camp Jurassic for us was were it was at though! Free exploration, cave, caverns, glowing amber caverns, waterfalls that run through the caves, bridges, the echo cavern... it goes on! It really is such a splendid place for kids to explore. Parents just be ready to the physical requirements! There a lot of climbing, stairs, net climbs and if you have a little one that is as excited as ours was to explore everything, the right shoes are a must :) but be ready for the joy in adventure without the lines for a while. What a great place for the kids! So in 2019 was the first time we visited as a family, and thanks to military discounted tickets we were able to go back 4 more times for a great price! the park to park ticket is a must! Don't let anyone tell you otherwise, I don't know why they still sell the single park ticket. Harry Potter is beautiful! The design, the details, the characters, the fire breathing dragon, and all the special interactive things for wizards with the interactive wand can do! What a blast! UO can literally make a third park strictly Harry Potter and it would be amazing! Super Hero Island is great for my kiddo; HOWEVER, what a bummer they can't really expand and bring more of the recent MCU... I say this because my son WAS the biggest Thor fan and we could not find much Thor merchandise unless we wanted to fork our $$$ for the collectors statues (which we already have). A HUGE thank you to the Dr. Doom and Green Goblin characters! On our first visit, my son was dressed in his Thor hammer shirt and brought his hammer with him, what a blast how Green Goblin and Dr. Doom played out a scene, failing to lift the hammer for they were not worthy! What a blast, what a memorable experience. Jurassic Park exploratory is a nice place for the young dino enthusiast! We love going there when its a bit quieter to explore on the interactive activities and dinos, and the learn that the skeletons on display were the actual props from Jurassic Park! Thank you to the specialists there who let us in on that bit of information! The dining past over the years has really tightened up where it's not much of a deal for families. It's advised you eat a good breakfast, and perhaps consider exploring the good food options just a walking distance away in City Walk! Take a look, so many options for a decent print (theme park price) but more options, and better quality that some of the options in the mean deal. So much to say, you'll love the park. Do you research and see how other families/locals save some money and truly get the most out of their experience. Also, the UO phone app is WONDERFUL! You can store your ticket info. makes it easy to present and great in the event you misplace your physical ticket temporarily. You can check the status of rides, wait times, times for events all at the convenience of your phone. It's a very well done app.

I went with friends to Universal Studios, primarily to ride the new Hagrid's roller coaster. The first day, the app said the line was 2 hours long, and we arrived four hours before the Park closed -- they had already closed the line for the day. The second day, the app said the line was 9O minutes long, and we arrived five hours before the park closed, and once again they had closed the line for the day already. The third day, at noon they had signs out saying the ride had already met capacity, but a line agent said there were technical problems (despite what the signs said).  Given all of the advertising about the new coaster, you would think that any company that had any commitment to customer service would go the extra mile to make sure that as many guests as possible ride the ride. Given that Universal is owned by Comcast, it seems that the infection for zero customer service is catching......  I also wrote to the park directly and got an amazingly lame response. They basically acknowledged that they don't ever want to pay employees to have to stay keeping the ride open until the line went down after park closing. The way they're doing it, employees are probably even getting off early!  Universal Orlando, where the customer experience is well down the list of priorities......

Went to Universal on 27 Dec. We were very exited to see the Harry Potter side of the parks. Arrived at 7.30 and managed to enter by 8.00. Had a park to park ticket with express passes for both parks. During the day, especially at Island of Adventures it was literally not possible to walk due to the numbers of people the park allowed to enter. Despite the numbers, the park continued to sell express passes. There do not seem to be a restricted number of passes and anyone who is willing to pay may get one. As Island of Adventures had 3 HP rides it was even more crowded than US. It was not possible to even walk through the Hogsmeade village. There were a queue at the butterbeer stand that snaked through the entire park and with the queues for the rides it was literally gridlocked. Never ever ever go to Universal in December. It is a sure and solid waste of money. Some of the other rides faired a little better. We were 12 people in our group and simply gave up around 6 pm and left the park. A very expensive mistake. If you are of a body type that is the larger side please be aware that you will not fit into some of the rides. Don't waste money on an express pass and then not be allowed to ride. The other serious ripoff is the backpack storage. They have free lockers for a very small bag. Anything bigger cost $2 for every ride. We spent another $40 on bag storage. First you queue to store tha bag and then to do the ride. All in all not worth it. Go on the most unpopular day of the year if you want to enjoy it.

There were unfortunate staff errors and a bit of a run-around with our tickets upon arrival, but a really great employee "fixer" got us all squared away and even comped me a Universal hoodie for our trouble. I wish I remembered her name, but she was the BEST.  The price for an Express Pass is exorbitant, but on this crowded day I'd estimate that we were able to enjoy at least 2-3 times as many attractions as we would have without it. The standard wait times were terrible at many attractions, and I don't come to parks like this to stand in line all day. Bottom line, the pass let us enjoy our day rather than being constantly frustrated.  Price gauging is rampant at all the Orlando parks, and Universal is no exception - two simple veggie burgers with fries and sodas at Mel's Diner set us back almost 40 bucks. That's ridiculous, and the Universal execs should be ashamed of themselves.  Employees were generally very nice, with the notable exception of a french braid sporting sour-faced girl at the Harry Potter locker area - this unhappy soul was just as rude as she was dull, angry, and incompetent. This type of employee needs to be scrubbing bathrooms after hours, not interacting with customers.  But the new coaster, Hagrid's Magical Creatures Motorbike Adventure, was innovative, packed with fun surprises, and easily the best thing I rode all day. It's a can't-miss, to be sure.
Very easy. And if you follow the directions, even easier. I’ve already recommended this to a friend.

This is the place where they want you to wait in line. When the line is shorter so you can get the attraction before the marked wait time then they announce a break. My kids were very disappointed that they asked to leave the place. In addition, it is expensive and really laud.

Visited with family in December rides are amazing but staff are rude and so unpleasant! If you deciding between parks then Disney is a better option for value and respect of guests and cleanliness. The Restaurants are dirty and we were told if we want a clean table to wipe it down ourselves. We went to both universal and Island is adventure, we were rudely told what line to be in, the staff have no clue where rides are or what time characters appear and there is no schedule and if there is one they don’t stick to it. When you complain to guest services all they say is “sorry” Universal has a lot to learn from Disney Parks!!!

We went to Universal Studios Theme Park in November. It was a good time of year to go there, warm but not too hot and cool in the evenings. Although it was warm in the day, as soon as the sun went down it got pretty cool. The first day I was there I had to buy a hoodie. We discovered that we could get on the rides as quickly as the people that bought the fast pass if we went into the single rider lines. Many of the rides you can't really converse with your friends on the rides anyway and it made the time waiting a lot less. The down side of this is that in some cases you miss part of the experience. For instance in the Harry Potter Castle there is a lot to see as you wind through the line. The singles line bypasses many parts. For me the sacrifice was worth the time savings!

Pizza prices inside Universal Studios was $30 per pizza which is outrageous on a holiday when so much crowd depend on inside the studios food. Many rides were shown false wait times where as in actual they were able to be done in half the time posted in the app. Management to please be fair with the Customers on pricing and true with wait times.

Again, this park does not disappoint. Always lots going on, fun rides and so much to see. Don’t know how anyone can’t like it. When there in September most rides were walk ons or a very short wait & finally got to try the large donut and a flaming mo 🔥

Spent the day exploring Universal Studios as well as Islands of Adventure to experience all the Harry Potter settings and rides. Hagrid's Magical Creatures motorbike tour was an awesome rollercoaster ride, the Forbidden Journey is an excellent simulator ride (as long as you don't get motion sickness). Over the 2 parks these were my top 3: . The Hulk . Hagrid's Magical Creatures motorbike . The Rip Tide Rockit Staying at the Hard Rock hotel enabled us to get in earlier, worth the price.
Going from one park to the other aboard the Hogwartz train is a must! I love both Universal and Islands of Adventure. Both parks have something for everyone.

It is certain that you will enjoy the magic and amusement of the attractions, 3D, 4D, rides and the embellishment of magical worlds will delight the whole family, however, be prepared to spend a lot of cash $$$, these attractions are certainly expensive. Parking, entrances, and overpriced souvenirs and meals. Also Christmas and New Year is so overcrowded that you should mentally prepare for long lines of several hours to experience few minutes on the greatest attractions, or pay for express tickets or ride solo where possible. The park is well suited for the whole family and teens. You will probably walk a lot, stay standing in lines a lot, and get significantly tired. Multiday, muliti park tickets if you go to experience it several days will certainly help.

The only way I thought to maximise 1 full day at the two parks in Dec was to go for a VIP Experience! Was this worth it ? Totally in my opinion, I kept it a surprise for my daughter and it did not disappoint. We could do 13 rides with no ques, better than fast pass, behind the scenes access and breakfast and lunch included. The Vip experience for 2 adults was about $900 you need to purchase separate park tickets which were $373 through another site on Facebook that does price comparisons... Caught lyfts there and back about $26 each way ... with our guide Sara We caught the Hogwarts express The rides we did : Harry Potter and the forbidden journey wait time would have been 175mins Flight on the hippogriff Skull island Hulk coaster Adventures of 🕷 man Lunch from 12:30 till 13:15 at cafe la bamba Despicable me minion mayhem Hollywood rip rider rock it Transformers Race through New York Jimmy Fallon Revenge of the mummy Simpson’s ride And men in black Harry Potter escape from gringotts ￼ Unfortunately Hagrids motorcycle 🏍 was down .. A really great experience! Express passes after and 10% discount on merch

Only spent time in Universal and Islands of Adventure. Too cold for Volcano Bay. Great parks. Many roller coaster rides and other attractions but frequent (glitches)/breakdowns, which are badly managed. Was stuck on Gringotts ride for 45 mins, was given a bump to front of queue pass which was a complete waste, as it is not valid on most rides and I was still pushed into the normal queue. Only managed to get on Hagrid’s ride once due to breakdowns and queue lengths. Even the single rider lane is busy as family groups use it which should be not allowed. Lots of walking to be done and distances can be tiring but plenty of places to stop, sit, eat or drink. Enjoyed ourselves very much. Highly recommend a FAST PASS. It really does save time queuing.
Realy nice "town" from the Harry Potter-movies! Great Service and personal working there and we will not forget!

Park not overly crowed, most wait time approx 30/45 mins in Dec 19/ Jan 20 apart from the new Harry Potter ride which was 255 minutes but very worth it! This ride is outstanding it will leave you wanting more. The only negative thing is its the only ride that doesn’t accept express pass so just normal line only. Free parking after 6pm, we turned up one afternoon at 17:10 and the man didn’t charge us which i thought was good of him. We stuck to Disney for years with the kids being smaller but now there all for Universal, could do with a few smaller roller coasters as the minimum heights for the big ones are either 48 or 54 inches the youngest is 47 3/4 so depends on who’s on the measurements some let her on some don’t. Still a excellent place for them and highly recommend it. Harry Potter attractions either if your a fan or not os amazing.

enjoyable experience being a kid again; luckily for us no long wait times so no fast pass needed; longest waits were for harry potter castle b/c it was new at that time; pretty long wait to ride train though

As a Floridian we are annual pass holders simply because there is no better place in Orlando to have a great day. The one caveat to that is the lines. They are everywhere. If you can afford the express pass, get one, otherwise just be very patient. It's great fun, but yes, every ride only lasts a few minutes and you can wait for an hour or more, in some places. Halloween and Christmas time is our favorite.

Our family decided to visit this park on Monday December 23 2019. I had previously read about long wait times during Christmas but we were very lucky and wait times were reasonable. We have visited this park 3 other times before but never in December. The park has alot to offer but on this visit the employees seemed miserable. They complained about working there and acted like the job was an inconvenience to them. I will not go back to universal studios until I have grandkids some day. The park was clean. The rides were good but ET is a bit run down. The refillable cup was good and negative. If you buy a refillable cup you dont wanna throw it in the trash to get on a ride so you have to put it in a locker. If you accidentally forget about your stuff in the locker and go back later to get it well you get charged , so make sure you have a game plan for every small detail. You can take snacks and a back pack in which is nice but it's more to keep up with. Food is high but its an amusement park so its expected. Parking is 26 dollars so preplanning for a trip there is very smart. Preplanning every thing including the times you visit the most popular rides.

We just finished our last day at Universal and it was the best week with the family! We had so much fun and we have so many team member to thank!! We went on Men in Black and Sarah was nice and friendly! My daughter loved Men in Black the most and even getting the highest rank! Very cool! My wife and kids volunteered me to do Fear Factor and that was a blast!! I unfortunately didn't win but the cast and crew made it a great time! Gabby was very sweet and funny when she was getting my helmet on me and the guys in all black keeping me safe did an amazing job making it fun! Chase was funny and serious about the safety made it great! We ate dinner at Big Fire and it was a great way to end the trip. Thank you Universal and your employees for making it a great week!
We had lots of fun but the express pass lines were huge. They should limit the amount sold because it was still a wait and line seemed longer at some rides. But still a great experience
We all loved it.. Great rides (MUCH better than almost every Disney ride) and better queues.. Even better with express passes.

My family and I visited Universal in late December for two days. We purchased two day park to park with unlimited express pass. Although, the park was crowded we never waited for more than 20 mins for any ride. Since we purchased the unlimited express, we rode all our favs multiple times! It was fantastic because our items could stay in the lockers while we repeatedly rode our favs! This was definitely money well spent! Why doesn’t wdw offer this?My family and I had a blast and created more memorable family moments! We will definitely return!

We have visited Universal many times of the past 10 years, and sadly they have never been the best experience. Nothing to do with the park itself, but I have a daughter with mental illness and it becomes overwhelming for her and for us. This visit thanks to amazing customer service, my daughter had the best time ever almost without an episode, which was when we knew it’s time to leave - not after half hour as per usual visits BUT 4 and half hours! Can’t thank Universal and staff enough!
Located in Islands of Adventures its a roller coaster that gave Harry Potter's groundkeeper his due. Its the Hogsmeade section of the park.

Very expensive over the new year and the queues ere pretty bad but amazing experience. The rides are out of this world. Unfortunately did not get on the new Harry Potter ride as there was a 5 hour queue!

With limited time available we decided to splurge and do the two park VIP experience. We were in a small group of 7 worth 3 teens. Luckily we got the brilliant Logan as a guide. The whole experience from start to finish was fabulous - we felt totally like VIPS walking straight into rides and going through all the secret entrances. Logan’s knowledge is outstanding and he tailored the day to everyone! We did 12 rides during the day and never felt rushed and wholeheartedly recommend the VIP experience - it will make standing in lines at other parks very tedious!

Be aware that you have to put your stuff in lockers. Some lockers you have to pay and some you don’t. They need to have the same type of lockers for each ride because you get confused on what to do with putting your stuff in the lockers.

We visited Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure with a Park to Park pass on December 23. We stayed on site at Loews Royal Pacific in order to take advantage of the included express passes. This was a must for the holiday week! We were able to walk to the park for early admission, then bypass lines of 60-90 minutes and get to all the attractions we were hoping to do in both parks. We started with Diagon Alley. (True to the books, it's not well advertised. You have to search for it!) This area is really well done, and the Gringotts dragon is amazing! Our family is not a fan of roller coasters, but the Gringotts ride was fine. There is a gradual drop at the beginning, but nothing too fast or steep. Be aware you need to store your bags in a locker before riding; the process was pretty easy. We took the Hogwarts Express to the Islands of Adventure. The ride itself wasn't super exciting, but the setting of the train station and watching the Hogwarts Express pull up to platform 9 3/4 was fun. Be prepared to show your park-to-park ticket before boarding the train. Aside from the Wizarding World, we tried out a number of the simulator rides. Avoid the Simpsons ride if you are prone to motion sickness. Despicable Me has stationary seats in the front for people who prefer that. When you need a break from the rides, the Horror Make Up Show is a lot of fun! Wear your walking shoes, and don't let rain scare you away, as many of the lines and attractions are indoors.

We visited Universal Studios over the new year holidays and had a blast! We did a two park for three days ticket and explored every corner of Universal Studios and Island of Adventure. The parks are wonderful and full of things to see and do.

Took my wife and 2 sons (ages 13 and 15) here on vacation. These were the perfect ages for my kids. We really had a great time. The park itself looks like a city and really makes you feel like you’re walking down the streets in New York and Beverly Hills. The new Harry Potter section is also ridiculously realistic and makes you feel like you’re in the movie. Most of the rides are 3D Simulation rides and are incredibly real looking. This was an expensive vacation but ended up being one of the most fun family vacations that we’ve had. I highly recommend this park.

Went at Christmas time (27th Dec) and it was so busy and the prices were eyewatering and you pay more on top of this to park. Dont go in the holidays is my very strong recommendation. For a party of 6 with 1 day in 1 park with fast passes was £2500. Without the fast pass it would have been 4 hour waits for each ride. The ride experience was very good for Transformers, Gringotts and had fun on MIB ride; even for fast passes the waits were 1 hour....... It was a one off experience and I wouldnt go again

We toyed with the idea of a VIP experience or Express passes for Universal Studios and decided on Express. I’m glad we did this as there wasn’t anywhere near as much to do here as Island of adventure. They were well worth having as went straight to the front of the queues as it wasn’t hugely busy. I personally really enjoyed the rides here although a bit samey. Kids enjoyed it less and was more interested in the churros but had a lovely leisurely day all the same.

This is a great place to visit - from Marvel to Harry Potter - Dr Suess to The Simpsons, something for everybody here! Plenty to see and do - we stay in a Universal Hotel for one night, that gives you 2 days unlimited fast passes, which is cheaper than buying them and I wouldn't do the park without fast passes. You must ride Hagrid's Motorbike ride - out of this world!
Had a great time, but the one day, two park ticket price has just got out of control. $209.00 per person is just to high!! For 11 people it was more than my home monthly mortgage.

Really enjoyed the continual improvements they’ve put into USF. The synergy between universal and nbc brands really creates some fun new experiences like Tonight Show ride and Today cafe.  Biggest opportunities for improvement: 1) It’s time for a reboot of the kids areas: curious George, fievel, and Barney all look dated and irrelevant.  2) Would love to see ET rebooted or rebranded into a Strangers Things attraction, Universal has already acquired those rights for HHN.  3) too many simulators. Watching a screen in a moving seat might be cheaper to create but it’s not that fun. Would love to see USF focus on more innovative ride systems instead of motion simulators.

I realise that in the current day and age that space is at a premium, but there is simply no excuse for the level of motion simulators in this park It's literally every single ride  Fast and furious ? Not fast nor furious in fact it's a damp squib and not worth waiting for, it's like someone blew the budget for the ride on led lights and fancy cars and never bothered with the ride I expected something like rita queen of speed or Aerosmiths ride. Nope nothing, you dont even have to buckle in it's that tame  But literally every 2nd ride or 2 in 3 are motion simulators ready to make you sick and not thrill you at all Really really disappointed so far

Great time at Universal Studios. The waits can be long, but I believe in not waiting over an hour for any ride. Arrived at one which was a 90 minute plus wait. Instead went and explored other parts of the theme park and then went back and stood for an hour, which in the end did not feel that long. I did not find things to be as overpriced as it could of been. My favorite part of all Disney theme parks is the night life with the lights etc...

My family visited Universal Orlando on January 1 and had a fantastic time! Yes, it is expensive, especially if you buy the fast passes, but it is worth the extra investment to skip the lines and be able to ride anything you want all day over and over with little to no wait. Two days earlier we visited Disney’s Hollywood Studios which was overcrowded and miserable...their fast pass system is a joke...we only got to ride 3 rides all day (and their rides are not good...our kids thought they were boring). We’ll never go to a Disney park again. Pay the extra and go to Universal...the rides are amazing, worth the extra cost, and the crowds aren’t nearly as bad as Disney!

We had a good time. Yes, it's very expensive and some things, like the meals in some of the restaurants, are ridiculously awful for what they charge. Stuff like that I've come to expect out of places like this. On the positive is that the people that make the place work were really very pleasant and helpful. The shows and the decorations for the Christmas holiday were wonderful! My biggest disappointment is how accommodating this venue is to smokers. They have a surprisingly huge number of designated smoking areas. It didn't seem like they discourage or enforce violation of no smoking rules, anywhere on the property! That was really shocking. Even in the areas that are more geared to young children, we saw people walking around smoking cigarettes. We pointed out a couple that were walking along, both smoking to a park security guard and she seemed hesitant to approach them. If Universal doesn't want to join the majority of businesses that have banned smoking, they should at least make it more difficult by forcing the smokers to go away from the non smokers! It was really disgusting!

My reaction was just to keep thinking how expensive it was. I was kind of in shock after paying for the tickets. Everything was very expensive inside the park but not any more so than any other amusement park I've been in. The tickets though (it was like $600 for our family of four; two adults and two kids) just felt so shockingly high. It's party my fault- we did it a little on the spur of the moment and I think I didn't consider just how much the tickets would be.  As for the experience, my 9yo daughter is into Harry Potter and really liked it. We just did the one-park experience because I didn't want to have to mortgage the house in order to do both. I have to say I was impressed with the Escape from Gringotts and the Diagon Alley visit overall. We got there early so the line was like 45 min. to do Escape from Gringotts and we spent probably like another hour or two bouncing around there. Unique and definitely nice for HP fans. It is a unique ride.  After that, we did the Minions ride, which was like just short of 2 hrs. So our day was two rides after getting through that (we left early at 3- just because we needed to get to our next location). Minions was neat but it wasn't like a 2 hr wait neat.  I enjoyed it but there's no way I would have coughed up that amount of money for something like that- except that it's a unique HP experience and my daughter and I have really been doing a lot of those.  My 3 year old son got scared of the dragon in Diagon Alley and had to leave the Alley.  Bitterbeer is good for like 2 sips and then the sweetness overwhelms you.  You should be prepared to drop another almost $60 for the wand because when you get there all the kids are doing to be doing it (there's a lot of stations where they can use it to make neat things happen).  I think I'm still in shock over the price. Nice little day out but not sure it's worth the cost- I'm not sure there are many 1-day travel experiences on earth that are worth that actually. But it was a nice day out.

Spent the whole day at Universal Studios park, really nice park I expected to pay high prices for drinks food etc but what I think let’s the park down is the extra charging to use both parks. I really don’t see the point to charge almost double to use 2 parks instead of 1. What Universal have done is basically split 1 park into 2. They have 1 fast rollercoaster in each park along with a few other rides. I paid $119 each or it was £194 for both parks. I don’t think it’s fair to make people pay the extra $75 each to use both parks, the Universal in LA is a much better park.  Overall nice day out but not as good a the park in LA.

Visited Universal for two days and decided to get the park-to-park tickets. Highly recommended being able to move between the two, especially for the Hogwarts Express.  There’s a lot of things that are great about Universal studios. A great variety of rides for all ages - but you also have to be ready to do A LOT of waiting.  *Of course I’ll say something about the Hagrid ride... we arrived extra early to try and beat the line. By the time we were let in at 9am, the line was already 6 hours long. I understand it’s popular and there will be lots of people waiting - but surely it would make more sense to have visitors grab a ticket at the entrance of the ride, to come back at a later allocated time, rather than them stand in line for 6 hours.  Universal - you can and you should think of a better way to deal with this. If the choice is between standing for 6 hours or missing out entirely, you’ll probably have to stop saying you pride yourselves on exceptional service.

We love coming here as a family. Ages 9-61 had a great time making memories. The price is a little steep for both parks, especially since you have to pay for parking her day. All employees that we came into contact with were very kind!

This was our second visit to this park and it didn’t disappoint it’s wonderful for all age there’s something for every one and wizarding world of Harry Potter was fantastic. Last time we came my two older kids got on all the rides and my twins weren’t quite old enough to go on every thing so we came back and they went on every thing we had a wonderful time all of us . Definitely worth every penny loved it had a great time with the family. Sad to come home. Even the restaurants are fun . Would recommend to all . Love universal x
Lovely over crimbo, get there early to get on rides, very busy but went more to experience Christmas as been before, glad we did

If your are going to universal on Christmas break DO NOT waste your money on park to park train. I bought 7 passes to ride the train park to park and it was so crowded we were not allowed on train. We were told to walk to 2nd park. It’s upsetting because it was basically money I gave away. My family was at the park on December 26, 2019. We tried getting on train around 9pm. Big disappointment.,

Everything that Disney isn't. The rides are great and uptodate and use CGI brilliantly. Harry Potter rides are fantastic but something needs to be done with the wait times, 5 hours for the Haggrid ride. Costs a lot to enter so why wait 5 hours for 1 ride. Pathetic. Single rider is the best and quickest way to get on rides if it is available.

We enjoyed visiting Universal Studios since it was a long time since we were there. We thoroughly enjoyed the Indiana Jones show. We don't do thrill rides so a lot of things we didn't participate in. The weather was nice and October was the ideal month to visit the parks since they were not crowded as other months tend to be. I was in a wheelchair and the staff was very good at accommodating us.

We enjoyed our visit to universal studios! We got an early entry and a multi day pass park for new years day. It was to avoid crowds and lines. It was absolutely the right decision. We lined up at 7:30 am, park gates opened at 8 am. We did fast furious which was ok, enjoyed transformers and met bumblebee. We loved mummy ride which is very scary. Despicable me and shrek these are all virtual reality rides. The Christmas tree was beautiful. There are so many shows to watch blues bro, marylin and her singers as well as characters from betty boop, simpsons, back to the future. We enjoyed the mib ride where its more interactive and simpsons ride as well. There is the Macy's parade which is a must do where all the characters can be seen on giant floats. The night show with fireworks and cinematic water experience is very cool. We did all the harry potter rides and got it out of the way. Diagon alley is absolutely fabulous place to visit in the evening and we did dinner at leaky cauldron. Try hot and frozen butter beer and the green ale. We gringots ride and It was our fav ride, they have done a fantastic job with the bank, dragon and the virtual ride. The dragon breathes fire so definitely get a good shot. We went into the single rider line, there was already a 100 min wait. We did that in about 40 min. The single rider line splits your party, its more for families with older kids. My son does not mind riding alone and he waits for us at the end of the ride, or we send him after my husband or I go on the ride, so there is always an adult waiting at the end. It definitely saves hours in waiting and lets us go on rides we like. we took king cross hogwarts train over using our multi day park pass which you need to park hop and do this ride. It was a train ride with images of hogwarts and London in your window. This train ride can have insanely long waits so plan accordingly. It also has different images back and forth to the parks. The train actually takes you to the other park. You arrive at islands of adventure.

Way better than Disney even w/ younger kids! But it is the most expensive park I’ve ever been to. They get us for twice as much money as Disney, but I didn’t feel bad about paying for it. Unless you are a big Harry Potter fan skip the wands... they were a letdown.

We arrived at universal at 4pm on New Year's Day. It took us over and hour to buy tickets although I'd already purchased them using our corporate discount. My young adult children and I packed it in and got on every ride we wanted to before the park closed at 10pm, including Harry Potter. My only complaint is the ticket cost. Over $700 for three people (1 two day pass and 2 one day passes), is not very family friendly. I had never experienced a virtual reality ride, so that was a new a fun experience.
This is a best theme park in Orlando. I love the Harry Potter Wizarding world, me and my family love Harry Potter. Thank you universal studios

Went here with as a family of 2 adults and 2 teenage girls. One word to describe this 2 park attractions is brilliant. Wizarding world of Harry Potter to islands of adventure to city walk. Have been here a few times before. This is definitely the best it has been. Great for kids of all ages ( includes dads ) . 5star.

Universal studios Harry Potter world was fantastic! The only down fall was Hagrid’s motorbike ride had a 3 hour queue at 9.15am! And through the day, the lowest queue time for this was 1h 30 so we didn’t manage to get on it.  There were lots of virtual 3D & 4D rides / shows which is great for those who don’t like roller coasters.  We didn’t have time to do both islands of adventure and universal studios so did have return for a 2nd day.

My wife and I recently took our daughters, buying park hopper passes for just over $1,000 (Dec 29). The parks were insanely busy. The line for the newest Harry Potter ride inside Islands of Adventure was 5 hours long. I kid you not! We didn't spring for the Fast Pass (another $1,500+) but managed to avoid the long lines by joining the Single Rider lines; our kids are aged 15, 17 and 20. The Harry Potter areas are pretty amazing. Both parks are great, but I strongly suggest trying to find a date when the park is less busy.

If it weren't for Transformers and the Mummy ride, we could have completely skipped Universal altogether. Race thru New York will make anyone nauseous to the point they do not want to ride anything else after. I enjoyed Rip Ride Rock-It, but again, more rides would make this park better.

Thought this vacation was going to be for the kids but I had just as much fun as they did. We did both parks in one day but really should have spent two days here. Staff were fantastic and it was fun to walk through Harry Potter, the Simpsons, Jurassic Park etc.  The photopass at universal is not as good as Disney but still worth it. Wish the resolution of the photos was better.  It would be nice to see a wrist band system for rides and photos at universal instead of the tickets /cards.

I read so many websites and watched so many videos about how to optimize your visit to Universal Studios Orlando. But the 2 main advices I will remember are: 1) arrive as early as possible if you can and 2) start your "Harry Potter pilgrimage" by Universal Studios (not from Island of Adventures).  We booked a 3 days + 2 nights package (I'll review the Endless Summer hotel separately but it was really nice, in a nutshell). On the first day, we went straight to Diagon Alley (the Harry Potter part). The annoying thing is that you have to first go through the "City Walk" (which is just a big mall with lots of overpriced restaurants) then cross the entire Studio park to finally reach the Harry Potter world. In a way, that's the price to "pay" but once you are there, fans will be *delighted*.  In Diagon Alley, everything is nearly identical to the books (and the movies - but kids preferred the books). The houses, the shops, the front of shops (the ones you can't go in), the restaurants, the Butter Beer, the Gringotts bank, calling the Ministry of Magic, the night bus, ... Kids were really, really happy!  Of course, you have long queues to some attractions. But if you download the Universal Studios app before, it will tell you how much time you have to wait even before you move there.  Buying the interactive wands is a must for kids - they cost a lot ($50) but provides magic to kids in many places (in the park).  Take the Hogwart Express, go to the other park (you directly reach Hogsmeade) - but come back to Universal Studios, that's the best part of the 2 parks.

Terrible service from universal studios. We waited for 3 1/2 hours. they told us the ride was not working properly about 22 minutes into the line. They would not give us tickets if we left the line for 3 1/2 hours. Universal Should think of the small children, wheel chairs etc before the made us wait for so many hours. Bad service.

Our big family Christmas gift this year was a trip to Universal (we typically cruise the week before or the week after Christmas but decided on Universal this year). We left the day after Christmas and drive down from NC, we opted to stay at a Universal onsite hotel for the early park admission and transportation perks. We have done Universal (and Disney in the past at different times during year and knew from experience it would be crowded). Our main goal was to visit Harry Potter World as it has been a couple of years since we were there, hands down the early park admission is well worth the price of staying onsite. We stayed at Cabana Bay Resort and I booked several months ago (August 2019) so did get a decent price ($254 a night for a standard 2 queen bed regular room) for the 3 of us (2 adults and a teen). Also, we were there for 4 days and once we parked the car at the hotel, we did not drive again until the day we left to drive home, so very, very nice to not have to drive anywhere (or look for a parking place)...  We had the choice of hotel bus (only our hotel straight to park so no other shuttle stops and we were there in minutes) which ran continually from 6:00 AM to past midnight everyday (never waited going from hotel or from park). We could also walk next door to the Blue Sapphire hotel (another Universal onsite hotel) and use the water taxi straight to the parks for hotel guests only. Early admission for this time of year was 7:00 - 8:00 AM with the parks opening to public at 8:00. We caught the hotel bus at 6:30 and it drops you off right at the City Walk section (you do have to go through security of course first) and they let us go right into the parks. We headed for Island of Adventure over to the HP World area (preplan where you want to start), got right in line for whatever attraction was open early that day (it changes from day to day in HP World) and got right on ride within minutes. HUGE time saver as once the gates open to the public your lines get exponentially long VERY quickly.  HP World did not disappoint and we were very satisfied (and grateful) with the early park admission (have to get up early but with hotel so close to park and so easy to transport back and forth, we would go back to hotel for lunch and a nap about 1:00 pm and then return to parks around 5:00 PM when everyone was eating dinner) until after fireworks. We had a great time and quality family time for sure!!!  2 recommendations that will surely help with time management in the parks with the crowds;  Stay onsite if possible, the early park admission is priceless when it comes to crowds and lines and second, "single rider line", go for it, beats express line almost every time hands down.  The single rider line is the way to go (very quick access to the rides) and enables you to spend way less time in the lines and do more rides/attractions for the best time management. (we had 2 day, park to park tickets so we could ride the Hogwarts train between the 2 parks). If you are staying at onsite hotel it is very easy to go back to the hotel for a break after the first 5 or 6 hours in the park! Have fun!!!

The park was packed, which we were expecting since it was the Christmas holidays. We paid $1265.00 for 3 of us for a 1 day 2-park with Express pass tickets. 🤷‍♂️ We didn't spend a lot of time researching what it might cost for the day but that was certainly double or more than we were expecting. We purchased our tickets at the Marriot hotel where we were staying, the employee there told us we'd walk right onto the rides with no wait with the express pass. That was not the case.  We enjoyed most of the rides and the express pass did seem to cut down wait times a little. It took 1 hr instead of 2 hrs to get through The Minions ride, most others were under an hour but not by much. The wait times were a little more than our 7 year old could take but he pushed through it. The Mummy ride was one of our favorites and we happened to jump in right after it reopened from an outage and got seated in 25 minutes. The 3D simulator rides were surprisingly realistic but less thrilling than rollercoaster type rides.  We definitely agree with some other reviewers regarding the staff, especially in the cafe. Most were socializing and only a few ready to get your food out. Lunch was $67 for 3 fried chicken plates and 2 drinks. Most other employees on the rides themselves were friendly and upbeat.  We spent the rest of our days at the hotel pool, which was much more relaxing and enjoyable for everyone.  Wishing this was a positive review but we did not see the value for what we spent. This may be comparable to what other parks charge but if I'm going to spend this kind of money on a vacation, it will be at a resort where I'm waited on hand and foot.

If you go to Universal Studios on a VIP tour, I highly recommend requesting DJ for your guide. He is full of knowledge and very entertaining. He reminds of famous radio legend Casey Casum. The VIP tour was definitely worth it.
This is for young and old!! Really cool especially the Harry Potter part. Enough to eat, to see and to enjoy

Much less crowded than Epcot, but Universal lacks the Disney magic. Every ride was a stomach churner for those who suffer motion sickness, so we were left with not much to do except that we absolutely adored the Harry Potter Diagon Alley. It was so much fun to see everyone running around in their black robes, waving wands and casting spells. The dragon sitting atop the tower breathes fire every so often, which was great. And they sell butterbeer! It was also fun to see groups of Universal Studio characters--the Simpsons, Scoobie Doo and his gang, and others. The Men In Black ride was lots of fun (although it triggered nausea) and I assume the rest of the rides were also fun. Try this park if you can't face the crowds at Epcot.

We enjoyed staying at Portofino Bay. Wonderful Hotel, but also enjoyed the Express Pass that went with it. We were able to skip so many very long lines. There are a lot of 3D and Simulators. But they are enjoyable. The detail that is put into the environment is probably my favorite part. it's like walking into the movies. Highly recommend.

My family LOVED Volcano Bay. Loved. Everyone had such an amazing time, there were activities for all of us (5 people). My thrill seekers loved the drop water slides, while my oldest and I found our happy place with the water coaster and wave pool. The staff were helpful and pleasant, particularly Carl. We met Carl our first day assisting with lockers, and again another day offering help to those who needed it. When we booked our trip going to Volcano Bay was not high on our priority list, as it felt like an unneeded bonus to Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure. It quickly became a favorite and was our first stop Christmas morning! Highly recommend for anyone one the fence about going to Volcano Bay...do it!!! PS We had no little ones (9 was our youngest) but it seemed there was plenty for them to do. Yes there were rides that catered to older kids and up but the area for the littles looked fun. I’m sure if our kids were younger they would have still enjoyed Volcano Bay.

I enjoy Universal Studios very much and knew that the lines would be bad the week of Christmas, so we splurged for VIP tours. We had 9 in our family and had to break into 2 groups or we would have been charged for a private tour. We had DJ as our tour guide and he took us to the front of the line on lots of rides in both parks. He told us some interesting things and took us on the quick "backlot" route between the parks. We didn't get to see anything about how rides worked(the other family group did). DJ did help our group get on Hagrid's ride at the end of our tour as it started to rain! Our tour included breakfast but we only had 10 min. to eat because we didn't know how much time it would take to park & get checked in(allow an hour). It also included a fabulous lunch. My only complaint is that my husband, who is a big & tall guy, fits on every ride at Disney and almost nothing at Universal. I know the ride engineers have to design seats for all body sizes but I would like to see a "bigger" seat put in so they can ride too.

We had an amazing time last week at Universal Studios. With the exception of a few rides, we were able to do everything we wanted while there. My family had five day tickets for all three parks. We did not purchase the express pass for our visit; we contemplated doing it for at least one day but mainly relied on the Universal app for wait times. Ride times varied, we had to check the app often but it was worth it. We also utilized the single-rider lines for shorter wait times. Our only complaint - the Fast and the Furious ride was a disappointment. It was confusing, short and very lackluster. If it’s a must do for your visit - by all means go for it. My family enjoyed all of the holiday decorations and the parade. Our Warm Christmas was a success - and we look forward to hopefully doing it again.
The parks are smaller than Disney Parks, but there is just as much fun. Lots of things and rides to see and do. Highly recommend.

We stopped for one day and got the park hopper ticket to get as much as we could out of it. It was holiday break and a day before new year's eve so we knew it would be crowded. We only got in about 6 rides due to lines, was still good but I thin I would only buy a single park ticket in the future.
Great adventure by the family. Family friendly and fun place to visit. Love the settings and the ease of going around.

We had 3 day 3 park tickets. We didn't go to Volcano Bay, so that gave us extra time at the other two parks. We mainly spent a lot of time in Harry Potter areas. I didn't go on that many rides, but my daughter and her friend went on most of them. They avoided the Hulk one though. I went on the Jurassic Park ride and nearly had heart attack!! The light show at night was magical. It repeats every hour after sunset, so if you missed one you can wait for the next one. We thoroughly enjoyed it. The newest ride was either had a long que or closed every time we tried. We ate at the Leaky Cauldron and Mythos. the girls purchased multi day Halloween Horror night tickets and went 3 nights. They said it waas fantastic.

My grandsons really enjoy Fear Factor. They came last year (2018) and loved it and it was their favorite activity again this year in 2019. When we came last year your employee, Joey, took a special interest in them and we took pictures with him. This year he asked the boys to stay afterwards and he offered to give them a tour. It absolutely made our day. Joey is one wonderful employee!!
universa; [s a grat park for familys that love thrill ride and dr suess land is a wonderful place the only drawback is it is pricey if you have a large family start saveing now it is worth it.

Visited with my family including 2 kids aged 10 and 5yr old gals. We booked for 2days-2park entry. We chose the universal studio and Universal Islands of Adventure. While booking, we contemplated buying the express pass. In hindsight- it was a mixed decision. Our family was not crazy about the roller coasters but we focused on the 3D/4d Let me share some valuable details 1. Choose your hotel wisely depending on the number of days. The hotels inside universal come with express entry. It may work out cheaper if you do that. We had not done enough research and booked a hotel on International drive that was 10 min by Uber. We bought the 2 days 2 park pass which also gives you access to the Hogwarts express train between Universal studio and Islands of Adventure. 2. We did not purchase the express entry as we used that day to get acclimatized with the 2 parks. We were there at 8am sharp which was the park opening time. If you stay at any of the universal hotels, you get entry 1hr before the rest of the public. Here are some of our experiences with the rides and 3D/4d experiences 3. Download the Universal app and use that for the map and choose the rides which you want to do. Add them to your favorites list in the app. The app also shows options for food. 4. Food, beverages and snacks are expensive. Even Starbucks inside is more expensive. We brought 2 back packs and carried beverages and snacks and it’s allowed to be brought in. 5. Bring your own lanyards from outside as the ones in the parks cost 12 dollars each. You get to buy lanyards outside at 3 dollars or less each. The lanyards can be used for the express passes as these are required to be scanned at all the rides. 5. We bought the express pass with single entry as we wanted to do all the rides only once. The unlimited entry universal pass is only good if you like to repeat the rides. 6. We rented the large stroller for 2 days. Each day you have to rent it separately as both our gals get tired walking very fast. So it was definitely worth the 28 dollars for each day. Single strollers are 18 dollars each day. 7. Photo packages are not worth it according to me. Click your own with your phone/camera with characters around the Park. There are Universal staff who click your pics for free for the characters. 8. Express entry prices vary each day. If you are going during school holidays, you will need them.  In universal studios using the express pass we did: 1. Harry Potter and escape from Gringotts( one of the best experiences). My 5yr old was not allowed. so we used Child swap which is amazing thing because my wife and 5yr old waited next to the ride while I did it with my 10yr old.once we finished, my wife did it immediately. It’s a great feature. Excellent and do not miss. 2. ET( only good for kids below 7-8). Very low on thrills for the rest 3. Transformers : good fun for all ages. 4. Men in black: good fun as you get to shoot at aliens. Good for all ages. 5. Jimmy Fallon: good experiences for all for the race through New York. Don’t miss. 6. Shrek : good for small kids. Boring for some adults and my 10yrd old also found it less exciting. 7. Minion: good for all ages. 8. Woody woodpecker roller coaster: okay for all ages.
